name: 1976 Ketch Baarda Zeegrundel1976 Ketch Baarda Zeegrundel
description:
General: The Zeegrundel was originally designed around 1968 and shows similarities with the Zeeschouw. The design deliberately deviated from the traditional flat bottoms in order to create a number of improvements. Designer Baarda has further developed the Sipman models, and the larger Baarda Zeegrundel's were given a much more spacious interior. This Baarda Zeegrundel has bilge keels instead of swords, a spacious center cockpit with benches which can be covered with a cockpit tent. The powerful Indenor 40hp diesel engine is reached through a hatch in the cockpit floor. Central in the cockpit is the steering position with steering wheel and sloop compass. The mainmast, mizzenmast and spars have recently been repainted. The main boom can be lowered with a hand winch and trestle. Traps are secured on the nail bank near the mast and the jib sheets are operated with the winches on the cockpit edge. Furthermore, a varnished wooden boat pole, pick hook, removable swimming ladder and gangway are part of the equipment. Thanks to the limited draft, the Zeegrundel has a large sailing area. Without rigging, the Zeegrundel can also be sailed as a motorboat, to make trips through the interior.
Interior: The cabin has a dinette with comfortable sofas that can be converted into a double bed by lowering the table. Headroom is good with approx. 1.90m. In the open forecastle is another spacious bed, with cupboard space underneath. The wet cell has a pump toilet. Next to the cabin entrance to starboard is a galley, with sink and cold running water. There is a possibility to place a stove on alcohol or gas on the worktop. There is a gas well with drain, but it is not currently in use. The 12V cool box is placed under the cockpit seat. The aft cabin has its own entrance through a door with sliding hatch in the cockpit. Here is a large bed and a small cot, the latter of which is now used for storage. Headroom is limited with approx. 1.45m. In the aft cabin is also an inspection shaft, which gives access to the propeller, allowing inspection of the propeller in the water. There is an extensive manual of the Baarda Zeegrundel, which has been compiled by the current owner, with all parts of the boat and information regarding maintenance.Mehr anzeigen

name: 1979 Dufour 28001979 Dufour 2800
description:
Selling a well-preserved and equipped sailing yacht Dufour 2800, built in 1979: 8.30 meters long, 2.95 meters wide, draft 1.60. The ship is - typically French - comfortable and stable to sail and has plenty of space for up to 2 adults and 2 children. The ship has a teak deck, a new spray hood from Wendel & Rados, a bathing ladder with teak steps, anchor with chain, compass in the cockpit, speedometer, wind gauge and echo sounder, lines are laid in the cockpit.
Mahogany interior, fold-away table for 4 people, sink, alcohol stove (no gas -:)), cool box, sanitary area with sink and large mirror, electric sea toilet, Wabasco heating. Upholstery in excellent condition in the bow berth and the berths in the saloon. Headroom: 1.85 meters.
Technology: Simrad radio with AIS (reception), weather box, radio, autopilot. The engine is an original Volvo Senta MD7a (diesel, 13 hp) and runs like a VW Beetle. He has never let us down on 12 tours across the Channel to and from Berlin via Stettin and the Lagoon to the Baltic Sea. In winter he had another service at Wendel & Rados with a change of engine and transmission oil, a new oil filter, a new fuel filter, installation of a new V-belt and checking the seals. The stuffing box has just been renewed. When the ship was pulled out of the water, there were almost no shells or similar on the underwater hull. "The antifouling works great," said the expert.
The paint is from Peter Wrede!! Due to the fenders it is a bit worn in some places, there are also some scratches. After a professional polish at Wrede in Greifswald almost everything would disappear and the boat would shine even more. Since the polish at Wrede (preferably in winter storage) should cost around 1000 euros, I discount 700 euros for it and sell the ship for a fixed price of 9200 euros.Show more

name: 2010 Custom Van Der Graaf BV Schooner2010 Custom Van Der Graaf BV Schooner
description:
Price On Application
 
The current ATLANTIC is the replica of legendary ATLANTIC which was commissioned by New York Yacht Club member Wilson Marshall, Atlantic and which was launched in 1903.After owning, restoring, rebuilding or recreating a number of famous yachts such as Thendara, Aile Blanche, Borkumriff, Zaca a te Moana and most recently the Herreshoffracing schooner Eleonora, Dutch yachtsman Ed Kastelein planned his ultimate masterpiece: the recreation of the 3-mast schooner Atlantic. Over three years of technical and historical research resulted in sufficiently detailed plans and information to enable a highly accurate and authentic recreation.Having set a new standard with his creation of Eleonora, Ed Kastelein built on his vast experience and has once again constructed a yacht that no-one thought would ever sail again. The project was certainly his most ambitious; with her length over deck of 185 feet (56 metres) she is the largest classic racing schooner ever to be recreated. Ed Kastelein was determined for her to be the way she was when she wrote history in 1905, her original lines were honoured to the finest detail and her sail plan is identical to that of her victorious 1905 Transatlantic Race which made her immortal in yachting history. Above all, she is again breathtakingly beautiful, turning heads wherever the wind takes her.Atlantic's dimensions are simply incredible; over deck she measures a remarkable 56 meters. Her graceful sheer line and long overhangs accentuate her grace while her waterline length of 42 meters and narrow beam are a promise of unmatched speed under sail. Her spars tower some 45 meters above the waterline and support a staggering area of 1,750 m² of sail, more than two and a half times that of the already awesome J-Class yachts.Mehr anzeigen

name: 1990 Custom Aegean Builders SA Poseidon 1231990 Custom Aegean Builders SA Poseidon 123
description:
ARIADNE, a 37.49m sailing yacht built in Greece and delivered in 1990, is the flagship of Aegean Builders. She is the only Poseidon 123 model. The exterior design of this luxury vessel is the work of Antonis Ploutis, who also completed the naval architecture. The yacht was refitted in 2001; in 2010 the owner took the boat to a shipyard in Tuscany to make a further refit, then he dismantled trees, furnishings and accessories with the intention of rebuilding them in a more modern version. The owner was unable to complete his project, so the boat is now looking for an owner who wants to restore her to the splendor of her when she was designed. We estimate that the cost for the total refitting can be around € 1,200,000 / 1,500,000, but this amount is only indicative because it varies according to the owner's needs.

name: 1910 Tweemast Charter Zeeklipper 22 pass 1910 Tweemast Charter Zeeklipper 22 pass
description:
The Skylge is a beautifully built two-masted clipper that came into service in 1910 as a sailing freighter. She was built under Lloyds class for the Wad and Sound shipping. In 1986 the ship was converted into a charter ship. The ship has spacious guest rooms with newly fitted sanitary facilities. There is room for 22 hotel guests or 35 day guests. The ship has the ideal dimensions to sail the Western Baltic Sea, but she also comes into her own in the German Wadden Sea. The ship also has a neat crew quarters in the aft cabin and a cabin for the mate in the forecastle. In 2011/2012 the engine room was completely packed and, among other things, a new engine was installed (cost approx. 120,000 Euro). A good ship with many possibilities. It can be supplied with new certificates for an additional charge. Full information about this ship can be found at www.doevemakelaar.nl or if you want to view the complete information about this ship by clicking here.

description:
Glorious II is a true luxury ketch motorsailer was built by Mirror Shipyard in Fethiye/Turkey in 2011 and her beautiful interiors and exterior designed by Esen Yacht. She can host up to 8 guest in 4 cabins including a master suite, 2 x VIP stateroom and 1 x Twin ensuite cabin. As well as there is also crew accomodation for 6 aboard. 
The boat has undergone a major refit last year in 2019 and the owners have invested almost €1 million in her repairs, replacement and upgrades. Her Commercial Rina Classification has also been renewed this year so that the boat can optionally be operated in VIP charter or can either be used privately. 
EU Vat for Malta is also paid. 
Definitely a must-see boat to be appreciated. Currently available for pre-inspections in southern Turkey by advanced booking prior to your visit.

name: 2000 Multiplast Maxi Catamaran2000 Multiplast Maxi Catamaran
description:
OCEAN PEARL is the ex Club Mediterrannée winner of the Race in 2001 (around the world regatta) with New Zealand skipper Grant Dalton. She had a fantastic track of records and prize list before she undergone similarly to her sistership ex Swift, a complete refit and conversion project into a fantastic maxi cruiser catamaran with light and comfortable accommodation for fast crossing and blue waters cruising. 
The conversion has been done choosing high quality equipment and taking a special care to keep the weight as close as possible as original when she was meant to race around the world. The result is that only 3 more tons have been added although OCEAN PEARL is now incomparably more easy to sail and comfortable to live aboard.
One of the of the major achievement of OCEAN PEARL is that she has successfully been converted from being one of the best performing racing machine in the world to the fastest sailing cruising catamaran ever.Mehr anzeigen

name: 1968 C & L Cantiere Craglietto1968 C & L Cantiere Craglietto
description:
ailing yacht TELSTAR VI is a classically designed, auxiliary ketch with the character and style of the 1960’s with the luxurious comfort, amenities and advantages of a modern yacht. Her strength and long range will provide endless enjoyment for local and world cruising.
TELSTAR VI is a 29m ketch designed in 1967 by renowned naval architect Alan Buchanan and built in Italy by Cantiere Craglietto Yard no. 62. Her keel was laid in 1967 and she was completed in 1968. 
“TELSTAR VI is the chronology of the ownership, custody or location of a historical object. The term was originally mostly used in relation to works of art, used in similar senses in a wide range of fields, including archaeology and manuscripts”
TELSTAR VI is carvel built of mahogany and oak. She underwent a substantial refit in Malta from 2012 to 2019 where she was completely stripped out, partly replanked, beams and floor replaced with laminated beams, re fastened and sheathed with epoxy. The extensive refit enables MCA coding.
 Mehr anzeigen

name: 1992 Jongert 25S1992 Jongert 25S
offerer: HAAS INTERNATIONAL - The Sailing Yacht Broker
description:
The Jongert 25s COLOMBAIO is a perfect example of a semi-custom-built ketch by the famous Jongert Shipyard with an interior design by Peter Sijm.  
The classic 25 series is one of the most successful designs of the Dutch shipyard. With her superior build quality and high safety margins used throughout the design, COLOMBAIO is able to travel the world through all seas and weather in highest comfort. 
Sisterships of COLOMBAIO have sailed more than 300’000 NM and still continue to delight owner, guests and crew. Her sail plan and effortless handling systems makes her easy to sail for a small crew.
Distinctive handcrafted elements are to be found throughout the entire yacht, from the beautiful wooden figurehead at the front, all the way to the characteristic fitted windows at the rear.
The deck plan offers plenty of space for sunbathing.  The well-protected sitting area behind the wheelhouse is perfect for al-fresco dining. The aft platform hosts conveniently the dinghy during navigation and offers easy access to the water with a solid manual lowerable boarding ladder.
Under deck, the voluminous hull offers ample space for a full beam owner’s cabin aft and two equal guests cabins adjacent, each with en-suite bathrooms. 
Amidship, COLOMBAIO features a full beam lower saloon with large windows and portholes and a well-liked bar.
Separated in the forward section is the crew area with large, functional galley and opposite a crew dinette. Forward are two crew cabins, each also with en-suite bathrooms. 
The engine room is very spacious and designed for easy access and proper maintenance. The engine room is very spacious and designed for easy access and proper maintenance. Under engine she has a maximum cruising range of 2000 Nm @ 9 kn. 
KEY FEATURES:

Classic world-cruising ketch with good sailing performance for fast ocean passages 
Always privately used
Excellent finish, built to the highest standards, with many tried-and-tested features that have proven their reliability over decades
Perfectly crafted joinery and general impression of high-quality 
Large volume and great layout that enhances privacy on board, ideal for long stays on board.

Last works on COLOMBAIO:
2019:                         
- New Genoa
- New 12Kw generator Fischer Panda
Summer 2021:      
- New antifouling
- New hull and superstructure paint
- All service batteries renewed
- Deckhouse varnished (8 coats Epifanes PP, 2 coats Epifanes extra UV)
- 1 new LOFRANS anchor winch, 3500W – 24V
 
COLOMBAIO is in need of a new teak deck, a complete service on all her systems, equipment and rigging, as well as new sails, hence her attractive price. 
She’s a perfect choice for a family looking for a very comfortable and safe bluewater cruiser with a first-class pedigree and lasting value. Mehr anzeigen

name: 2001 CNB 93 SAVARONA2001 CNB 93 SAVARONA
description:
SAVARONA, a performance world cruiser, was designed by naval architect Philippe Cabon and Frank Darnet (interior) and custom built in aluminum, by the French yard Construction Navale Bordeaux.      
SAVARONA has been on a proper refit schedule since new.   Her first in 2006, the second in 2010, and the major refit completed in 2015 when hauled at the Gino Yard in Marmaris, Turkey. Shortly before, in August 2014, she had been hauled in Palm Beach f28 or a hull survey and inspection by Patton Marine, one of the best marine survey companies in the world.  
SAVARONA has now completed an extensive refit, done by an experienced owner who is unable to do something “good enough”, it has to be done the right way. His project manager, also a marine surveyor himself, was on site for the entire project. The result is an absolutely stunning yacht that is better than new, with $1.5M invested.   Not only was SAVARONA fully repainted, mast-boom-hull-superstructure, but also new 16 mm Burma teak decks and caprail was laid, with new teak added to the coachroof well. Deck hardware is all new black anodized Lewmar, interior varnishing and refurbishing with high quality fabrics, but the real story is under the floorboards and behind the cabinetry. Virtually every system has been serviced/replaced or modified, so that her planned charter activity would not have any interruptions. Her new owner has the choice of using her as a private yacht or continue with the charter operation, complete with web site.   
Her twin cockpit layout is perfect for guests and crew. The center cockpit area has a rounded settee with a good size table for dining, which was just custom designed and built with an ice bucket and wired Bluetooth linked to the yacht’s stereo system. The aft steering/crew cockpit, also has comfortable rounded seating area, with steering and navigation completely separate. And as the owner needs to run his business while cruising, she has full Internet connectivity and communication from anywhere in the world.
SAVARONA had a beautiful Atlantic crossing in 2017.  She sailed 4,009 miles with an average speed of 9.2 knots (her owner now has over 8,000 miles on board her).
SAVARONA has just undergone her 3rd major refit in 2021 in preparation for a long-term program and her trade registration (RIF). The standing rigging, the engine, and the boom have been changed as well as many systems completely overhauled. Improvements have been made to increase comfort and reliability.Mehr anzeigen

name: 1985 Custom DUBOIS 921985 Custom DUBOIS 92
description: DUBOIS 92, during his life, he completely circumnavigated the globe, notably passing through Antarctica. She benefited from a serious refit in 2005 before her world cruise. She has always been kept in turnkey condition and has just completed a serious nautical makeover, including new paint on the hull and superstructure, masts and booms and complete updating of her systems. All of her electronics as well as a majority of her household appliances were replaced in April 2019. In recent seasons, she has sailed in the Mediterranean and has been maintained by the crew on board during the winter period. This gave the opportunity for many improvements and changes. Cruising yacht with an exceptional pedigree, designed with a custom design by Ed Dubois and built in Double Et Jesse in Germany. Her current owner has remained faithful to the quality and spirit of the yacht. Total reliability and safety have always been the key words during incredible adventures not only from Antarctica to Ushuaia and the Falklands, but also to Chile, the East Coast of the United States, the Caribbean and all parts of the Mediterranean. , as well as in Australia, New Zealand, Polynesia and the Indian Ocean. He is now ready for new adventures with his future owner. DOSSIER ON REQUEST, aMehr anzeigen

description: IKIGAI was recently refitted and refurbished at Vitters Shipyard in what was effectively a complete rebuild. The spacious, modern and welcoming interior is fashioned from clear varnished teak. The large master cabin and two guest cabins are situated forward. Amidships are the spacious saloon and dining room. Behind the companionway you will find, to port, the brand new high-tech navigation station, the chart table and the crew cabin; and to starboard, the galley and crew mess. The transom opens to give access to the garage where the tender is stored. Sailing Ikigai is an absolute joy: sensational to helm, she is simply fantastic upwind.Mehr anzeigen

Yacht broker Floris Vos 088-2502500Yachtbroker Floris Vos 0031 88 2502500


A unique, fantastic sailing seagoing vessel built for habitation and circumnavigation of the world. This Sailing Logger is a newly built in 2007 replica of a 19th century sailing herring Logger. The ship is suitable for long (world) trips, habitation and suitable as a charter (day trips for groups and holiday trips). It is a modern built two-mast, a very fast sailor (10 knots is no problem) and fully equipped. Due to the well thought-out keel-centerboard construction, the ship has a large sailing area. The client and current owner had as a requirement for the designer to build a modern, safe, maintenance-friendly and comfortable ship that could be easily operated by 2 men, on which he could also live. That worked. The bow thruster, anchor and sails are hydraulically operated. The super generator provides all the necessary energy. Extra attention has been paid to safety. The sea rail is extra high, there are 3 watertight bulkheads in the ship and there is no gas on board. The ship has been thoughtfully built and maintenance-friendly with 1st class materials. No teak wood was used, the ship is built of Corten steel and provided with 2-component paint. It is very comfortable on board. There is plenty of seating space on the foredeck, point, bow and aft near the steering wheel and on the transom. The deckhouse is light and spacious. There is a very extensive galley, a navigation corner and a seating area for 12 people. The view all around is great. Below deck is the spacious salon with desk, bar and sitting area. The engine room has been placed in the stern and there is room for (washing) machines. Amidships is an aisle with cabins on both sides and a shower and toilet. In the bow of the ship is a very spacious owner's cabin with private shower and toilet. The ship is little used, from 1st owner and well maintained. An absolutely unique ship. a comfortable sailing apartment. General: Sail logger, name de Hoop, dimensions: 25 x 6 x 2-4 m, year of construction 2006-2007, construction number 21.006, builder Helldörfer Scheepsbouw Arnhem, designer Peter Bosgraaf Yacht and Boat Design, S-frame, lifting keel, corten steel, displacement 64 tons, ballast lead (cast), 6 berths in 3 cabins, 2 extra in the saloon and 1 extra in separate room, headroom 2.20 m, bed lengths 2.10 m, double glazed windows in aluminum, rod steering, 2 wet cell, stainless steel guard rail, anchor winch (hydraulic), stock anchor 145 kg, 50 meters anchor chain 16mm. Rigging: Schooner rigged, vertical clearance 23.5 m, rigging Duform 12, 14 and 19 mm, mainsails 76 m2 and 77.9 m2, jib 36 m2, jib 67 m2, reefing lines, 10 winches (Anderson), 4 hydraulic winches (2SP 50ST). Engine: 2 x Perkins Saber RE30850, 2 x 87 HP, construction numbers 290112N and 290116N, year of construction 2006, only 500 engine hours, diesel consumption 8 liters/hour, hydraulic transmission, steel diesel tanks 3,000 liters, tachometer, hour meter, oil pressure gauge, temperature gauge, folding propeller ( bronze), hydraulic bow thruster (10 hours). Navigation and equipment: 5 x 12V battery, 12 x 2V batteries, shore power, inverter (Victron), generator (Kohler 9 KVA), volt/ammeter, compass, depth sounder, fishfinder, windset (Maretron, multifunctional), GPS (Maretron), VHF radio (Vertex VM 3500 E), radar (Nobeltel), AIS inland navigation. Electricity and water: Steel water tanks 4,500 litres, boilers (180 litres), 2 showers, 2 toilets, holding tank 4,500 litres, refrigerator, freezer, four burner induction cooker, oven microwave (electric), heating (hot air electric). name: 2003 Marine VPLP 772003 Marine VPLP 77
description:
A fast and light classic catamaran, built of Epoxy glass fibre and carbon structure. A safe boat capable of 300-350 miles passage per day.She is designed to give a real sailing experience while ensuring maximum comfort on board. The transverse structure and mast are of carbon fiber in order to keep her strong but light. She is easy to handle with electrical winches, twin helms and a clear view over the coach roof from the cockpit.Dining indoors and outdoors for 12.
TAJ: the legend still goes on… This amazing catamaran originally known as CORIOLAN VI, was highly seen during St Tropez regattas and other famous events: elegance, comfort & performance are guaranteed! Her new current owner has invested not less than EUR 750,000 in a major 8 months refit in 2018: 2 new engines, 2 new generators, new standing rigging, all new interior with spacious, luminous and modern accommodations, etc.TAJ has 4 guests cabins for up to 8 guests and 1 crew cabin for 2 crew members. No fly bridge for such a good-looking catamaran, but the passionate sailors will enjoy 2 aft steering positions, a nice protected cockpit, slim hulls and 2 large trampolines forward. A real ocean-going sailing catamaran for going around the world and also available for charter.Mehr anzeigen

description:
Phoenix 77 is a yacht designed by Rob Humphreys and built by Pendennis Shipyard in the UK. This tall cruiser offers high performance under sail with the comfort and luxury of a "Super Yacht". Her length of just under 25 meters allows for offshore sailing. This incredible sailing yacht had two complete refits in 2011 and 2014.
The Phoenix 77 is in excellent condition, very well equipped and ready to sail.
For more information contact Ilona on +34 653 472 988 or email ilona@yateocasion.com


Phoenix 77 is a yacht designed by Rob Humphreys and built by Pendennis Shipyard in the United Kingdom. This deep-sea cruiser offers high sailing performance along with the comfort and luxury of a "Mega Yacht". Its length, bordering on 25 meters, allows high-altitude navigation (offshore). This incredible sailboat had two complete renovations in 2011 and 2014.
The Phoenix 77 is in excellent condition, very well equipped and ready to sail.
For more information contact Ilona +34 653 472 988 or email ilona@yateocasion.com

description:
1984 TREHARD KETCH TREHARD 24M,
XBOAT ref 5123. Boat equipped with hydraulic retractable keel allowing a minimum draft of 1.90 m up to 4.30 m maximum. Absolutely exceptional condition. Boat completely redone in 2010 with a teak deck more than 2 cm thick, gray sikaflex, flat deck hatches, completely redesigned coachroof, carbon sun protection with guide for the running backstays, the three main cabins and the galley have been completely redone in 2010, including insulation, solid mahogany only, alcantara linings. Expertise of the aluminum thicknesses available and without corrosion thanks to the low voltage protection system of the hull. Impeccable and exceptional boat whose cost of improvements greatly exceeds the selling price of the boat. Boat having recently changed from Spanish flag to Polish flag. VAT paid. name: 1994 IBRAHIM AKBAS BODRUM CAIQUE TURQUE1994 IBRAHIM AKBAS BODRUM CAIQUE TURQUE
description:
1994 IBRAHIM AKBAS BODRUM CAIQUE TURKISH,
XBOAT ref 2815. Boat finished built in 1997 at the AKBAS shipyard renowned for its quality, the shipowner participated in several ''Bodrum Cup'' won 3 then after a setback, the boat was seized and sold in 2008, has 3 brothers Carpenters of boat who reconditioned it in private installation, (4 Cabins) in order to sell it at the end of the building site in 2009 to a new owner. Decided to transform it even more, this one has the boat transported from Marmaris to Dunkirk by cargo, to enter a long period of improvement. A total refit of the electrical circuits, ''E?FFAGE'' a new engine ''PERK?NS 300cv'' (54 hours) new generator ''ONAN 27 Kwa'' (152 Hours) A hydraulic unit controlling 3 genoa furlers, the 2 sails on ''SELDEN'' masts, the windlasses, the bow thruster, the 2 davits and the tillers with autopilot on joy-stick . A satelite TV antenna, an adjustable projector headlight, a heated rotating windshield wiper, etc., etc. This for a total amount of €942,000. This consolidated her CE classification. In 2018, without ever having really sailed, she was sold to the current owner to finish the carpentry work. From December 2019 to May 2020 she underwent a total refit for an amount of more than 130,000€ in order to give it a new destiny.

Additional description:

2 new 19 and 17 meter "SELDEN" aluminum masts with hydraulic sail furlers. 3 hydraulic "HARKEN" Genoa furlers, All new sails. 2 new hydraulic "LEWMAR" windlasses with 120 meter chains and 2 new "FOG" anchors. Hydraulic bow thruster.Hydraulic bars and autopilot with Joystick. "MAX-PROP" variable pitch propeller with rope cutter.New 120litres/hour watermaker.New "PERK?NS" 300 CV engine. new. Latest generation "FURUNO" electronics, compass, depth sounder, A?S, BB 150Khz sonar, Autopilot, Navtex, Navionic Carte R-34 Med, Mini Gyro, rotating and heated windshield wipers, Safety for 12 people, Survival a Day for 12 pax, Satellite telephone. Washing machine, dishwasher, extractor hood - Fridge and Freezer - Fryer and oven. 4 beautiful cabins with shower and toilet, possibility of creating a marine cabin. Water tank: 1000 liters // Fuel tank: 4500 liters // Black tank: 500 liters French Flag Certificate C E VAT paid

description:
English "vintage" classic - schooner yacht ELLA 1935 - design Frederic Shepherd
Well-known, stylish beauty of the German classic car scene
Outstanding original condition with proven history, new rig and sails - well maintained, easy to handle and ready to sail, complete navigation and safety electronics, classic mahogany interior, skylights and portholes in all cabins, 3 modern bathrooms.

name: 1991 Scorpio 721991 Scorpio 72
description: This beautiful Bermudian ketch rigged sailing yacht designed by leading American nacal architect Robert H. Perry is an impressive and great example of Scorpio 72. She has four spacious en-suite cabins, two master cabins with queen beds aft and two twin cabins forward all equipped with modern comforts and facilities, each cabin has its own private shower, toilet and independent A/C unit. The vessel underwent a total refit during the last three winters; she is presently equipped with a 19KW Onan generator complying with the new anti-pollution norms. All A/C units have been replaced and are now independent for each cabin. The engine room was totally rebuilt and completely isolated. A new Perkins / Cat MC 300 HP engine was installed in 2020. The strong rigging and the large sail area will ensure the ultimate sailing experience. She was constructed under Bureau Veritas rules for classification at the highest class *Malta cross*1 3/3 E.PRVT - world cruiser she complies with the IMO  and SOLAS rules, she is certified merchant navy ship for passengers transport (under French regulations). Mehr anzeigen

name: 2010 CNB 772010 CNB 77
offerer: HAAS INTERNATIONAL - The Sailing Yacht Broker
description:
The CNB 77 AMAZON CREEK is a beautifully designed semi-custom CNB 77 finished to the highest possible specification for a knowledgeable owner. Solidly built in aluminium alloy by CNB Bordeaux with a carbon mast and spectra running gear, her naval architecture is by the multi award-winning naval architect Philippe Briand, and interior design by Fabrice Lefevre. 
Designed primarily as an owner's yacht for personal use, this fast blue ocean cruiser with go-anywhere capacities sleeps up to four guests in two spacious and supremely comfortable master/VIP cabins, each with roomy en-suite facilities rarely found on similar sized yachts.
Perfect for the Buyer who prizes performance but who is also looking for comfort when traveling over longer distances, she effectively has infinite range and offers the possibility of circumnavigation to the farthest corners of the globe if desired. With just very light use, AMAZON CREEK benefits from low hours on her equipment, and having been immaculately maintained by a professional crew, she looks just as good as new.
Key selling points: 

Pedigree design
Very spacious cabins for her LOA
Fast and lively under sail
High build quality aluminium/carbon construction, very weatherly and safe
Superbly maintained in better than new condition
Replacement cost of over €4m fully equipped

name: 1981 Bermuda Schooner 23 Meter1981 Bermuda Schooner 23 Meter
description:
Schooner, proven suitable as an expedition ship, charter ship and for residential use


The beautiful schooner "Abel Tasman" is derived from the famous "America 1", designed by George Steer. While "Abel Tasman" is not a replica, she has the same lines and striking grace that makes her stand out in any port. She sailed countless nautical miles around the world with her 3 owners. For her second owners, she became their home and a means of earning a comfortable living while chartering in largely remote areas of the far Arctic and Antarctic waters. The current owner continues in the same way, but including making it available for mainly documentary use. In the past 3 years she has sailed over 46,000 miles from Europe to Antarctica, across the Pacific Ocean to Australia, north to Japan via New Guinea, to the Kuril Islands, to Kamchatka, the Aluetean Islands, Alaska, Northwest Passage , Greenland, Norway and Svalbard. Almost all of these miles were chartered by movie companies and private guests, which provided a comfortable and steady income for the owner.
She has a very desirable and unique classic ship feel rather than a normal yacht. Her oversized rigging and deck equipment convey a sense of strength and safety at sea, consistent with her hull shape. The hull is constructed from 10 mm steel, making it suitable for extreme conditions. Her DAF engine and 2000 ltr. fuel tanks provide ample power and approximately 900 nautical miles of fuel range. She can carry enough food and basic necessities for 9 people for 3 months. The salon has a large U-shaped sofa and two comfortable armchairs. The galley has a large stove with oven that also serves as a heater. The saloon has an extra diesel heating system and a central heating system heats the rest of the boat. Next to the escort to starboard is a head with wardrobe for sailing equipment. There are 3 twin cabins in the bow and a twin master cabin on the port side aft. Furthermore, in the bow is a wet cell with shower and toilet. In the bow is a workspace and storage space. In the stern is the engine room, where we also find the technical installation, including generator, watermaker and a large amount of spare parts to make the boat as self-sufficient as possible. The interior is cozy, practical in design and suitable for long stays on board for a group of up to 9 people. The hesitant decision to sell Abel Tasman is due to a change in situation by the owner but she is ready to go anywhere in the world as a home or as a business or perhaps as a lifestyle where she occasionally charters can bear to help defend the costs of owning a real seagoing vessel.
From the skipper's point of view: "The "Abel Tasman" is a powerful boat to sail but easily handled by 2 experienced sailors. Her schooner rig, unlike a sloop rig, means smaller sails to handle and less loads on winches and deck gear reducing wear and tear As a skipper I often realize how suitable she would be as a training vessel Under the guidance of experienced hands she is the perfect platform to gain experience with sail handling, understanding the loads and forces involved, sometimes making small adjustments in power and speed.Her comfort at sea is often a source of wonder to people, even with many years of ocean sailing behind her.Her displacement, her sail area and ballast ratio all combine to provide a ride & feeling of security unique to this boat I can only say that the last 46,000 nm, often in the wildest circumstances imaginable present, was a pleasure".
This boat is mediated through the White Whale Yachtbrokers Enkhuizen office. If you are interested, please contact enkhuizen@wwy.nl or +31(0)228 855 380 for more information or to make an appointment for a viewing on board. Viewings are possible from Monday to Saturday.

name: 1989 Alan Pape Williams Boatyard 73 Ft Ketch1989 Alan Pape Williams Boatyard 73 Ft Ketch
description:
Classic Alan Pape Williams Boatyard 73 Ft ketch moored in Valencia, Spain


Classic design by Alan Pape, built 1977-90 - refitted in 2018 - of iroko and mahogany by the famous Williams Boatyard in Falmouth, Cornwall, UK. This top range SY represents 73 feet of pure elegany. Avrea is a classic ship built with excellent materials and a lot of workmanship. As a traditionally built wooden boat of high quality, her interior is warm in winter and cool in summer; she never has problems with damp or humidity. The building is carvel planked with 50mm Iroko on laminated 100mm Iroko frames every 300mm. The fastenings are copper rivets, and all other bolts are of stainless steel. The decks are 20mm marine ply with 20mm teak planking. The rest of the boat on deck and down below is solid Brazilian mahogany. Mast supports is galvanised steel. The keel is 8 tons of cast iron, the chain plates and all fixtures on deck are either stainless steel or bronze. Bow cabin with two beds in V-shape, followed by heads on starboard. There is a complete pantry in U-form on starboard and a cosy dinette in front of it. Further back is the enormous saloon with the main entry. The saloon has a gangway on starboard with two beds on top of each other which leads to the big owner cabin including en suite heads and a separate access to the cockpit. On mid-ship and port is the engine room with its working area. There is an invoice with V.A.T. paid on the bare hull from 1977.

name: 2009 Seaway Shipman 72, Sloop2009 Seaway Shipman 72, Sloop
description:
GEOMETRY is a stunning example of a high performance, shorthanded capable, carbon composite, family sailing yacht. Laden with top quality hardware and race-proven technology above deck, and an abundance of space and luxury below, she is a truly impressive performance sailor’s yacht, in every respect. The master stateroom offers a double berth, settee, dressing table, large wardrobe and a spacious en-suite head with wash basin and shower. The starboard and port aft staterooms, both offer convertible twin / double berths with well-appointed hanging lockers, storage and en-suite heads with wash basins and separate showers. A further double guest bed is available from the purpose designed conversion in the main saloon. The bright and spacious saloon and galley are surrounded by large windows which fill the area with natural light, giving a capacious feel to the living area. Complete with a well-appointed galley and a large 'U' shaped seating area for lounging or dining. The chart table is both well served for both space and digital communication. The Crew cabin has independent access, forward and comprises of twin bunks with heads and a shower.
Accommodation for up to 8 guests in 3 en-suite guest staterooms, including a full beam master stateroom and convertible saloon.Mehr anzeigen

description:
Model: MAXI OCEAN RACER 72 FT Type: sailing yacht LOA (m): 21,76 Beam (m): 5,31 Draft (m): 4,20 Air draft (m): 33,00 Headroom (m): 2,00 Year built: 1989 Launched: 1989 Builder: Nordhal Mabire Country: France Designer: Dumas/Mannerberg Displacement (t): 17,3 CE norm: A Hull material: carbon fibre Hull colour: white Keel type: yes Superstructure material: carbon fibre Deck material: carbon fibre Deck finish: non-skid paint Window frame: aluminium Deckhatch: yes Radar arch: Mast Fuel tank (litre): 100 stainless steel Level indicator (fuel tank): yes Blackwater tank (litre): 300 polyethylene Wheel steering: x 2 chain steering Emergency tiller: yes The CJ Legend was the first yacht in the world to sail etmal of over 400 nm. The average speed at that time was 17 knots. In 1993/94 the Maxi-yacht was rebuilt (hull, deck layout, mast, boom, keel) to make her even faster. She went on to win more races, including taking 1st place twice in the legendary "Fastnet Race": once with a lead of over 20 hours over the next Maxi-yacht. With her impressive length of almost 22 meters, a width of more than 5 meters and a total sail area of about 280 square meters, the yacht offers everything that makes the ambitious and demanding sailor's heart beat fast.

name: 1958 Kotter 21.50 Zeilkotter1958 Kotter 21.50 Zeilkotter
description:
Former pilot boat converted to Sailing Kotter, sleeps 12, owners cabin, suitable for habitation, spacious and renovated wheelhouse, + bowsprit 27 m


Former pilot boat from German Loodskotter from ca. 1960 with CVO inspection and certificate from 2019. Current owner bought the ship in 1999 and restored it in 2000 with the plan to sail around the world. It has remained a plan. Total invested during the years approx. € 350,000.- Hull has been inspected in 2017. The small deckhouse has been replaced by a larger deckhouse and the ship is further equipped with two steel masts with compete set sails in 2009 and also new rigging. This sailing cutter has a spacious heated saloon with u-seat in the deckhouse, with bookcase. owner's cabin aft under the deckhouse and a dormitory with 12 berths and can be used as a comfortable sailing and sailing houseboat. There is still much work to be done on this ship.
Can also be used as a charter ship for up to 12 passengers The engine is a reliable problem-free Suzker Diesel engine with 300 hp
Engine is clocked for above 90%
Trade-in is negotiable.
A smaller, possibly habitable ship, preferably motorboat or motorsailer.
Boat meets all standards and is CVO approved

name: 2001 One Design Custom 702001 One Design Custom 70
description:
Wow - what a yacht!  If you are looking for a true head turner this is the boat for you. The design brief was grace, pace and space whilst being easy to sail either singlehanded or fully crewed.  We have sailed Madam ourselves and can testify to her sailing ability and user friendliness.  Her well thought out rigging systems allow the helmsman to sail her in all conditions without leaving the helm.  You will passage plan at 8 knots and 220 mile days are easily attained.  She was locally built by skilled craftsmen to a very high standard in the well proven wood/epoxy cold moulded system.  This gives a light, strong structure with all the beauty of traditional construction without the high maintenance.  Her hull is coated with Epifanes two pack varnish giving a durable long lasting finish that is a joy to behold.  A true modern classic, she is simply gorgeous. The owner has a new project in the offing and she must be sold. He's a very motivated seller!
Viewing by appointment only through our Suffolk Office 01473 659 681.Mehr anzeigen

name: 1991 Ta Chiao Scorpio 721991 Ta Chiao Scorpio 72
description:
This sailboat has real marine qualities as well as a pleasant interior layout. A ketch of character that we sail with pleasure. A large sunbathing area along the teak deck, a protected and warm cockpit, cabins each with their own bathroom, an elegant interior in solid teak decorated in navy blue, life on board Scorpio 72 remains above all maritime and comfortable.
English This sailboat has real marine qualities as well as a pleasant interior layout. A ketch of character that we navigate with pleasure. A large sunbathing along the teak deck, a protected and warm cockpit, cabins each with their individual bathroom, an elegant interior in solid teak decorated in marine blues, life on board Scorpio 72 remains above all maritime and comfortable.

Ein großes Sonnenbaden entlang des Teakdecks, ein geschütztes und warmes Cockpit, Kabinen mit jeweils eigenem Bad, ein elegantes Interieur aus massivem Teakholz, das in Marineblau gehalten ist, das Leben an Bord der Scorpio 72 bleibt vor allem maritim und komfortabel.

Россию этот Парусник обладаетоящими морскими качествами, а также Приятной Внутренней Планироique. Кетч характера, которым мы ориентируемся с удовольствием. Большое загорание вдоль палубы из тикового дерева, защищенная и теплая кабина, каюты с каждой индивидуальной ванной комнатой, элегантный интерьер из массива тикового дерева, оформленный в морском блюзе, жизнь на борту Scorpio 72 остается прежде всего морской и комфортной.Mehr anzeigen

name: 1996 Oyster Cutter Rigged Sloop1996 Oyster Cutter Rigged Sloop
description:
In the exhaustive search for the right vessel to transport his family with five young children around the globe, in optimized comfort and safety, this owner finally decided on “Toad”. Finding a strong reliable cruising yacht with the long legs and five ensuite cabins, and all the associated features that “Toad” now offers, was a challenging quest. As “Apollonia” this Oyster 70 was found resting in the South of England, and so the story began. The owner’s requirement for no compromise on the technical performance of the yacht necessitated a substantial refit and upgrading and replacement of a large proportion of the vital technical components. The details of these improvements are contained in a separate list available to interested parties.
 
“Toad” was the chosen vessel for an 18 month long family cruise from Europe to New Zealand. She has proved immensely reliable, and fit for purpose. Her professional crew have continually maintained and upgraded her like no other yacht of this size or ilk. As a result, and with very little evidence of her painless and immensely successful cruise, she is offered in turnkey condition, ready to bring the same enjoyment to her next lucky owner. Toad continues to benefit from an extensive maintenance and upgrading program as she lies at her new berth in Imperia, Italy.Mehr anzeigen

name: 1941 Baglietto Motorsailer Bermudan Ketch1941 Baglietto Motorsailer Bermudan Ketch
description:
The hull was built at the Baglietto Shipyard in Varazze between 1942 and 1943, together with 3 other sister navy ships, to be used as minesweepers. The program did not go ahead and one of these ships, was sold to Dr. Fassio, a ship owner who turned it into a pleasure vessel at the Cantieri Sturla in Genoa, under the direction of the than young English architect Laurent Giles.
The current owners bought the yacht in 1990 and after having reconstructed its history and retrieved project and documentation around Europe, between 2000 and 2009, submitted her to a radical refit at Cantieri De Carlo of Viareggio. In 2016, the boat has been submitted to an extra refit update. 

Flying Italian Commercial Flag.
Real SUPER conditions for a so old lady.Annual maintinance in progress, from April to half May.
Asking Price* € 360.000 now reduced to € 310.000 + vat, if due.

 
**This boat is Italian and as such, its sale is subject to Italian customs and practices on yachts brokerage, which state that the agency commission of 10% is paid in half between the seller and the buyer. The sale price published on this site is therefore calibrated so that the seller pays to the broker only 5% and does not include the other 5%, which must be paid directly by the buyer to the broker.Mehr anzeigen

name: 1914 AB Norvegian Galeas1914 AB Norvegian Galeas
description: LUN II was built for fishing in 1914 near Ålesund in Norway, she completed her initial career in 1976 with a significant refit at a shipyard, with changes to the engine and lengthening and widening modifications to the hull in 1956. This was common practice at the time, as it was less expensive than building from scratch. Acquired by her fourth owner in 1979, she was refurbished at the Ring Andersen shipyard in Denmark with a 14-year full refit to exact Norwegian and Germanischer Lloyd Standart. In 1996, she sailed to Ensenada in Mexico where she became a floating home for her owner, his wife and dogs.The last owner bought her in 2015, with the intention of turning her into a sailing cargo ship. Significant carpentry and engine work was carried out in 2016/2017 for this purpose. Several expeditions have been successfully completed since, with over 100 tonnes of cargo shipped across the Atlantic and a polar expedition in 2018/19.Mehr anzeigen

name: 2012 Maxi Dolphin NACIRA 672012 Maxi Dolphin NACIRA 67
description:
With over twenty years of experience in the sailing market, the Italian shipyard Maxi Dolphin, known for producing one-off yachts, has followed its natural evolution and now launches the 20m sailing yacht Dream 67 SHAMLOR.
SHAMLOR is made both for leisure or race and is described as "the most powerful leisure yacht worldwide, able to reach speeds in excess of 30 knots – with a sea view from the dining table!"
She features plenty of discretely packaged race technology, including light Karver headsail furlers driven via endless Dyneema loops from the powerful electric winches aft – much lighter than electrical furlers. A big single-spreader Lorima rotating wing mast, a powerful sailplan, plenty of form stability from the wide hull plus a canting keel are more than enough reasons for extra crew to be added when Shamlor starts racing last summer.Mehr anzeigen

name: 2014 KM Yachtbuilders ANABEL2014 KM Yachtbuilders ANABEL
description:
A very unique yacht that is ready to sail the world for new adventures. Anabel is a very seaworthy yacht that has been built for unlimited cruising and a unique design which is totally “Custom built”. Only one owner from new.
Built in the prestigious KM shipyard in Holland and designed by Dykstra Naval architects, it is made to the specifications of its owner who is a very experienced sailor. All on this yacht is thinking of safety, seaworthiness but not leaving aside the maximum comfort it provides for life onboard. There are no other boats like this on the market this is the reason for its customization. 
You can tell from the pilot house that the owner has an aviation background. Just one big helm seat, centrally positioned, straight in front of an instrument panel, featuring gauges, digital displays and buttons. There are even switches with various functions on the ceiling. The windows provide an all-round view outside and above in order to keep an eye on the sails.
Some key facts about this yacht are:
Welded aluminum hull and deck on the solid side of performance.
– Outside plating is in ALUSTAR 5059 H321
– Hull form for gentle motion.
– Essential equipment is mostly serviceable/repairable in the field.
– Essential equipment does not rely (too much) on computer technology.
Walkthrough inside from Bow to Stern.
The Forepeak is the first watertight section, and accommodates sail bags, rope and fenders. A FORTRESS FX125 spare anchor is mounted on the port side. There is a big aluminum reel on port side aft, that accommodates a gennaker in a sock. There is one more aluminum reel to store mooring lines.
Following additional equipment is installed.: Electric circuit breaker and switch box, hydraulic bow thruster, 2 combination pumps for bilge drain, anchor locker drain, anchor chain wash , seawaterdeckhose. One Standpipe on the starboard side aft supplies this forepeak pump and the forward head. There is 1 small inspection hatch from the forward head into the forepeak at chest height. This hatch enables you to activate said pumps, and white, or red lights, and do a visual check of the forepeak.
The forward cabin is the second watertight section with access from the salon via a watertight door. At the forward end is the bathroom. Holding tanks for this head are directly behind and above the heads, for short pumping distance and easy flush. The bed is on Starboard between hull and keel case, to have the sleeping body supported on both tacks. The chain locker is a watertight compartment directly ahead of the keel case, sitting low and in the center of the boat. On the portside, forward of the watertight door is an office desk with a computer suspended on bungee cords, to absorb shocks from pounding seas.
The technical equipment in this section 2 consists of an electric bilge pump, washing machine, a COMMANDMIC at the bed for VHF radio and intercom capability with NAV- station and helm. 230V outlets at the desk for the Mac and others stuff. 1 AC outlet in the cabinet over the wash basin. Hot and cold water + heating radiators .
There is ample storage throughout the boat, the forward cabin, being the owners cabin , is privileged and has locker space fit for a king.
The Salon is the third watertight section.
From the watertight door aft is the utility area opposite the keel case. Located here are the watermaker and the water pressure pump. The watermaker is in a convenient accessible open position for easy access and maintenance. Underneath is the water pressure system. Next is the washing machine. Further forward are the freezer/fridge boxes. The cooling compressors are below the box, and of 24V/DC to avoid inverter losses and not be inverter dependent. The cooling compressors are skin cooled, like the engine, so NO outside water is required.
Above the fridge and freezer is the 220V switchboard flanked by the sine- wave inverters. The 220V unit is supplied directly from the battery block and completely separated from the 12/24V system in order to prevent any possibility of electrical shock when working on the DC system. One more reason why this position has been chosen, is the close proximity to the heaviest consumers.: Washing machine, Stove, galley tools.
The Galley has two distinct stove systems. The electric stove is gimbaled. The « Wallas». The diesel stove needs only a little 12V supply, so there is redundancy to the 230V stove. There is ample storage to hold glasses ,plates and silverware. A dehumidifier is in this area as well.
Aft of the galley is the bathroom/head for the quarter cabins and guests. This bathroom is a little roomier, and has access from the salon, via a sliding door.
The port quarter cabin is the Nr. 2 cabin and is roomier than the starboard cabin. It has direct access to the head via a sliding door.
On starboard, aft of the watertight bulkhead, the seating area is situated. The table, being the only one inside the boat, can seat up to 8 people. A sound system from Maranz with KEF speakers provides a concert atmosphere and the sound for the beamer/screen combination, for cinema at sea. Very nice to relax with a movie, when you are in a storm. In the 20m boat class, this is the best sound system afloat.
Aft of the seating area is the Nr. 3 quarter cabin. The passage from the pilot-house to the salon is offset to starboard and engine access is provided to the right side of the engine. The hot water boiler is under this quarter cabin bed.
In the middle of the salon, right after the keel, the welded in aluminum compartment for the 1100 Amp/h NiCad battery block is situated. This compartment, being water- tight, sits as low as possible, and we build a bench above it that fits to the main table. The engine can be started from its dedicated starter battery, or from the main battery by the flip of a switch. The pre fuse box is mounted to the aft end of the battery box. Forward of the battery is a glass in the bottom, to enable a quick check of the bilge. At night, this place can be lit by a red inspection light.
Next to the battery is the main DC electric, circuit breaker and switch board. This cabinet-like compartment has 0.4m depth and holds some black box equipment as well. Instruments and switches face forward.
In order to trade space, for salon and cabins, the pilot house is on the smaller side for this size of boat, and a little further aft. There is no table except for the Nav. table. All navigational electronics are arranged from the center to port, in front of the navigator seat. The pilot house windows are brand new and made of SILATEC bullet proof glass ! This is primarily to make them as resistant as possible, against breakage in case of wave slap. The fact that they can stop a bullet is another positive, but not the primary reason for this choise.
Sails:
Mainsail 106m
Genoa 85m
Staysail ( inner Jib ) 33m Storm jib 25m
Storm trysail 29m
Small gennaker 199m Large gennaker ca. 250m
Propulsion: 
LUGGER L1064T 4 cylinder, fairly slow turning, mechanically fuel controlled diesel engine. The fuel lifting system , that lifts fuel from the bottom tanks, into the day tank, has a hand operated pump as a backup, thus even without electricity, you could run the engine for six days on a full tank. The engine is keel cooled, thus no outside water is taken inside the boat. Large diameter CPP prop.
Navigation: 
VHF/AIS – Class B ICOM 
Radar SIMRAD
Autopilot SIMRAD
list of equipment can be offered upon enquiry, 
For more details please contact our sales team.Mehr anzeigen

name: 2006 Custom 20M ACUBENS SAILING YACHT2006 Custom 20M ACUBENS SAILING YACHT
description: MASSGEFERTIGTE 20M ACUBENS SEGELYACHT Die Segelyacht ist eine spezielle Sonderanfertigung. Sie hat viele großartige Eigenschaften. Zunächst einmal hat sie durch ihr spezielles Design (von Acubens Yacht Design) mehr Volumen und Raum als andere Yachten gleicher Länge. Ihre Unterwasserlinien, ihr Kiel und ihr Ruder können es in puncto Effektivität mit den besten Designs von heute aufnehmen. Sie ist eine sehr komfortable, sichere und schnelle Segelyacht. Ihr Verhalten auf See ist beeindruckend. Sie ist wirklich ein hochseetaugliches Schiff. Ihr Design oberhalb der Wasserlinie ist nicht nur ästhetisch ansprechend, sondern auch perfekt für den Einsatz auf Reisen. Das Cockpit ist groß und komfortabel und bietet einen Komfort, den man bei einem Segelboot dieser Größenordnung nur selten findet. Das Design trennt auch den Manöverbereich und den Entspannungsbereich, um mögliche Unannehmlichkeiten für die Gäste bei einem der Manöver zu vermeiden. Der Innenraum ist geräumig und hell, mit einem großen Wohnzimmer und vier Kabinen mit Bad und eigener Dusche (plus einer fünften Kabine für die Crew). Was das Schiff jedoch wirklich einzigartig macht, ist seine Konstruktion: Der Rumpf und die Innenstruktur sind aus CORTEN-Stahl (Cupro-Nickel; hoher Gehalt an Chrom, Kupfer und Nickel). Dieser Stahl hat wichtige Eigenschaften - er besitzt eine hohe mechanische Festigkeit, die mit der von kohlenstoffreichen Widerstandsstählen vergleichbar ist. Diese Eigenschaft ermöglicht eine leichtere Konstruktion, die der Yacht eine geringere Verdrängung als andere Materialien verleiht, und eine unendlich höhere Widerstandsfähigkeit, die ihr maximale Sicherheit in der Schifffahrt verleiht. Das Deck, die Kabine und das Cockpit sind aus EDELSTAHL gefertigt. Dieses Material ist nicht nur mechanisch sehr widerstandsfähig, sondern verringert auch Korrosion und Oxidation. Das Deck ist mit Teakholz ausgelegt. Kommentar des Eigentümers: Wir haben sie als Kreuzfahrtyacht gebaut. Sie ist stark und sicher. Carinox hat alle Stahlarbeiten für den Rumpf und das Deck ausgeführt. Unsere eigene Firma Gabinette Naval hat die gesamte Innenausstattung, die Installationen usw. mit Hilfe von Fachkräften und erstklassigen internationalen Lieferanten ausgeführt. Wir haben das Schiff hauptsächlich im Atlantik auf den Kanarischen Inseln und in der Karibik eingesetzt. Sie wurde zwischen November 2018 und Januar 2019 überholt, einschließlich: Sandstrahlen des Unterwasserschiffs und Neuanstrich. Reinigung und Anstrich aller Bilgen und Teile der Innenausstattung. Demontage, Inspektion und Anstrich (Awlgrip) von Mast, Baum und 2 Masten. Demontage, Inspektion der stehenden Takelage und Austausch einiger Teile nach Bedarf. Demontage und Austausch der Welle und der Wellendichtung (Shaftseal) sowie Inspektion des Propellers und Austausch seiner beweglichen Teile und der Anode. Demontage, Inspektion des Ruders und Austausch der Lager und der Dichtung (Shaftseal). Neues Großsegel, sowie Lazy Jacks und Abdeckung. Der Rest der Segel wurde überprüft und mit einem neuen Sonnenschutzstreifen versehen. Als Beweis für die Qualität und Zuverlässigkeit dieses Schiffes ist es wichtig, darauf hinzuweisen, dass sie insgesamt 22 Transatlantiküberquerungen gemacht hat, alle mit absolutem Erfolg, d.h. ohne nennenswerte Pannen. Viele davon wurden im Rahmen der ARC (Atlantic Rally for Cruisers) durchgeführt, bei denen sie durchweg sehr gute Ergebnisse erzielt hat. Konstruktion: Gebaut nach RINA-Klasse. RCD-Status: Die Yacht entspricht den wesentlichen Sicherheitsanforderungen der Richtlinie 94/25EC (Sportbootrichtlinie) und ist CE Kategorie A - "Ocean". Spanische Registrierung unter "lista 6ª" mit Erlaubnis und Lizenz für Charter. Spanische Immatrikulationssteuer bezahlt. Spanische Mehrwertsteuer gezahlt - aber das Boot ist Eigentum einer Firma und diese wurde zurückgefordert. Abhängig von den Umständen des Kaufs kann IVA anwendbar und auf den Kaufpreis zahlbar sein. Rumpf, Deck & Aufbauten Konstruktion: Rumpf und Aufbau in Cortenstahl. Deck und Kajütdach aus rostfreiem Stahl. Decksbelag aus Teakholz (original und jetzt abgenutzt). Die gesamte Yacht ist mit Awlgrip gestrichen. Die Oberseiten sind in dunkelgrün gestrichen. Wasserlinie in weiß gestrichen. Aufbauten in weiß gestrichen. Wartung und Antifouling (geplant für Ende Januar 2022). Kiel und Ruder: Der Kiel ist gekapselt, die Flossen sind nach hinten geschwungen und haben eine Verdickung. Einfaches Ruder. Einzelne Ruderanlage - an der vorderen Backbordseite des Cockpits positioniert. Maschinenpark: Die Yacht verfügt über einen fantastischen Maschinenraum, in dem man sehr bequem arbeiten kann und der gut isoliert ist. Ebenso ungewöhnlich für Boote dieser Größe ist der Maschinenraum, in dem die gesamte Ausrüstung untergebracht ist, was bedeutet, dass der Motor oder das Aggregat, wenn sie laufen, fast unbemerkt bleiben! Motor & Getriebe: 1 x Perkins Sabre 265hp Dieselmotor. Doppelscheiben-Getriebe, 3,5:1 Untersetzung Wartung & Leistung: Reisegeschwindigkeit - ca. 8 Knoten bei 1500rpm. Die Höchstgeschwindigkeit beträgt ca. 9,5 Knoten. Motorbetriebsstunden (Stand: September 2021): ca. 8.720. Der Motor wurde immer gemäß den Wartungsempfehlungen des Herstellers gewartet. Der letzte Service war im April 2021 (Filter, Öl, Kühlflüssigkeit) und eine neue Seewasserpumpe. Der Kraftstoffverbrauch beträgt ca. 12 Liter pro Stunde bei 1.500 U/min. Die Reichweite unter Motor beträgt ca. 1.750 Meilen. Antrieb & Steuerung: Brunton 4-Blatt-Verstellpropeller. Whitlock-Steuerungspodest. Lewmar Mamba System. Vetus Bugstrahlruder - in einem Tunnel am Bug angebracht, Hydraulikmotor 26,8 kW, betrieben über eine Hydraulikpumpe am Motor. Motor. Elektrische Systeme: Spannungssysteme: Die elektrische Anlage besteht aus zwei unabhängigen Installationen, eine mit 24 V Gleichstrom und die andere mit 220 V Wechselstrom. Die 220-Volt-Anlage wird entweder von den beiden Generatoren über die beiden Wechselrichter oder von der Landstromversorgung gespeist. Das 24-V-System wird von der 800-Ah-Bleibatteriebank gespeist. Batteriebänke: Die Service-Batteriebank hat eine hohe Kapazität, so dass man die Nacht vor Anker verbringen kann, ohne den ohne Generator (wenn Sie keine Klimaanlage benötigen). Für den Service: 8 x Batterien mit je 205 Ah, die in Reihe/Parallel geschaltet sind. Motorbatterien, 2 x 205Ah, die von einer Lichtmaschine am Motor oder von den Ladegeräten geladen werden. Alle Service- und Motorstartbatterien wurden im Januar 2021 erneuert. Batterieladegeräte: 2 x Ladegeräte Victron Skylla TG 24v 80 Amp. 2 x Wechselrichter, beide Victron Phoenix 3000 Einheiten. Lichtmaschinen: 150A Lichtmaschine am Hauptmotor zum Laden der Servicebatterien und eine zweite Lichtmaschine zum Laden der Motorstartbatterien Batterien. Generator: Die Yacht ist mit zwei Generatoren ausgestattet. 1 x Westerbeke 10kw. Ca. 3058 Stunden (Stand: September 2021). 1 x Westerbeke 7.5kw (diese Einheit ist defekt - das wird vom Verkäufer behoben oder eine Entschädigung angeboten). Landstrom: Die Yacht ist für 220 V ausgestattet, obwohl die Installation auch mit einer externen Steckdose von 110 V AC 60 Hz funktionieren kann. Hz. funktionieren, da die Ladegeräte mit beiden Stromstärken und Frequenzen arbeiten. Der Eigner kann diese dann zum Aufladen der Batterien verwenden und diese über die Konverter die gesamte Anlage mit 220 VAC versorgen. Das Schiff war zwei Jahre in Mexiko, wo der Strom 110 VAC 60 Hz. (USA) und sie haben keine Probleme gehabt. Anschlusskabel und Stecker wie an Bord enthalten. Andere Elektrik: Klimaanlage der Serie CLD 2000, für den Salon und alle Kabinen, Heizung und Kühlung. Sanitäranlagen: Frischwasser- und Wasserheizungssystem: Das Frischwassersystem besteht aus zwei Glasfaser-/Polyestertanks mit einem Fassungsvermögen von 1.600 Litern zwischen den beiden Tanks. Das heiße Wasser ist mit wasserdichten Butangasboiler Marke "Bosch" und neu installiert letzten Juli 2021. Dieser Kessel ist völlig geräuschlos und produziert immer konstant warmes Wasser. Wassermacher: Hidromar-Einheit, MC3J, die bis zu 250 Liter pro Stunde produzieren kann. Neue Membranen im Januar 2019 vom Typ "Dow Corning". Bilgepumpen: Es gibt drei Bilgen, jede mit einer automatischen elektrischen Bilgepumpe und einer manuellen Bilgepumpe, alle unabhängig. Unterhaltung: Vierfaches Pioneer Stereo-Radio/CD mit Lautsprechern im Cockpit. Sharp Aquos TV; versteckt hinter einer aufklappbaren Platte am Ende des Salons. Sony DVD-Spieler. Unterbringung: Zusammenfassung der Unterbringung: Die Yate bietet Schlafplätze für 8 Gäste in 4 Kabinen, jede mit eigenem Bad (plus eine Kabine für den Skipper). Alternativ können Sie auch 6 Gäste unterbringen und eine weitere Kabine für 2 Besatzungsmitglieder nutzen. Die Materialien im Inneren sind von höchster Qualität. Alle Kabinen (vier) haben ein Bad und eine Dusche aus Marmor und rostfreiem Stahl. Alle Möbel sind aus laminiertem Ahornholz mit hochdichtem Polyurethanschaum im Inneren, um Gewicht zu sparen, und die Wand- und Deckenpaneele sind aus dem gleichen Grund aus der Luftfahrtkategorie "Honigwabe". Die Trennwände und Böden sind aus nachvollziehbaren Gründen mit schallgedämmten Paneelen ausgestattet. Salontisch mit ausklappbaren Blättern; hebt und senkt sich mit einer manuellen Hydraulikpumpe, so dass Sie die Höhe einstellen können. 2 x klappbare Regiestühle. 1 x Beige Stuhl am Schreibtisch im Salon / oder im Esszimmer. Innenaufteilung: Vordere Kabine mit V-Koje, Schreibtisch, Regale, Hängeschrank und Schubladen an Backbord. Grüner Teppichboden. Große Decksluke vorwärts. Kleine Luke achtern an Backbord. Auf der Steuerbordseite befindet sich der eigene Waschraum mit Duschkabine, Waschbecken und Toilette. Kleine Klappe über der Toilette. Die Tür achtern führt zu einem Durchgang - hier hebt sich der Kabinenboden mit einem sehr geräumigen Stauraum durch die zentrale Stauraum, einschließlich einer zweiten Gefriertruhe. An Backbord befindet sich ein Tageskopf mit einer Decksluke darüber. An Steuerbord befindet sich die Doppelkabine. Eine Koje befindet sich vorn und achtern und eine zweite Koje befindet sich achtern, ist erhöht und verläuft an Backbord und Steuerbord quer durch die Kabine. Diese Kabine hat einen Schreibtisch, Schubladen, einen Schrank und ein Regal. Decksluke darüber. Grüner Teppich. Im Vorschiff befindet sich der eigene Waschraum mit Duschkabine, Waschbecken und Toilette. Vom Gang aus führt eine Treppe nach achtern, wo sich an der Backbordseite ein Sofa/Sitzbereich mit Bücherregal befindet. Über eine zweite Stufe zum Hauptsalon. An der Backbordseite befindet sich eine kurze Sitzbank mit Stauraum im Inneren. Entlang der Backbordseite befinden sich eine Reihe von Schränken und Schubladen und eine kleine, erhöhte Schreibtischeinheit. An der Steuerbordseite befindet sich ein L-förmiges Sofa (geändert gegenüber dem Original und jetzt ohne Tisch, in der vorderen Ecke). Der Tisch hat zwei ausklappbare Blätter und ist mit einem manuellen Hydraulikzylinder in der Höhe verstellbar. (kann also als Couchtisch oder zum Essen verwendet werden). Es gibt 3 Regiestühle, die hier verwendet werden können. Achterlich der Sitzbereich befindet sich ein Schreibtisch mit Computer. Entlang des hinteren Schotts befinden sich die elektrische Schalttafel und die Funkausrüstung (Steuerbord). In der Mitte des Achterschotts ist ein Fernseher hinter einer herunterklappbaren Platte versteckt. Durch die großen Fenster und zwei Decksluken ist der Salon sehr hell, luftig und geräumig. Vom hinteren Teil des Salons führen vier Stufen hinauf zum Cockpit. Drei Stufen achtern auf der Backbordseite führen nach unten und nach achtern. In diesem Gang befinden sich weitere Schränke. Direkt achtern befindet sich die Haupt-Doppel-Gästekabine mit reichlich Stauraum und Schränken, einem Sitz und einer Doppelkoje querschiffs. An der Innenseite der Kabine befindet sich der eigene Waschraum mit Duschkabine, Waschbecken und Toilette. Der Duschbereich und die Kabine haben Öffnungen zum Cockpit. Zur weiteren Belüftung befindet sich achtern eine Decksluke. Außerdem gibt es zwei Rumpffenster für zusätzliches Licht (eines im Heck und eines auf der Backbordseite). Die Kabine hat einen grünen Teppich. Vom Gang aus führt eine Treppe nach unten und nach innen in die Kombüse und die Essecke. Dieser ist gut ausgestattet und und hat eine Öffnung zum Cockpit sowie ein Rumpffenster neben der Spüle. Wenn man durch die Kombüse geht und sich nach achtern wendet, kommt man in die achterliche Doppelkabine, die über obere und untere Kojen, Schubladen, und Schränke. Sie hat ein Rumpffenster und eine Öffnung zum Cockpit. An der Innenseite der Kabine befindet sich das Bad mit Waschraum mit Duschkabine, Waschbecken und Toilette. Im Waschraum gibt es eine Öffnung zum Cockpit. Achterwärts von der Doppelkabine befindet sich die Einzelkabine (für die Besatzung) mit Schreibtisch, Schränken und einem Safe. Die Kabine hat eine Decksluke über und ein Rumpffenster im Heck. Diese Kabine ist nur über die Doppelkabine zugänglich. Ein Eigner kann beide Kabinen nutzen für Besatzung Ausstattung an Deck: Rigg: Aluminium, 3-Spreizmast auf Kiel gestuft. Mast und Baum sind von dem deutschen Hersteller Reckmann. Es ist ein starker Mast, ideal für Langstreckenfahrten. Die Spieren sind alle schwarz lackiert (Mast, Baum, Spinnakerbaum, Jockeymast). Das stehende Gut ist Dyform (Dyform - jetzt bekannt als Compacted), ein High-Tech-Drahttauwerk mit geringer Dehnung, mit einer um mehr als 30 % höheren Bruchfestigkeit als herkömmlicher 1×19-Draht und 25 % weniger Dehnung. Das laufende Tauwerk besteht aus Dyneema. Sie ist mit drei Rollfockstagen ausgerüstet - alle von Hood - einer für die Genua, einer für einen Yankee und der dritte für die Fock. MASSGESCHNEIDERTE 20M ACUBENS SEGELYACHT Alle Segelkontrollen werden vom Cockpit aus gesteuert, was eine einfache und sichere Navigation ermöglicht (perfekt von einer Person gesteuert). Im Winter 2018-19 war der Mast zur Inspektion und zum Anstrich (Awlgrip) von Mast, Baum und 2 Masten sowie eine vollständige Inspektion der stehenden Takelage und den Austausch einiger Teile, wie erforderlich. Segel: Großsegel (mit vollen Latten und Frederiksen Auto- und Schienensystem und einem "Lazy Bag" System mit "Lazy Jacks" für einfache Handhabung) - neu im Januar 2019 von "Advanced Sails". Genua und Yankee/Staysail in gutem Zustand, von 2015, von "Elite Sails" - und überarbeitet und das Sonnenschutzband Sonnenschutzband im Januar 2019 geändert. Fock von 2016 in gutem Zustand, aber das Sonnenschutzband muss ersetzt werden. Alles in Dacron. Winden: Lewmar 110 manuelle selbstholende Schotwinden. 2 x Barient 37 hydraulische, selbstholende Winden am Steuerstand für die Hauptsteuerung. 2 x Barient 26 manuelle, selbstholende Winden am Mast an Deck für Fallen. 2 x Lewmar 65 selbstholende Winden achtern für Läufer (und Festmacher). Ankern und Festmachen: Hydraulische Ankerwinde Kappis Nautic DZC 1000 H. Delta 60kg Anker. 100m 12mm Ankerkette. Allgemeines: Teak und Ebenholz lackiert Cockpittisch mit s / s Beine. Große Schränke an Deck - Steuerbordseite (Fender). Lazarettschrank achtern, plus 2 x kleine Schränke. Teakholzsitze an den Heckkorb-Ecken. Abdeckungen, Segeltuch und Kissen: Festes Bimini - Edelstahlstützen und GFK-Verdeck (auf dem man stehen kann, um das Großsegel aufzuräumen und Sonnenkollektoren usw.). Sprayhood im Cockpit. Cockpit-Kissen. Sonnenliegekissen auf dem Vordeck. Großsegeltasche / Großsegelabdeckung in weiß. Beiboot & Außenborder: Halbstarres Beiboot "Gommonautica", 3,5 m lang, aber inzwischen alt und in schlechtem Zustand. Es ist geplant, es gegen ein Beiboot von gleichen oder ähnlichen Marke und Größe zu ersetzen, das auf die Keilen am Bug passt. Außenbordmotor "Yamaha 15 PS, neu gekauft im Februar 2021 und mit 20 Betriebsstunden. Das Beiboot wird auf dem Deck vor dem Mast verstaut. Sicherheitsausrüstung: Rettungsinsel, 12 Personen Oceanic Class A RFD Solas, letzte Wartung Feb 2021. Anmerkung: Sie hat die volle Sicherheitsausrüstung, die von den spanischen Vorschriften für Charter unter Lista 6º verlangt wird – einschließlich Rettungsinsel, Rettungswesten, Mann-über-Bord-Modul, EPIRB 406, Leuchtraketen, Feuerlöscher, ... etcMehr anzeigen

name: 2003 Meta META JOUBERT DI2003 Meta META JOUBERT DI
description:
2003 META META JOUBERT DI,
XBOAT ref 5192.Solid 20 M expedition sailboat, integral dinghy in thick aluminum (12/15 mm) from the META shipyard in TARRARE FRANCE.It has been specially designed to be able to navigate both in the tropics and near the poles.

>Engine: Volvo D5TA 165 hp diesel, efficient at slow speed (max 2200 rpm). Propeller diameter 70cm. 3 fixed blades Engine compartment completely isolated from the accommodation by aluminum partitions, soundproofed, with multiple accesses.

>Accommodation: 12 people, three double cabins, plus six single berths with beds. Washing machine, short cycle and adjustable water level, 2400 rev, in the front technical room. Water: 2000 l Bathroom with three compartments, two of which have electric showers and toilets, two sinks, larger waxed storage space.

>Kitchen: Comfortable and large U-shaped kitchen Force 10 cooker with four burners plus oven. Large double sink. Refrigeration: Engel fridge and freezer, plus 60 l and 40 l.

>Anchor equipment: Hydraulic Lewmar windlass, 100m 14mm main chain, 80kg Rocna Anchor (NZ version). Second anchor 80 kg Bruce, Fortress anchor in alloy (Portable) of large size usable ice pack.

>Security: Fire extinguishers, emergency bilge pump attached to the engine, manual pumps including a cockpit. Two EPIRB beacons including one in the survival raft. Many life jackets, survival suits.

>Electricity: Boat independent of external electrical sources, rarely in the Marina. Two new D 400 wind turbines, 6 x 120 W solar panels. Victron inverter charger with Venus control system. Two 250 AH domestic batteries plus one for engine starting, two alternators. A Honda 2200w generator in case of breakdown (used once a year on average)

>Electronics / Navigation:Simrad NSS8 plotter with Wifi, (which displays a mirror image of the AIS chart reader included on smartphone and tabletsTwo sounders, one forward, one mid/shipSimrad 4G radar,Simrad Autopilot with wireless control and joystick(for navigation tight in the ice )Iridium go

> Sails: Complete set, full batten mainsail 2021, tri radial genoa (North) 2021, staysail, both with Profurl furlers. A storm jib, a trysail permanently mounted in lazy bag, with separate mast track. Asymmetric spinnaker with sock.

>Large quantity of mooring lines and ropes.Twelve winches (12) including two 4-speed coffee grinders.Strong section 25 M mast with rod rigging, three spreaders, three stays forward, four lower stays, backstay double, two running backstays. Honda Zodiac 5hp 4-stroke dinghy Pool-type aft swimming ladder giving superb access to boarding and the baths.

Videos and visit on request. More information and photos on the site xboat.frMehr anzeigen
