name: 2006 Dufour 455 Grand Large2006 Dufour 455 Grand Large
description:
2006 DUFOUR DUFOUR 455 GRAND LARGE,
XBOAT ref 2735. The DUFOUR 455 Grand Large, with very refined hull and deck lines, has also been designed to be spacious and comfortable. Its cockpit is very wide, the table is impressive. In addition, the purity of the hull, the draft of 2.00 meters and the two steering wheels make navigation comfort optimal, even with a reduced crew. And just like the hull, the interior has been particularly well cared for. Very stylish, it offers a spacious saloon, well lit and ventilated. The joinery is in Moabi mahogany with fiddles, moldings and surrounds in solid wood.

This 2006 model is a 4-cabin version with 3 bathrooms and 2 toilets. Well-appointed modular saloon, very equipped longitudinal galley and two comfortable aft cabins. Forced air heating throughout the boat. New upholstery, 3-burner ENO cooker, huge fridge and double sink. Isothermal cold unit with compressor changed in 2019. Water heater 2017 (on 220 volts and engine exchanger). Hot water, cold water under pressure throughout the boat. Rear deck bath shower with hot and cold water. The joinery is well preserved, and the whole boat is very clean.

It is equipped to navigate mid-offshore with a new PLASTIMO 10-seater liferaft, a 2020 Sailonet GV with 2018 Lazy bag, a FACNOR furling genoa in good condition (BUV 2018), an asymmetrical spinnaker with sock and a staysail on carabiner.SPARCRAFT mast and boom, releasable forestay, HARKEN and LEWMAR fittings.RAYMARINE navigation unit, AIS transmitter/receiver on GRAMIN screen, FURUNO radar, VHF Radio Océan RO 470 and ST6000 autopilot.NAVTEX NX300.4 x HARKEN double winches speed (44 and 53). Double mooring. Hood and bimini new 2022.

Good autonomy thanks to a large capacity of fresh water (500 litres, 2 polypropylene tanks) and diesel (250 litres).

VOLVO 55CV engine from 2017 revised in April 2022. 5 recent batteries (4 x 105 Ah LX from 2017 for the edge, 1 x 95 Ah AUTOPOWER for the engine). Electric and manual bilge pump.

The boat is currently under summer rental contract via a professional skipper, therefore perfectly maintained and complies with all navigation and safety standards (automatic vests, flares, lifelines...).

Fairing February 2022. Engine maintenance April 2022. Available from September 2022. More details and visit on request. More information and photos on the site xboat.frMehr anzeigen

name: 2011 Jeanneau SO 44i2011 Jeanneau SO 44i
description:
Fast and spacious Jeanneau Sun Odyssey


This beautiful Jeanneau SO 44i is excellently equipped and well maintained. The boat is located on the beautiful island of Sardinia where both Transavia and Easy Jet fly to, a ticket is very affordable. There is someone on site to show you the boat. Former charter boats such as the Blue Eyes are technically checked weekly and are equipped with (almost) all options, including this 44'er! The strong and well-running 75 hp Yanmar engine in combination with the heavy bow thruster makes maneuvering easy. Below deck you will find an interior with lots of light and no less than 4 double cabins. The dividing wall between the front cabins can be removed, creating a very large cabin. Make your visit a nice outing, Sardinia is more than worth it and out of season you can fly there and back for 100 euros.

name: 2022 Leopard 452022 Leopard 45
description: Based on the philosophy of continuous innovation and the comments and opinions received from customers in the nautical sector, the new Leopard 45 sailing catamaran is synonymous with success, elegant lines and passion for sailing. The naval architecture developed by Simonis & Voogd Yacht Design and the exterior and interior design of the boat created by the world renowned team Robertson and Caine, the Leopard 45 sailing catamaran is not only based on the best features of the line Current Leopard, but is distinguished in particular by a new exterior design and an improved interior layout for more comfort. Exterior styling has evolved from more curved deck features in the current Leopard line to a more streamlined and angular design. A sleek new rigid canopy covers the saloon, which extends from the aft cockpit to the forward cockpit. It is sleek and nimble, yet supremely comfortable and embodies the Leopard boating heritage spanning 25 years of experience. The Leopard 45 sailing catamaran offers exceptional and strict quality in the construction of the whole boat, a new and elegant design, a practical and intelligent floor plan, sailing comfort in all types of sea conditions, and equipment integrating innovative technologies as well as multiple entertainment areasMehr anzeigen

name: 2022 Leopard 452022 Leopard 45

name: 2017 Nautitech 46 Fly2017 Nautitech 46 Fly
description:
This Nautitech 46 with flybridge from 2017 from first owner offers great comfort, space and matching performance. This Nautitech 46 is cutter rigged with a mainsail, self-tacking jib, gennaker, lazy jacks and lazy bag, electric winch, and a dedicated sprit on the bow. Furthermore equipped with: two 55hp Volvo Penta diesel engines, bronze 3-blade folding props, generator, inverters, water maker, tender with a 20hp outboard engine, etc. The comprehensive Garmin navigation equipment on flybridge and at the chart table includes radar. And the full safety equipment includes 2 life rafts and Epirb. The entirety of the deck is designed with maximum comfort in mind. Especially the front decks and the inviting cockpit offer ample space. The interior of the Nautitech 46 Fly is fitted out with all comforts like air conditioning throughout, dishwasher, etc. This 4 cabin version has two identical hulls, each with two good-sized cabins, a shared shower compartment and separate toilets. Additionally, there are two small cabins in the forepeaks, which can serve as crew quarter, berth for kids or storage. In short: the ideal cruising multihull to go anywhere.
Diese Nautitech 46 mit Flybridge von 2017 aus erster Hand bietet erstklassige Komfort, Leistung und Sicherheit. Die This Nautitech 46 ist Kutter getakelt mit einem Großsegel, Selbstwendefock, Gennaker, Lazy Jacks, Lazy Bag, elektrische Winde und ein Bugspriet. Darüber hinaus ausgestattet mit zwei 55 PS Volvo Penta Dieselmotoren, Bronze 3-Blatt Faltpropeller, Generator, Wechselrichter, Wassermacher, Beiboot mit einem 20 PS starken Außenborder, usw. Die umfassende Garmin Navigationsausstattung auf der Flybridge und am Kartentisch enthält Radar. Und die komplette Sicherheitsausrüstung umfasst ua zwei Rettungsinsel und Epirb. Das gesamte Deck ist entworfen worden für optimalen Komfort. Vor allem die Vordecks und das einladende Achterdeck bieten viel Platz. Das Interieur dieser Nautitech 46 Fly ist mit alle Bequemlichkeiten ausgerüstet, wie Klimaanlage, Geschirrspüler, usw. Diese 4-Kabinen-Version enthält zwei identische Rümpfe, die jeweils mit zwei Kabinen, einem gemeinsamen Dusche und zwei separate Toiletten ausgestattet sind. Dazu gibt es auch noch zwei kleinere Kabinen in beide Vorpieken, die als Crewkabine, Stauraum oder Koje für die Kinder dienen können.  Dieser Katamaran kann Sie überall hinbringen. 
Este Nautitech 46 con flybridge de 2017 del primer propietario ofrece gran confort, espacio, estabilidad y seguridad. Este This Nautitech 46 tiene un aparejo de cúter con una vela mayor, Lazy Bags y Lazy Jacks, foque autovirante, gennaker, cabrestante eléctrico y un bauprés. Además equipado con: dos motores diésel Volvo Penta de 55 CV, hélices plegables de bronce, generador, inversores, desalinizadora, bote auxiliar con fueraborda de 20 CV, etc.  El amplio equipo de navegación de Garmin incluye radar. Y, el completo equipe de seguridad está inclusivo balsas salvavidas y Epirb. El exterior está diseñado con el máximo confort en mente. Especialmente las cubiertas en proa y el flybridge ofrecen amplio espacio. El interior de este This Nautitech 46 está equipado con todas las comodidades como: aire acondicionado en el salón y todas las cabinas, lavavajillas, etc.  Esta versión de 4 cabinas tiene dos cascos idénticos, cada uno con dos cabinas, un compartimento de ducha y aseos privados. Adicionalmente hay dos pequeñas cabinas en ambas proas, que podrían servir como cuarto de tripulación, litera para los niños o almacenamiento. Con este crucero familiar puede ir a cualquier lugar del mundo.
Cette Nautitech 46 avec  flybridge de 2017 du premier propriétaire offre grand confort dehors et dedans. Cette This Nautitech 46 est gréée en cotre avec grand-voile, Lazy Bag et Lazy Jacks, gennaker, foc auto-vireur, winch électrique, et un beaupré. En outre, équipée de deux moteurs diesel Volvo Penta de 55 CV, hélices pliables de bronze, groupe électrogène,  inverseurs, dessalinisateur, annexe avec moteur hors-bord de 20 CV, etc. Le complet équipement de navigation de Garmin sur le flybridge et à la table des cartes comprend radar et l’équipement de sécurité inclut 2 radeaux de sauvetage et Epirb. Les ponts sont très spacieux et derrière le poste de contrôle sur le flybridge se trouve une immense zone de repos. L’intérieur de cette This Nautitech 46 est équipé de tous les conforts comme climatisation dans les cabines et le carré, lave-vaisselle, etc.  Est une version avec 4 cabines. Les deux coques sont identiques avec chacun deux cabines, des toilettes privées, et une cabine de douche. De plus, il y a deux petites cabines situées aux proues, qui peuvent servir pour les enfants ou de stockage. Avec ce catamaran polyvalent on peut aller partout.Mehr anzeigen

name: 2005 Beneteau First 44.72005 Beneteau First 44.7
description:
Secondo proprietario, mai charter. Buono stato generale. Posto barca disponibile. Ce FIRST 44.7 est une 2eme main, jamais loué. Trés bon état général. Place de port disponible. Instruments Vhf Raymarine, eco Raymarine, autopilota Raymarine, log, gps Raymarine, stazione vento Raymarine, batterie 3. • Elica tripala abbatibile a passo variabile. Interni/interiors Cabine 3, cuccette 6 + 2, bagni 2, wc marini, doccia 2 + 1, cucina 2 fuochi, forno, frigo, boiler. More The feedback provided by over 550 owners of the First 40.7 has been instrumental for Farr Yacht Design and the Bénéteau Design Team to create the NEW Beneteau First 44.7. The First 40.7, designed by the same team, is a world best seller with a record of race titles, including an IMS World Championship. Her success is not due to race results alone. The 40.7 offers rare versatility, outstanding value, and consistently high resale value as will the NEW Beneteau First 44.7 Additional Description • This version of the accommodation plan has 3 cabins (1 to the bow and two aft) and 2 heads. • It facilitates movement from one part of the boat to another, has great storage capacity and comfort and a sober atmosphere. • The woodwork is in pear-tree coloured Mukali wood with fiddles and mouldings in solid wood. • The light colour of the woodwork gives a greater feeling of space. • Storage: There are several storage spaces making life easier aboard. They are equipped with ventilation systems. (Some of the storage lockers are "removable" to help lighten the boat, which is necessary for regattas). • The locker catches are of the spring-loaded type. • Doors and door frames: Communicating door frames in moulded wood are very wide, allowing ease of movement throughout the boat. • The doors are locked by lever type spring locks, with independent locking device. • Flooring and leatherwork: • The cabin mattresses have removable covers (standard • version: ecru and blue spots) and the standard saloon cushions covered in undyed leather (Fiesta one foam) are easy to look after and resistant. • The floorboards are made of varnished hydropont (marine quality) with a thin black line. They have an excellent finish, and are silent, easy to maintain, strong and insulating. Additional Description - POWER SUPPLY  • The 12 V electric circuit is supplied by two 140 A lights and service batteries. • The battery isolation switches (+/-), located in the aft cabin, protect the circuit. • A voltmeter and ammeter enable good management of the battery installation. - ELECTRICAL NETWORK - • Specific beams are inlaid in the deck to supply the integrated lighting in the deckhead as well as various electrical appliances (pumps, windlass, navigation lights, etc.). • Pre-cabled sheaths are pre-positioned to make it easier to install options. - BATTERIES CHARGING - • By alternator (power depending on engine specifications) attached to the engine. • 220 V shore power supply (protected by a circuit breaker). - ELECTRIC PANEL - • A 12 V backlit electric panel, 16 functions (with labels and identification) is located above the chart table. • A cigarette lighter socket is located on the panel. • The electric panel provides power consumption information: the capacity of the various tanks can be visualised with a water gauge using a selector knob. - LIGHTING AND SOCKETS - • 21 halogen lights (reading spotlights) diffuse light for greater comfort inside. • 5 power outlets have been installed (in the cabins, galley and above the chart table). • Navigation lights: • Anchor light. • Steaming light. Additional Description • Headroom: 1.96 m. • 1 size 4 hinged porthole with blind on side of coachroof. • Laminated white worktop. • High moulded wood fiddle around the worktop to prevent objects from falling. • Double sink with mixer tap. • Seawater foot pump or refrigerated cabinet drain by three-way sluice. • Polyester 110 L insulated refrigerated cabinet, which opens from the top. • Wastebin on door under worktop. • Cabinet with storage shelves under worktop. • Gimballed 2 ring stove with oven/grill. • S/S stove protection bar/dishcloth rail. • Bottle storage. • Lateral storage spaces with doors along the hull above the worktop. One of these storage spaces can take a microwave (electric socket accessible) and a S/S paper towel holder. • Crumb collector in flooring. Additional Description • The Sail Drive diesel engine is mounted in a ventilated and soundproof compartment, on a frame that is structurally part of the hull It was chosen following B�n�teau specification requirements (reliability, low vibration, reduced emission of harmful gases, compactness). • It is equipped with sea water filters. • The propeller (Volvo) is foldable (duckbeak) to reduce underwater resistance and thus improve boat performance. Its size is related to its horse power. • The starter and control panel is located outside near the wheel. • The Spinlock Flush Racing engine control lever is built-in to the sides of the cockpit. • The rotomoulded diesel fuel tank, located under the portside stern berth, has a 200 L capacity and is equipped with an electric gauge, a primary filter and a remote stop valve. Its aluminium filler hole is located on deck to the rear of the cockpit. • A 12 V - 110 A battery is specifically for the use of starting the engine Additional Description • The hull is made of solid GRP laminate. Hull capping and occasional reinforced areas (keel, rudder, chain plates, deck line), strengthen the overall structure. • The hull is optimally protected from osmosis phenomena, thanks to the application of vinylester resin precoating. • A structural solid laminate inner structural grid is achieved through the use of biaxial and unidirectional material. It is glued to the hull and randomly laminated. Its structural function is important, since it makes it possible to pick out all the pressure and stress points (chain plate, shroud, keel, and rudder tie rods, etc.) guaranteeing even distribution and less strain on the hull. It also ensures a good finish to the bilges and simplifies cleaning and maintenance. • The structural bulkheads made of marine plywood are sealed to the hull for extra rigidity. • The hull is white or grey in colour, with grey livery. Additional Description • The deck is built in sandwich (fibreglass/balsa/GRP) for an optimal rigidity-lightness ratio. • There are solid laminate reinforcement areas under the deck gear (winches, tracks, chain plates, cleats). • All the working and movement areas on the deck have been given a non-skid gel coat pattern. • The whole of the deck has been given a solid laminate inner lining, including the structural beams, which are sealed to the deck to give a perfect finish (integrated lighting, finish, access to deck gear fitting screws, etc.)

Blackberries The feedback provided by over 550 owners of the First 40.7 has been instrumental for Farr Yacht Design and the Bénéteau Design Team to create the NEW Beneteau First 44.7. The First 40.7, designed by the same team, is a world best seller with a record of race titles, including an IMS World Championship. Her success is not due to race results alone. The 40.7 offers rare versatility, outstanding value, and consistently high resale value as will the NEW Beneteau First 44.7 Additional Description • This version of the accommodation plan has 3 cabins (1 to the bow and two aft) and 2 heads. • It facilitates movement from one part of the boat to another, has great storage capacity and comfort and a sober atmosphere. • The woodwork is in pear-tree coloured Mukali wood with fiddles and mouldings in solid wood. • The light colour of the woodwork gives a greater feeling of space. • Storage: There are several storage spaces making life easier aboard. They are equipped with ventilation systems. (Some of the storage lockers are "removable" to help lighten the boat, which is necessary for regattas). • The locker catches are of the spring-loaded type. • Doors and door frames: Communicating door frames in moulded wood are very wide, allowing ease of movement throughout the boat. • The doors are locked by lever type spring locks, with independent locking device. • Flooring and leatherwork: • The cabin mattresses have removable covers (standard • version: ecru and blue spots) and the standard saloon cushions covered in undyed leather (Fiesta one foam) are easy to look after and resistant. • The floorboards are made of varnished hydropont (marine quality) with a thin black line. They have an excellent finish, and are silent, easy to maintain, strong and insulating. One of these storage spaces can take a microwave (electric socket accessible) and an S/S paper towel holder. • Crumb collector in flooring. Its size is related to its horse power. • The starter and control panel is located outside near the wheel. • The Spinlock Flush Racing engine control lever is built-in to the sides of the cockpit. • The rotomoulded diesel fuel tank, located under the portside stern berth, has a 200 L capacity and is equipped with an electric gauge, a primary filter and a remote stop valve. Its aluminium filler hole is located on deck to the rear of the cockpit. • A 12 V - 110 A battery is specifically for the use of starting the engine Additional Description • The hull is made of solid laminated GRP. Hull capping and occasional reinforced areas (keel, rudder, chain plates, deck line), strengthen the overall structure. • The hull is optimally protected from osmosis phenomena, thanks to the application of vinylester resin precoating. • A structural solid laminate inner structural grid is achieved through the use of biaxial and unidirectional material. It is glued to the hull and randomly laminated. Its structural function is important, since it makes it possible to pick out all the pressure and stress points (chain plate, shroud, keel, and rudder tie rods, etc.) guaranteeing even distribution and less strain on the hull. It also ensures a good finish to the bilges and simplifies cleaning and maintenance. • The structural bulkheads made of marine plywood are sealed to the hull for extra rigidity. • The hull is white or grey in colour, with grey livery. Additional Description • The deck is built in sandwich (fibreglass/balsa/GRP) for an optimal rigidity-lightness ratio. • There are solid laminate reinforcement areas under the deck gear (winches, tracks, chain plates, cleats). • All the working and movement areas on the deck have been given a non-skid gel coat pattern. • The whole of the deck has been given a solid laminate inner lining, including the structural beams, which are sealed to the deck to give a perfect finish (integrated lighting, finish, access to deck gear fitting screws, etc.)
Française Pour obtenir des données et des photos à jour, veuillez nous contacter par e-mail. Deuxième propriétaire, jamais affrété. Bon état général. Siège de bateau disponible. Ce FIRST 44.7 est une 2eme main, jamais loué. Trés bon état général. Place de port disponible. Instruments Vhf Raymarine, echo Raymarine, Raymarine autopilota, log, Raymarine GPS, Raymarine wind station, batteries 3. • Hélice à trois coups à hauteur variable. Intérieur/intérieurs Cabines 3, couchettes 6 + 2, salles de bains 2, toilettes marines, douche 2 + 1, cuisine 2 feux, four, réfrigérateur, chaudière. Mûres Les commentaires fournis par plus de 550 propriétaires du First 40.7 ont joué un rôle déterminant pour Farr Yacht Design et le Bénéteau Design Team pour créer le NEW Beneteau First 44.7. Le First 40.7, conçu par la même équipe, est un best-seller mondial avec un record de titres de course, y compris un Championnat du Monde IMS. Son succès n’est pas dû aux seuls résultats de la course. Le 40.7 offre une polyvalence rare, une valeur exceptionnelle et une valeur de revente toujours élevée, tout comme le NEW Beneteau First 44.7 Description supplémentaire • Cette version du plan d’hébergement comprend 3 cabines (1 à l’avant et deux à l’arrière) et 2 têtes. • Il facilite le déplacement d’une partie du bateau à l’autre, a une grande capacité de stockage et de confort et une atmosphère sobre. • Les boiseries sont en bois mukali de couleur poirier avec des violons et des moulures en bois massif. • La couleur claire des boiseries donne une plus grande sensation d’espace. • Stockage : Il y a plusieurs espaces de rangement qui facilitent la vie à bord. Ils sont équipés de systèmes de ventilation. (Certains casiers de rangement sont « amovibles » pour aider à alléger le bateau, ce qui est nécessaire pour les régates). • Les prises de casiers sont de type ressort. • Portes et cadres de porte : Les cadres de porte communicants en bois moulé sont très larges, ce qui permet une facilité de mouvement dans tout le bateau. • Les portes sont verrouillées par des serrures à ressort de type levier, avec dispositif de verrouillage indépendant. • Plancher et maroquinerie : • Les matelas de cabine ont des housses amovibles (standard • version : taches écru et bleues) et les coussins berline standard recouverts de cuir non propre (Fiesta one foam) sont faciles à s’occuper et résistants. • Les planchers sont faits d’hydropont verni (qualité marine) avec une fine ligne noire. Ils ont une excellente finition, et sont silencieux, faciles à entretenir, forts et isolants. Description supplémentaire - ALIMENTATION ÉLECTRIQUE  • Le circuit électrique 12 V est alimenté par deux feux 140 A et des batteries de service. • Les interrupteurs d’isolation de la batterie (+/-), situés dans la cabine arrière, protègent le circuit. • Un voltmètre et un ammètre permettent une bonne gestion de l’installation de la batterie. - RÉSEAU ÉLECTRIQUE - • Des poutres spécifiques sont incrustées dans le pont pour alimenter l’éclairage intégré de la tête de pont ainsi que divers appareils électriques (pompes, lame de vent, feux de navigation, etc.). • Les gaines pré-câblées sont prépositionnées pour faciliter l’installation d’options. - CHARGE DES BATTERIES - • Par alternateur (puissance selon les spécifications du moteur) attaché au moteur. • alimentation à terre de 220 V (protégée par un disjoncteur). - PANNEAU ÉLECTRIQUE - • Un panneau électrique rétroéclairé de 12 V, 16 fonctions (avec étiquettes et identification) est situé au-dessus de la table graphique. • Une prise de briquet est située sur le panneau. • Le panneau électrique fournit des informations sur la consommation d’énergie : la capacité des différents réservoirs peut être visualisée à l’aide d’une jauge d’eau à l’aide d’un bouton sélecteur. - ÉCLAIRAGE ET DOUILLES - • 21 lampes halogènes (projecteurs de lecture) diffusent la lumière pour plus de confort à l’intérieur. • 5 prises de courant ont été installées (dans les cabines, la cuisine et au-dessus de la table graphique). • Feux de navigation : • Lumière d’ancrage. • Lumière fumante. Description supplémentaire • Espace libre : 1,96 m. • Hublot articulé de 1 taille 4 avec stores sur le côté du toit de carroof. • Plan de travail blanc laminé. • Violon en bois moulé élevé autour du plan de travail pour empêcher les objets de tomber. • Double évier avec mélangeur à robinet. • Pompe à pieds d’eau de mer ou drain d’armoire réfrigérée par écluse à trois sens. • Armoire réfrigérée isolée Polyester 110 L, qui s’ouvre par le haut. • Poubelle sur la porte sous le plan de travail. • Armoire avec étagères de rangement sous plan de travail. • Poêle à 2 annelés avec four/gril. • Barre de protection de poêle S/S/rail de torchon. • Rangement des bouteilles. • Espaces de rangement laraux avec portes le long de la coque au-dessus du plan de travail. L’un de ces espaces de rangement peut prendre un four à micro-ondes (prise électrique accessible) et un porte-serviettes en papier S/S. • Collecteur de miettes dans le plancher. Description supplémentaire • Le moteur diesel Sail Drive est monté dans un compartiment ventilé et insonorisé, sur un cadre qui fait structurellement partie de la coque Il a été choisi selon les exigences de spécification B n teau (fiabilité, faible vibration, réduction des émissions de gaz nocifs, compacité). • Il est équipé de filtres à eau de mer. • L’hélice (Volvo) est pliable (duckbeak) pour réduire la résistance sous-marine et ainsi améliorer les performances du bateau. Sa taille est liée à sa puissance de cheval. • Le panneau de démarrage et de commande est situé à l’extérieur près de la roue. • Le levier de commande du moteur Spinlock Flush Racing est intégré sur les côtés du poste de pilotage. • Le réservoir de carburant diesel rotomoulded, situé sous le poste d’amarrage arrière bâbord, a une capacité de 200 L et est équipé d’une jauge électrique, d’un filtre primaire et d’une soupape d’arrêt à distance. Son trou de remplissage en aluminium est situé sur le pont à l’arrière du poste de pilotage. • Une batterie 12 V - 110 A est spécifiquement pour l’utilisation du démarrage du moteur Description supplémentaire • La coque est faite de GRP laminé solide. Le plafonnement de la coque et les zones renforcées occasionnellement (quille, gouvernail de direction, plaques de chaîne, ligne de pont) renforcent la structure globale. • La coque est parfaitement protégée contre les phénomènes d’osmose, grâce à l’application de précoating de résine de vinylester. • Une grille structurale solide en stratifié intérieur est obtenue grâce à l’utilisation de matériaux biaxiaux et unidirectionnels. Il est collé à la coque et laminé au hasard. Sa fonction structurelle est importante, puisqu’elle permet de choisir tous les points de pression et de contrainte (tôleuse à chaîne, linceul, quille, barres de attache de gouvernail, etc.) garantissant une distribution uniforme et moins de pression sur la coque. Il assure également une bonne finition des cales et simplifie le nettoyage et l’entretien. • Les cloisons structurales en contreplaqué marin sont scellées à la coque pour une rigidité supplémentaire. • La coque est de couleur blanche ou grise, avec livrée grise. Description supplémentaire • La plate-forme est construite en sandwich (fibre de verre/balsa/GRP) pour un rapport rigidité-légèreté optimal. • Il y a des zones solides de renfort stratifié sous l’équipement de pont (treuils, chenilles, plaques de chaîne, crampons). • Toutes les zones de travail et de mouvement sur le pont ont reçu un motif de manteau de gel non dérapage. • L’ensemble de la plate-forme a reçu une doublure intérieure en stratifié solide, y compris les poutres structurelles, qui sont scellées sur le pont pour donner une finition parfaite (éclairage intégré, finition, accès aux vis de montage de l’équipement de pont, etc.)
Deutsch Für aktuelle Daten und Fotos kontaktieren Sie uns bitte per E-Mail. Zweiter Besitzer, nie Charter. Guter Gesamtstatus. Bootssitz verfügbar. Ce FIRST 44.7 est une 2eme main, jamais loué. Trés bon état général. Place de port verfügbar. Instrumente Vhf Raymarine, Echo Raymarine, Raymarine Autopilota, Log, Raymarine GPS, Raymarine Windstation, Batterien 3. • Drei-a-Schuss-Propeller bei variabler Steigung. Innen-/Innenausstattung Kabinen 3, Liegeplätze 6 + 2, Badezimmer 2, Marinetoilette, Dusche 2 + 1, Küche 2 Feuer, Backofen, Kühlschrank, Kessel. Brombeeren Das Feedback von über 550 Besitzern der First 40.7 war maßgeblich an Farr Yacht Design und dem Bénéteau Design Team beteiligt, um das NEW Beneteau First 44.7 zu schaffen. Die First 40.7, die vom selben Team entworfen wurde, ist ein Weltbestseller mit einem Rekord an Renntiteln, einschließlich einer IMS-Weltmeisterschaft. Ihr Erfolg ist nicht allein auf rennergebnisse zurückzuführen. Der 40.7 bietet seltene Vielseitigkeit, herausragenden Wert und konstant hohen Wiederverkaufswert wie der NEW Beneteau First 44.7 Zusätzliche Beschreibung • Diese Version des Unterkunftsplans hat 3 Kabinen (1 zum Bug und zwei hinter eft) und 2 Köpfe. • Es erleichtert die Bewegung von einem Teil des Bootes zum anderen, hat große Lagerkapazität und Komfort und eine nüchterne Atmosphäre. • Die Holzarbeiten sind aus birnenfarbenem Mukali-Holz mit Geigen und Formteilen aus Massivholz. • Die helle Farbe der Holzarbeiten gibt ein größeres Raumgefühl. • Lagerung: Es gibt mehrere Stauräume, die das Leben an Bord erleichtern. Sie sind mit Lüftungssystemen ausgestattet. (Einige der Schließfächer sind "abnehmbar", um das Boot aufzuhellen, was für Regatten notwendig ist). • Die Schließfachfänge sind vom federbelasteten Typ. • Türen und Türrahmen: Die Türrahmen aus Geformtem Holz sind sehr breit und ermöglichen eine einfache Bewegung im gesamten Boot. • Die Türen sind durch Hebel-Federschlösser mit unabhängiger Verriegelungsvorrichtung verriegelt. • Bodenbeläge und Lederarbeiten: • Die Kabinenmatratzen haben abnehmbare Abdeckungen (Standard • Version: Ecru und blaue Flecken) und die Standard-Limousinenkissen aus ungeschminkten Leder (Fiesta one Foam) sind leicht zu betreuen und widerstandsfähig. • Die Dielen bestehen aus lackiertem Hydropont (Marinequalität) mit einer dünnen schwarzen Linie. Sie haben eine ausgezeichnete Oberfläche, und sind leise, leicht zu warten, stark und isolierend. Zusätzliche Beschreibung - STROMVERSORGUNG  • Der 12 V Stromkreis wird von zwei 140 A-Leuchten und Servicebatterien geliefert. • Die Batterie-Isolationsschalter (+/-), die sich in der Achterkabine befinden, schützen die Schaltung. • Ein Voltmeter und ein Amperemeter ermöglichen eine gute Verwaltung der Batterieinstallation. - ELEKTRISCHES NETZWERK - • Spezielle Balken werden im Deck eingelegt, um die integrierte Beleuchtung im Deckkopf sowie verschiedene elektrische Geräte (Pumpen, Winde, Navigationslichter usw.) zu versorgen. • Vorverkabelte Hüllen sind vorpositioniert, um die Installation von Optionen zu vereinfachen. - BATTERIEN AUFLADEN - • Durch Lichtmaschine (Leistung je nach Motorspezifikation) am Motor befestigt. • 220 V Landnetzteil (geschützt durch einen Leistungsschalter). - ELEKTRISCHE PANEL - • Ein 12 V hinterleuchtetes elektrisches Panel, 16 Funktionen (mit Etiketten und Identifikation) befindet sich über der Diagrammtabelle. • Eine Zigarettenanzünder-Buchse befindet sich auf der Platte. • Das elektrische Panel liefert Verbrauchsinformationen: Die Kapazität der verschiedenen Tanks kann mit einem Wassermessgerät mit einem Wahlknopf visualisiert werden. - BELEUCHTUNG UND SOCKETS - • 21 Halogenleuchten (Lesestrahler) diffuses Licht für mehr Komfort im Inneren. • 5 Steckdosen installiert wurden (in den Kabinen, in der Galeere und über dem Charttisch). • Navigationslichter: • Ankerlicht. • Dampflicht. Zusätzliche Beschreibung • Kopffreiheit: 1,96 m. • 1 Größe 4 aufklappbares Bullauge mit Blind auf der Seite des Kutschendaches. • Laminierte weiße Arbeitsplatte. • Hochgeformte Holzgeige um die Arbeitsplatte, um zu verhindern, dass Gegenstände fallen. • Doppelwaschbecken mit Hahnenmischer. • Meerwasser-Fußpumpe oder Kühlschrankabfluss durch Dreiwege-Schleuse. • Polyester 110 L isolierter Kühlschrank, der sich von oben öffnet. • Abfalleimer an der Tür unter der Arbeitsplatte. • Schrank mit Regalen unter der Arbeitsplatte. • Gimballed 2 Ringherd mit Backofen/Grill. • S/S Herdschutzbügel/Geschirrtuchschiene. • Flaschenlagerung. • Seitliche Abstellräume mit Türen entlang des Rumpfes über der Arbeitsplatte. Einer dieser Abstellräume kann eine Mikrowelle (elektrische Steckdose zugänglich) und einen S/S-Papierhandtuchhalter nehmen. • Crumb-Kollektor im Bodenbelag. Zusätzliche Beschreibung • Der Sail Drive Dieselmotor ist in einem belüfteten und schalldichten Fach montiert, auf einem Rahmen, der strukturell Teil des Rumpfes ist Es wurde nach B n teau Spezifikation Anforderungen gewählt (Zuverlässigkeit, geringe Vibrationen, reduzierte Emission von schädlichen Gasen, Kompaktheit). • Es ist mit Meerwasserfiltern ausgestattet. • Der Propeller (Volvo) ist klappbar (Entenschnabel), um den Unterwasserwiderstand zu reduzieren und so die Bootsleistung zu verbessern. Seine Größe hängt mit seiner Pferdestärke zusammen. • Das Starter- und Bedienfeld befindet sich außerhalb des Rades. • Der Motorsteuerhebel Spinlock Flush Racing ist an den Seiten des Cockpits eingebaut. • Der rotomoulded Diesel-Kraftstofftank, der sich unter dem hecken Liegeplatz befindet, hat eine Kapazität von 200 l und ist mit einem elektrischen Messgerät, einem Primärfilter und einem Fernstoppventil ausgestattet. Das Aluminium-Füllloch befindet sich an Deck auf der Rückseite des Cockpits. • Eine 12 V - 110 Batterie ist speziell für den Einsatz des Motors Zusätzliche Beschreibung • Der Rumpf besteht aus massivem laminiertem GFK. Rumpfverkappung und gelegentlich verstärkte Bereiche (Kiel, Ruder, Kettenplatten, Decklinie), stärken die Gesamtstruktur. • Der Rumpf ist dank der Anwendung von Vinylesterharz-Vorbeschichtung optimal vor Osmosephänomenen geschützt. • Durch den Einsatz von biaxialem und unidirektionatorischem Material wird ein strukturelles festes Laminat-Innenstrukturgitter erreicht. Es wird an den Rumpf geklebt und zufällig laminiert. Seine strukturelle Funktion ist wichtig, da es möglich ist, alle Druck- und Spannungspunkte (Kettenplatte, Tuch, Kiel und Ruderzugstangen usw.) herauszupicken, die eine gleichmäßige Verteilung und geringere Belastung des Rumpfes garantieren. Es sorgt auch für einen guten Abgang der Bilgen und vereinfacht die Reinigung und Wartung. • Die strukturellen Schotte aus Marinesperrholz sind für zusätzliche Steifigkeit am Rumpf versiegelt. • Der Rumpf ist weiß oder grau gefärbt, mit grauer Lackierung. Zusätzliche Beschreibung • Das Deck ist in Sandwich (Fiberglas/Balsa/GFK) für ein optimales Steifigkeits-Leichtheitsverhältnis eingebaut. • Unter dem Decksgetriebe befinden sich feste Laminatverstärkungsbereiche (Winden, Schienen, Kettenplatten, Stollen). • Alle Arbeits- und Bewegungsbereiche auf dem Deck haben ein rutschfestes Gel-Beschichtungsmuster erhalten. • Das gesamte Deck hat ein solides Laminat-Innenfutter erhalten, einschließlich der strukturellen Balken, die zum Deck versiegelt sind, um eine perfekte Oberfläche zu geben (integrierte Beleuchtung, Finish, Zugang zu Deck-Getriebe-Fitting-Schrauben, etc.)
Español Para obtener datos y fotos actualizados, póngase en contacto con nosotros por correo electrónico. Segundo propietario, nunca carta. Buen estado general. Asiento de barco disponible. Ce PRIMERA 44.7 est une 2eme main, jamais loué. Trés bon état général. Lugar de puerto disponible. Instrumentos Vhf Raymarine, echo Raymarine, Raymarine autopilota, log, Raymarine GPS, estación de viento Raymarine, baterías 3. • Hélice de tres veces a paso variable. Interiores/interiores Cabañas 3, literas 6 + 2, baños 2, aseo marino, ducha 2 + 1, cocina 2 fuegos, horno, nevera, caldera. Moras Los comentarios proporcionados por más de 550 propietarios del First 40.7 han sido fundamentales para que Farr Yacht Design y el equipo de diseño de Bénéteau creen el NUEVO Beneteau First 44.7. El First 40.7, diseñado por el mismo equipo, es un best seller mundial con un récord de títulos de carreras, incluyendo un Campeonato Mundial de IMS. Su éxito no se debe únicamente a los resultados de la carrera. El 40.7 ofrece una versatilidad rara, un valor excepcional y un alto valor de reventa consistentemente alto, al igual que el NUEVO Beneteau First 44.7 Descripción adicional • Esta versión del plan de alojamiento tiene 3 cabinas (1 a la proa y dos a popa) y 2 cabezas. • Facilita el movimiento de una parte del barco a otra, tiene gran capacidad de almacenamiento y confort y un ambiente sobrio. • La carpintería es de madera Mukali de color peral con violines y molduras en madera maciza. • El color claro de la carpintería da una mayor sensación de espacio. • Almacenamiento: Hay varios espacios de almacenamiento que facilitan la vida a bordo. Están equipadas con sistemas de ventilación. (Algunos de los casilleros de almacenamiento son "extraíbles" para ayudar a aligerar el barco, que es necesario para las regatas). • Las capturas del casillero son del tipo de resorte. • Puertas y marcos de puertas: Los marcos de las puertas de comunicación en madera moldeada son muy anchos, lo que permite facilitar el movimiento en todo el barco. • Las puertas están bloqueadas por cerraduras de resorte tipo palanca, con dispositivo de bloqueo independiente. • Suelos y cuero: • Los colchones de cabina tienen cubiertas extraíbles (estándar • versión: ecru y manchas azules) y los cojines de salón estándar recubiertos de cuero sin tes (Fiesta one foam) son fáciles de cuidar y resistentes. • Las tablas de suelo están hechas de hidropont barnizado (calidad marina) con una fina línea negra. Tienen un acabado excelente, y son silenciosos, fáciles de mantener, fuertes y aislantes. Descripción adicional - SUMINISTRO DE ENERGÍA  • El circuito eléctrico de 12 V se suministra mediante dos luces de 140 A y baterías de servicio. • Los interruptores de aislamiento de la batería (+/-), situados en la cabina de popa, protegen el circuito. • Un voltímetro y un amperímetro permiten una buena gestión de la instalación de la batería. - RED ELECTRICA - • Las vigas específicas están enlazadas en la cubierta para suministrar la iluminación integrada en la cubierta, así como varios aparatos eléctricos (bombas, windlass, luces de navegación, etc.). • Las fundas pre-cableadas están preposicionadas para facilitar la instalación de opciones. - CARGA DE BATERIAS - • Por alternador (potencia dependiendo de las especificaciones del motor) conectado al motor. • Fuente de alimentación de 220 V en tierra (protegida por un disyuntor). - PANEL ELECTRICO - • Un panel eléctrico retroiluminado de 12 V, 16 funciones (con etiquetas e identificación) se encuentra encima de la tabla de gráficos. • En el panel hay una toma de encendedor de cigarrillos. • El panel eléctrico proporciona información sobre el consumo de energía: la capacidad de los distintos tanques se puede visualizar con un medidor de agua mediante una perilla selectora. - ILUMINACIÓN Y SOCKETS - • 21 luces halógenas (focos de lectura) difusa de luz para mayor comodidad en el interior. • Se han instalado 5 tomacorrientes (en las cabinas, la cocina y por encima de la mesa del gráfico). • Luces de navegación: • Luz de anclaje. • Luz humeante. Descripción adicional • Espacio para la cabeza: 1,96 m. • 1 ojo de buey con bisagras de 4 tallas con persiana en el costado del autocar. • Encimera blanca laminada. • El violín de madera moldeada alto alrededor de la encimera para evitar que los objetos caigan. • Doble fregadero con mezclador de grifo. • Bomba de pie de agua de mar o drenaje de gabinete refrigerado por esclusa de tres vías. • Armario frigorífico aislado de poliéster 110 L, que se abre desde la parte superior. • Wastebin en la puerta bajo la encimera. • Armario con estantes de almacenamiento bajo encimera. • Gimballed 2 ring stove con horno/parrilla. • Barra de protección de estufa S/S/carril de lavavajillas. • Almacenamiento de botellas. • Espacios de almacenamiento laterales con puertas a lo largo del casco por encima de la encimera. Uno de estos espacios de almacenamiento puede tomar un microondas (enchufe eléctrico accesible) y un soporte de toalla de papel S/S. • Colector de migas en suelos. Descripción adicional • El motor diésel Sail Drive está montado en un compartimento ventilado e insonorizado, sobre un bastidor que es estructuralmente parte del casco Fue elegido siguiendo los requisitos de especificación B n teau (fiabilidad, baja vibración, reducción de la emisión de gases nocivos, compactación). • Está equipado con filtros de agua de mar. • La hélice (Volvo) es plegable (pato) para reducir la resistencia subacuática y mejorar así el rendimiento del barco. Su tamaño está relacionado con su potencia de caballo. • El arrancador y el panel de control se encuentran fuera cerca de la rueda. • La palanca de control del motor Spinlock Flush Racing está incorporada a los lados de la cabina. • El tanque de combustible diésel rotomoldeado, situado bajo el atraque de popa junto al puerto, tiene una capacidad de 200 L y está equipado con un manómetro eléctrico, un filtro primario y una válvula de parada remota. Su orificio de relleno de aluminio se encuentra en la cubierta de la parte trasera de la cabina. • Una batería de 12 V - 110 A es específicamente para el uso de arranque del motor Descripción adicional • El casco está hecho de GRP laminado sólido. El tapado del casco y las áreas reforzadas ocasionales (quilla, timón, placas de cadena, línea de cubierta), fortalecen la estructura general. • El casco está protegido de los fenómenos de ósmosis, gracias a la aplicación de revestimiento de resina de vinylester. • Se logra una rejilla estructural interior de laminado sólido estructural mediante el uso de material biaxial y unidireccional. Está pegado al casco y laminado al azar. Su función estructural es importante, ya que permite seleccionar todos los puntos de presión y tensión (placa de cadena, cubierta, quilla y tirantes de timón, etc.) garantizando una distribución uniforme y menos tensión en el casco. También garantiza un buen acabado a las sentinas y simplifica la limpieza y el mantenimiento. • Los mamparos estructurales de madera contrachapada marina están sellados al casco para una mayor rigidez. • El casco es de color blanco o gris, con librea gris. Descripción adicional • La cubierta está construida en sándwich (fibra de vidrio/balsa/GRP) para una relación óptima rigidez-ligereza. • Hay áreas de refuerzo laminado sólido debajo del engranaje de la cubierta (cabrestantes, orugas, placas de cadena, tacos). • Todas las áreas de trabajo y movimiento en la cubierta han recibido un patrón de capa de gel antideslizante. • Toda la cubierta ha recibido un forro interior laminado sólido, incluyendo las vigas estructurales, que están selladas a la cubierta para dar un acabado perfecto (iluminación integrada, acabado, acceso a tornillos de ajuste de engranaje de cubierta, etc.)Mehr anzeigen

name: 2006 Bavaria Cruiser 462006 Bavaria Cruiser 46
description:
Bavaria Cruiser 46, imbarcazione dalle indiscusse doti crocieristiche, i due eleganti timoni a ruota gemelle in un grande e spazioso pozzetto, permettono agli ospiti di sfruttare al meglio lo spazio sul ponte. Il grande quadrato sottocoperta, l'ampio tavolo e la cucina sul lato sinistro con ampi gavoni e ripostigli, denotano la praticità e la comodità di questo modello Bavaria adatto per lunghe crociere. Questo 46' offre 6 posti letto in 3 cabine separate, di cui cabina armatore con locale wc separato dal locale doccia. Inoltre si aggiungono due posti letto nella dinette trasformabile. L'armamento con tutti i rinvii in pozzetto, oltre che alla per un controllo totale durante le manovre a vela in tutta sicurezza. Il generoso tavolo esterno dotato di prolunghe da spazio per 8 persone, per passare momenti di convivialità con gli ospiti o gli amici durante gli aperitivi o i pranzi . English Bavaria Cruiser 46, a boat with undisputed cruise skills, the two elegant twin wheel rudders in a large and spacious cockpit, allow guests to make the most of the space on the deck. The large square below deck, the large table and the kitchen on the left side with large lockers and storage rooms, denote the practicality and comfort of this Bavaria model suitable for long cruises. This 46' offers 6 beds in 3 separate cabins, including owner's cabin with separate toilet room from the shower room. In addition, two beds are added in the convertible dinette. The armament with all the referrals in the cockpit, as well as for total control during sailing maneuvers in complete safety. The generous outdoor table equipped with space extensions for 8 people, to spend moments of conviviality with guests or friends during aperitifs or lunches. Française Bavaria Cruiser 46, un bateau aux compétences de croisière incontestées, les deux élégants gouvernails à deux roues dans un cockpit grand et spacieux, permettent aux clients de profiter au maximum de l’espace sur le pont. La grande place sous le pont, la grande table et la cuisine sur le côté gauche avec de grands casiers et des salles de stockage, dénotent la praticité et le confort de ce modèle Bavaria adapté aux longues croisières. Ce 46' offre 6 lits dans 3 cabines séparées, y compris la cabine du propriétaire avec salle de toilette séparée de la salle de douche. De plus, deux lits sont ajoutés dans la dinette convertible. L’armement avec toutes les références dans le cockpit, ainsi que pour un contrôle total lors des manœuvres de navigation en toute sécurité. La généreuse table extérieure équipée d’extensions d’espace pour 8 personnes, pour passer des moments de convivialité avec des invités ou des amis lors d’apéritifs ou de déjeuners. Deutsch Bavaria Cruiser 46, ein Boot mit unbestrittenen Kreuzfahrtfähigkeiten, die beiden eleganten Doppelradruder in einem großen und geräumigen Cockpit, ermöglichen es den Gästen, den Platz auf dem Deck optimal zu nutzen. Der große Platz unter Deck, der große Tisch und die Küche auf der linken Seite mit großen Schließfächern und Abstellräumen, kennzeichnen die Funktionalität und den Komfort dieses Bavaria-Modells, das für lange Kreuzfahrten geeignet ist. Diese 46 'bietet 6 Betten in 3 separaten Kabinen, einschließlich der Eignerkabine mit separatem WC-Raum vom Duschbad. Zusätzlich sind zwei Betten in der umwandelbaren Dinette hinzugefügt. Die Bewaffnung mit allen Referenzen im Cockpit, sowie für die totale Kontrolle während Segelmanövern in völliger Sicherheit. Der großzügige Tisch im Freien ist mit Raumerweiterungen für 8 Personen ausgestattet, um Momente der Geselligkeit mit Gästen oder Freunden bei Aperitifs oder Mittagessen zu verbringen. Español Bavaria Cruiser 46, un barco con habilidades de crucero indiscutibles, los dos elegantes timones de doble rueda en una cabina grande y espaciosa, permiten a los huéspedes aprovechar al máximo el espacio en la cubierta. La gran plaza bajo cubierta, la gran mesa y la cocina en el lado izquierdo con grandes taquillas y trasteros, denotan la practicidad y comodidad de este modelo Bavaria adecuado para cruceros largos. Este 46 'ofrece 6 camas en 3 cabinas separadas, incluida la cabina del propietario con aseo separado del cuarto de ducha. Además, se añaden dos camas en el comedor convertible. El armamento con todas las referencias en la cabina, así como para un control total durante las maniobras de navegación con total seguridad. La generosa mesa exterior equipada con extensiones de espacio para 8 personas, para pasar momentos de convivencia con invitados o amigos durante aperitivos o almuerzos. Россию Bavaria Cruiser 46, лодка с бесспорными круизными навыками, два элегантных двухколесных руля в большом и просторном кокпите, позволяют гостям максимально использовать пространство на палубе. Большая площадь под палубой, большой стол и кухня с левой стороны с большими шкафчиками и складскими помещениями, обозначают практичность и комфорт этой модели Bavaria, подходящей для длительных круизов. Этот 46-дюймовый номер предлагает 6 кроватей в 3 отдельных каютах, включая каюту владельца с отдельной туалетной комнатой из душевой комнаты. Кроме того, две кровати добавлены в откидной столовой. Вооружение со всеми направлениями в кабине, а также для тотального контроля во время плавательных маневров в полной безопасности. Щедрый открытый стол, оборудованный пристройками для 8 человек, чтобы провести моменты веселья с гостями или друзьями во время аперитивов или обедов. description:
1989 WAUQUIEZ WAUQUIEZ AMPHITRITE MS 45 CC,
XBOAT ref 3749.This Amphitrite MS 45 is a habitable cruising monohull, solidly built by the Wauquiez shipyard. This fixed keel sailboat, rigged as a Sloop at the head, made by the naval architect Holman & Pye, is 13.6 m long and is also designed for offshore sailing. Production started in 1989 and ended in 1991. Central cockpit, a saloon allowing 360° vision with a table convertible into a double berth, 2 double cabins, a single berth, U-shaped galley equipped with a 3-burner stove. fires plus oven, a microwave, 2 refrigerators, pressurized hot water, 2 bathrooms with separate showers. 100hp Volkswagen engine with a MAXPROP 4-blade propeller, reliable and low consumption engine. INCIDENCE furling mainsail and genoa, Staysail with carabiner on releasable forestay, symmetrical spinnaker. B&G HYDRA 2000 control unit, SIMRAD autopilot, Computer with cartography, VHF Radio OCEAN RO4700 DSC ASN, FURUNO weather decoder, FURUNO radar. Bow thruster, 1500w electric windlass, diesel fuel heating. Deck redone in 2020, teak cockpit, dinghy davits, gangway. Deckhatch: 4 X Portholes: brass Insulation: foam Fuel tank (litre): 300 L. steel Fuel daytank (litre): 80 L. stainless steel Freshwater tank (litre): 2x 350 L. + 50 L. boiler Jabsco pump Blackwater tank (litre): 80 L. stainless steel Blackwater tank extraction: deck extraction + pump Greywater tank (litre): +/- 40 L. Wheel steering: mechanical Emergency tiller: - system is improved and updated in 2020. More info on paintwork: Hull professionally painted in 2020. Superstructure and deck have some rust spots. It is recommended that both be given a new paint system. Both were re-painted in 2019 before departure, crossing the Atlantic. Extra info: Rudder gearbox reduction system overhauled in 2020. New PSS Seal rudder shaft in 2020. Grey water tank system serviced in 2021 + inspection flange installed. New black/greywater seacock in 2019. New Jabsco freshwater pump in 2021. New Rule electric bilge pump in 2020. For sale by her 2nd owner this Colin Archer KVase 1350, a true blue water cruiser. After a beautiful 2,5 years of cruising the North Sea, the MED, the Caribbean waters and back it's now time to hand over de helm to a new owner. "Blue Scarlet" is a sturdy, Dutch built live-a-board yacht which offers a great deal of comfort, safety and is easy to sail. Her owners took care of their floating home and gave her many upgrades, maintained her well to be sure she's ready for a next voyage around the globe. She can be admired and inspected in our sales marina in Katwoude near Amsterdam, 7 days a week.

Model: DICK ZAAL SKARPSNO 44 Type: sailing yacht LOA (m): 13,50 LWL (m): 11,50 Beam (m): 4,10 Draft (m): 1,85 Year built: 1998 Launched: start of construction 1992, first time launched 1998 Builder: Mekon, Lemmer Country: The Netherlands Designer: Dick Zaal Displacement (t): 21 Hull material: steel Hull colour: blue Hull thickness (mm): keel 6 mm / keel > waterline 5 mm / waterline > deck 4 mm / deck & superstructure / cockpit 3 mm Hull shape: S-bilged Keel type: long keel Superstructure material: steel Superstructure (mm): 4 Deck plate thickness (mm): 4 Rubbing strake: stainless steel Deck material: steel Deck finish: non-skid paint Superstructure deck finish: paint Cockpit deck finish: Iroko and paint Antifouling (year): 2017 Dorades: 6 x stainless steel Deckhatch: 4 x Gebo Portholes: brass Insulation: BASF Styrodur foam plates Fuel tank (litre): 450 steel Fuel daytank (litre): 60 steel Freshwater tank (litre): 2 x 225 steel Blackwater tank (litre): never used - 150L steel Blackwater tank extraction: deck extraction Wheel steering: hydraulic + cable steering More info on hull: yes More info on paintwork: Hull above waterline painted in Awlgrip 2-component. Hull under the waterline is sandblasted in 2017 before applying new antifouling. Extra info: shore connection for permanent water supply. Extra info: Forepeak, Aft Cabin and Engine compartment have watertight aluminum doors. Inside of the hull is completely preserved with epoxywhich has been applied entirely manually to the skin and frames. Extra info: The Skarpsno has a modern s-shaped hull with an ascending sheer at the rear. This allows the water to be released much better than a Colin Archer and is therefore considerably faster and also easier to maneuver. This Skarpsno 44 double ender ketch is designed by the famous Dick Zaal and is a true quality, global voyaging yacht in Colin Archer style. This yacht is perfect and safe at all sea conditions, she moves pleasantly smooth and is easy to maneuver at all circumstances. The entire boat has been insulated with BASF Styrodur for extra comfort in both warmer and colder climates. "Orp" is equipped with an Isuzu 81 HP Marine engine (2015), a 4 Kva generator, solar panels, Webasto central heating and all navigation equipment you need. Please contact our sales office Monnickendam for a visit.

name: 1979 Van De Stadt 451979 Van De Stadt 45
description:
Beautifully lined and well sailing classic.


This classic van de Stadt 45 Pimpernel is a beautifully lined yacht, with good sailing characteristics. The yacht is solidly built and has a seaworthy center cockpit. With her shallow draft of 1.80 meters a yacht with a very large sailing range, where the high ballast share guarantees good stability. The interior provides for two cabins, a wet cell and saloon space in the bow. An aft cabin is available via the stern, which offers the possibility for two extra berths, or a nice storage space. This Van de Stadt is offered with, among other things, a recently overhauled Perkins diesel engine and bow thruster.


General
Hull shape: Full glass, semi S-frame hull shape. Semi-long keel bolted on.
Rudder: Pierced rudder
Windows: Lexan in stainless steel window profiles
Water displacement: Water displacement estimate
Ballast: Estimated ballast share
Other:
This beautifully lined yacht, designed by Ricus Van der Stadt, is the design type Pimpernel. At the time, however, the Pimpernel could be built in steel. Later, Van de Stadt provided the drawings for building a polyester variant, under the name Agulhas 45. This Van de Stadt Agulhas 45 is one of the few examples in polyester.
The design offers a very nice semi S-frame hull shape with attached keel. The yacht has a high ballast percentage, which ensures good stability. Solidly built in full glass laminate.

Accommodation
Saloons: Salon with kitchen, navigation table and dog cage. Passage to foreship, with port cabin, wet cell and cabin in the foreship. The aft cabin is accessible via the aft deck
Cabins: Front cabin, intermediate cabin on port side and forward cabin. Aft cabin stern
Berths: Double V-bed in fore ship, bunk bed in port cabin and dog cage in saloon. Two beds in aft cabin.
Cooker & fuel: 2-burner stainless steel stove, half - gimbal
Other:

Aft cabin annex storage space, accessible via aft deck.
Salon, with kitchen BB longitudinal sofa, SB lounge sofa, card table and dog cage
Passage to foredeck, with a wet cell to starboard and a cabin with bunk beds on port side
Forward cabin, with V-shaped bed.


Engine, electrics, water
Operating hours: Operating hours after revision: approximately 45 hours. Total from installation 3,245 hours.
Fuel tank number: Hull-integrated diesel tank in bilge
Cooling: Bowman cooling system
Propulsion: 3-Blade Fixed Propeller
Consumption: approximately 3-4 liters/hour
Solar panel: 2x solar panel on cabin roof
Water system: Foot pump for tank water. Extendable washbasin.
Water tank & material: Plastic water tank of 200 liters in saloon bench. Original water tank in bilge to be used with reservation.

Rigging
Rigging type: Sloop fractional rigging with cutter stay
Spars, stays: Solid aluminum mast profile
Winches: Lewmar 3-speed and 2-speed winches
Genoa: Genoa I and Genoa II
Breeding: High Aspect on leuvers
Foresail furling system: Proful roller-reef profile on forestay

Equipment
Windlass: Vetus electric windlass.
Swimming ladder: Swimming ladder on mirror
Sea rail: stainless steel

Grand Soleil 43 from 1998 in perfect condition for sale in Mallorca.
The Grand Soleil 43 is an elegant cruiser built by the Italian shipyard Cantiere del Pardo and designed by J & J. The generous hull design and sail plan provide outstanding sailing characteristics. Powered by a 56 Hp Yanmar diesel engine. Side decks, teak roof and cockpit, full navigation equipment, inverter, air conditioning, electric anchor windlass, etc...
Designed for comfortable touring, the Grand Soleil 43 remains one of the most popular models in the range.

name: 2007 Hanse 430e2007 Hanse 430e
description:
Epoxy version of the Hanse 430. Spacious and well equipped sailing yacht, with very good sailing characteristics. Watch the Video 1 below the images.


The hull of this Hanse 430 is the optional Epoxy version: Lighter, stiffer and moreover a high osmosis resistance. This generation Hanse is characterized by comfortable, but very good sailing characteristics with a lot of ease of use due to, among other things, the self-tacking jib and practical deck layout. From the range of Hanse yachts, the Hanse 430 is a beautifully lined and fast design. Just a little bigger in the 40-foot segment, but nevertheless good and easy to handle for a family or crew of two.


General
Hull shape: Hull of prepeg fiberglass in epoxy.
Steering: Jefa Twin Spoke steering wheels
Windows: Lewmar, to open windows is surface-mounted and lewmar deck hatches
Other:
The hull of this Hanse is made of prepeg fiberglass in epoxy, vacuum cured with CorecellTM foam. This results in a lighter and stiffer hull than the standard polyester version, in which the epoxy laminate also offers a high osmosis resistance. The Hanse 430e has a beautifully lined, modern hull shape, which naturally offers the good sailing characteristics that can be expected from a Hanse.
The superstructure has a sleek design, with all traps from the cockpit nicely concealed below deck. The yacht offers a very spacious, open cockpit with double steering position. This Hanse 430 has an extra optional stainless steel railing on the stern, to close the cockpit well. In addition, this railing provides two additional, foldable seats.

Accommodation
Saloons: Saloon with round seat to starboard and navigation table with seat to port
Cabins: Double aft cabin and spacious owner's cabin with en-suite wet cell in fore ship
Sleeping places: Additional sleeping space can be created on the chart table seat
Other:
The Hanse has a beautiful and practical and sleek interior, with three spacious cabins. If desired, the navigation corner with sofa can be converted into an extra sleeping place, or pilot cage. In the bow is a very nice and spacious owner's cabin, with en-suite wet cell and secretary with bench. The two aft cabins are also generously sized. The spacious saloon offers a round seat, with an opposite navigation corner, which is practically involved in the saloon space, as a cozy seating option. In addition to various standard practical solutions and storage spaces, this Hanse 430e is equipped with a number of extra practical things:

6x mosquito net fly screen for gates
4x mosquito screen for deck hatches
Extra inspection hatches in floor parts
Swingfeder mattress support
extra Johnson bilge pump in foreship


Engine, electrics, water
Year of manufacture: New engine installed under warranty in 2009
Propulsion: 3-Blade Varioprop
Water system: Also sea water pump in kitchen
Hot water: Boiler 25 liters on engine and 230V
Shore power: 2x 15 meter shore power cable
Other:
Teflon cover plate for Saildrive

Various extra blocks and stoppers

A true sailing and cruising machine from the hand of Satellite Yacht Design. Tyfoon is a well balanced yacht, stiff, strong and relatively lightweight hull. Built for the discerning sailor. name: 1999 Wauquiez 43 Pilot Saloon1999 Wauquiez 43 Pilot Saloon
description:
Beautiful and very well built sailing yacht, with fantastic deck saloon and very good sailing characteristics


Beautiful lined and very good sailing deck saloon yacht. The Wauquiez 43 Pilot Saloon is a very well-built Blue Water Cruiser, with a beautiful stay. The yacht offers a raised round seat in the saloon with panoramic views and a spectacular owner's cabin in the stern. This Pilot Saloon 43 is very well equipped, including boom furling furling mainsail, electric genoa furler, second forestay with self-tacking jib and electric halyard winch. Technically well equipped, including bow thruster, generator, heating and upgrade of navigation electronics.


General
Other:

Replace valves in 2014

The Wauquiez 43 Pilot Saloon inherits all the valuable experience gained from the construction of its bigger sisters, the 60, 54 and 48 Pilot Saloon. The yard has thus been able to very nicely incorporate the essence of the unique Pilot Saloon concept in 43 feet: elegance, performance, spectacular panoramic view from the raised saloon and at the navigation corner. Concentration of all technical components in an easily accessible engine room and a spacious galley under the panoramic windscreen.
Practical use of height increased the floor space in part of the saloon area to create an interior with a true panoramic view from the inside. Ed Dubois and Andrew Winch, the master designers, also managed to keep the center of gravity as low as possible. The round seat is placed just behind the large tinted surface-mounted windows, so that you can enjoy the view while sitting comfortably.


Accommodation
Material, colours: Light interior from Maple (Maple).
Saloons: Beautiful deck saloon, with raised round seat.
Cabins: Spacious owner's cabin in stern, beautiful guest cabin in foreship and extra cabin starboard-midships
Berths: Beautiful center line double bed in aft cabin. V-shaped bed in forward cabin. Extra berth in third cabin SB.
TV: TV-Flat screen in lounge
Cooker & fuel: Neptune 5000 stainless steel 3-burner gas comfort, semi-gimbal from 2018
Other:

Extra closet space in all cabins.

The layout of the salon offers a split-level floor, which makes use of the full width of the interior space in essential places and creates a beautiful salon space. Naturally, the round seat has been raised to such a height that a full panoramic view of the round seat is possible. In addition, the engine room has been placed under the saloon floor, which means that almost 20 percent more living space can be added compared to a traditional layout. The residence of the owner and the guests is separated for total privacy. Both the fore and aft cabins each have their own spacious, luxurious bathroom. Because the deck lines and cockpit floor are slightly raised, there is more volume in the stern, creating a spacious owner's cabin with freestanding bed. In addition to a forward and aft cabin, this Pilot Saloon 43, amidships, offers a third cabin. with extra sleeping place and plenty of closet space.
The kitchen has a special place on board. It has the safe and compact dimensions necessary for the use of a galley on the high seas, but also all the assets of a kitchen fully equipped to prepare good dishes on board. Given the practical and comfortable interior of the Pilot Saloon, the yacht is also ideally suited for longer stays on board.


Engine, electrics, water
Propulsion: Brunton's 3-blade feathering propeller, for optimum forward and reverse pitch.
Consumption: Consumption about 3-4 liters at cruising speed
Control panel: Switch panel at chart table
Alternator: Spare alternator present
Hot water: 40 liter boiler on 220V & engine cooling circuit
Other:

Various spare parts, such as filters, alternator, propeller shaft and 3-blade fixed propeller.
Propeller shaft with water-lubricated Volvo Seal propeller shaft seal

Under the raised saloon floor and round seat of the Pilot Saloon 43, there is a beautiful technical room, which is easily accessible through a full-fledged door. The engine, which is built under the saloon floor, is also easily accessible through (floor) hatches.

Rigging
Spars, stays: White sprayed mast
Winches: Lewmar Ocean self-tailing
Genoa reefing system: Electric Profurl roller reef profile for Genoa, from 2014
Jib: Self-tacking jib, on second forestay: 2014
Foresail furling system: Profurl furling profile for turning jib
Other:

Luff profile on mast -for the purpose of roller reef system- replaced 2019
Boom stabilizer for mainsail
Boom furling furling mainsail
Double forestay with genoa on electric genoa furler and self-tacking jib on second forestay.

The performance of this yacht designed by Dubois confirms the reputation of both the architect and the shipyard: The Pilot Saloon 43 has a high speed, pleasant seas - even in rough conditions - and a powerful rig that can be perfectly operated by a shorthanded crew.
The excellent dynamic stability, supported by a lead keel, allows the yacht to benefit from a powerful rig. A beautiful and well thought-out rigging plan gives control over all sails, at different courses, with optimal ease of operation. The double forestay, with a large genoa and a turning jib, combines the advantages of two types of sails in one rigging. A large genoa for the sailed races and the convenience of a turning jib, for the cruise. The furling mainsail, with boom furling, ensures a mainsail that always suits changing conditions.
With the electric Genoa furler, the turning jib and an electric halyard winch, the rigging is easy to operate, especially in the case of a short handed crew. In the sheltered cockpit, behind the superstructure, night watchmen and longer crossings can be fully enjoyed.

Navigation and electronics
Other:

On Board Wi-Fi
Suunto AIS Transponder
Garmin Plotter/Radar system with display at chart table and in cockpit.


Equipment
Anchor winch: Anchor winch to be operated on foredeck and at helm position
Tarpaulin(s): Winter cover over the entire deck
Swimming ladder: stainless steel
Swimming platform: Foldable swimming platform
Davits: stainless steel davits
Other:

Stern anchor on folding arm (currently disassembled)
Sun screening around deck saloon
cockpit cushions

name: 2010 Beneteau Oceanis 432010 Beneteau Oceanis 43
description:
The Beneteau Oceanis 43 is designed by Berret-Racoupeau with the interior designed by Nauta Designs. They balance a high level of cruising comfort with great sailing performance. With twin helms and easy line handling with all lines leading aft to the cockpit, the Beneteau is easy and fun to sail. The interior is light and airy with plenty of light from the overhead portholes. The powerful and reliable Yanmar 54hp engine makes her good under power and sails great with her 6'7" draft. She is an ideal boat for cruising in the Caribbean and beyond.
Viewing by appointment at our Grenada Office +1 473 422 6418 info(at)clarkeandcartercaribbean.comMehr anzeigen

name: 2016 Sydney Sydney 43 GTS2016 Sydney Sydney 43 GTS
description:
Fast, easy to handle, stable and spacious, the Sydney GTS43 serves as a comfortable cruiser, short- handed family weekender and competitive IRC racer.The Sydney GTS43 seamlessly combines a performance orientated yacht with spacious cruising comforts, offering universal appeal to racers, couples and families alike.Built to satisfy the demands of today’s discerning sailors, the Sydney GTS43 presents a marriage between impressive design and construction techniques to deliver a yacht that is light yet strong, easy to sail yet seriously fast, stylish yet functional, and above all else, seaworthy.Capable of competitive racing at both club and regatta level, this 43-footer can also be easily managed when racing short-handed or when cruising. With its non- overlapping headsail for ease of tacking and an asymmetrical spinnaker, the Sydney GTS43 can be sailed to its full potential without the need for a large and experienced crew. Its low vertical centre of gravity coupled with its generous sail area to displacement provides exceptional stability, thereby rewarding its owner with superior handling and performance.With accommodation for up to six guests, the Sydney GTS43 has a surprising amount of room. Above deck, the large open transom cockpit provides ease of movement and comfort whether racing, cruising or entertaining, while below deck its roomy interior is contemporary by design and easy to maintain. Large coach house windows provide an abundance of natural light and a greater feeling of size.Designed to exceed your expectations in terms of performance, ease of handling, safety and comfort, the Sydney GTS43 establishes a new benchmark for yachts of this size in the world.
Winner SNIM in IRC 1 Class
2nd European Championship in Marseille IRC 1 Class
2nd Mediterranean UNCL Championship IRC 1 Class
2019 :  Winner ROLEX GIRAGLIA Cup : INSHORE et OFFSHORE
2021 : Winner  ROLEX GIRAGLIA All ClassMehr anzeigen

name: 1989 Skua 42 (tradewind)1989 Skua 42 (tradewind)
description:
blue water cruiser


The Skua 42 Tradewind that we offer is fully equipped for long (sea) journeys. The design of M.C. van der Vlis is characterized by good and calm sailing behaviour. The S-truss hull and deck are constructed of steel, but the superstructure and fixed sprayhood are made of aluminum for good initial stability. The cockpit is also pleasant, where there is a lot of shelter behind the fixed spray hood. The overall condition of the boat is good enough to sail away with. The current owner has lived on board for a long time and has always carried out renovations whenever necessary.
The interior has a cozy salon with petrol leather upholstered benches, which gives a beautiful nautical look with the lacquered teak. Upon entering, you will find the wet cell on starboard, the navigation area on port side, with the kitchen with 3-burner stove, oven, refrigerator and double sink. In the bow on starboard you will find a cabin with a double bed with deep storage drawers underneath. At port there is an extra bed with plenty of storage space. Further in the bow is another cabin with a double bed.
For those who are looking for a sturdy and solid quality yacht with which they can make long journeys, this Skua 42 is definitely worth viewing. Viewing is possible by appointment at the White Whale Yachtbrokers Enkhuizen office. Please contact enkhuizen@wwy.nl or +31(0)228 855 380 for more information or to make an appointment for a viewing on board. Viewings are possible from Monday to Saturday.

1989 BACHS HVALPSOND DYNAMIC 43,
XBOAT ref 5352.DescriptionDynamic 43 - Shoneewandoah Builder: Bachs-Lyst shipyard - Denmark - Designed and drawn by Jan Kjaerulff Year Built: December 1989 - Seller has owned the boat since May 1995. It is a close up and up close boat outstanding. The boat originally had 4 double cabins + 2 beds in the saloon, and 2 bathrooms, each with its own WC. Cozy teak interior, headroom: 1.83 m This is a one-design offshore regatta boat designed for crewed sailing, perfectly balanced, fast, stiff under sail thanks to its deep ballast. She was converted for single-handed sailing, which has been her use since May 1995, and for the 27 years of her use by the current owner. name: 1980 Custom Beister Yawl1980 Custom Beister Yawl
description:
I am selling my father-in-law's beautiful Beister. The ship is in good condition so far, but as with any classic ship, there is still work to be done. On the port side there is a 70 x 30 cm large paint damage to be repaired and the cake stand should be replaced. In 2021, the gas stove with oven was renewed, the interior lights switched to LED, the on-board toilet renewed, all batteries renewed and all upholstery reupholstered. On the outside, the teak deck was resealed and painted and the antifouling was renewed.
The Aionios has been back in the water since 2021 after an 8-year break indoors.
The sails are in good condition.
One of the most beautiful sailing ships in any port!Show more

name: 1988 Jeanneau Sun Magic 441988 Jeanneau Sun Magic 44
description:
Very beautiful Sun Magic 44 monohull habitable cruising sailboat, built by the Jeanneau shipyard. This fixed keel sailboat, rigged as a Sloop at the head, made by the naval architect Andrieu Yacht Design, is 13.1 m long. Production started in 1987 and ended in 1993. Perfectly maintained by the owner and a shipyard, this boat is wintered dry 10 months out of 12. Very well equipped with constant refit, it is ready to sail without additional investment.
Comfortable and fast, it is a reassuring sailboat that allows long navigation. The finishes are in solid wood, its structure is in resin reinforced with kevlar. To see quickly.

name: 2006 Reinke 12M2006 Reinke 12M
description: We want to place the sailing boat "Nessie" in competent and professional hands, albeit with tears in our eyes, so that she can finally cruise the seas majestically. "Nessie", a Reinke 12 M, steel, plows through the waves with her bow, just by her weight of 15 tons, and doesn't jump out of the rudder with every gust. Its heavy and solid but nevertheless slim form of a 12 m long hard chine and ASY twin keel was built by our father, who unfortunately already passed away, as his favorite until 2006 and equipped with a marinated 40 KW Mercedes-Benz engine (OM 616-240 D ), whose operating hours are < 300 hours and a bow thruster (Exturn). The built-in daily diesel tank (40 l) with connection to the spacious main tank (1,000 l) allows optional optimal fuel bunkering. The generously dimensioned 450 L fresh water tank ensures a carefree "refreshing" trip and the equally lavish 230 L faeces and gray water tank also makes the trip "relieving". The lovingly designed and well-kept wooden interior confirms the detailed equipment in the saloon, in the aft cabin and in the pantry. Likewise the two bunks in the middle of the ship or the cupboard and lying areas in the fore ship. The practicable pantry, equipped with high-quality fittings, a sink, a petroleum stove and an oven, doesn't leave the Smutje's kitchen cold either. The existing diesel heating (Wallas) ensures cozy warmth below deck on cold days and the radio Navmann VHF 7200 takes care of both nautical and landlubber communication. We don't want to withhold a small flaw. "Nessie" is still without cloth - without mast, rig and sail. The new captain is thus allowed to carry out a very personal, original rig tuning on "Nessie" in order to wrap her in her new characteristic cloth. "Nessie" is in the Rhine-Herne Canal in Castrop-Rauxel (AMC Castrop-Rauxel), chained to a 30m stainless steel chain and two stainless steel anchors, and is eagerly awaiting the sea. Ahoy.Show more

name: 2008 Leopard 432008 Leopard 43
description:
2008 LEOPARD 43 / 4+2 CABINS / FROM FIRST OWNER / LYING IN TURKEY 
The new Leopard 43 is based on the award-winning Leopard 42 design, of which over 45 units have been introduced since 2001. New features include a hard-top bimini, a longer transom, fixed stainless steel davits and twin Yanmar 40Hp naturally aspirated engines. The 4-cabin-4 Head layout features an owner-dedicated starboard hull, spacious double cabins with en suite heads and separate showers, fully equipped galley and expanded saloon with breakfast bar. A clear deck layout, excellent bunk access, walkthrough access from the cockpit to the aft swim platform and a galley-up design are popular features with cruisers.   
5HP Outboard / Tender 2x39 HP Yanmar replaced with new ! (2022 / 3 years guarantee )  Solar Panels = 2 X 280 Watt Hard Top Bimini 4 Cabins / 2 Head & shower Configuration  
Aft cabin queen berth with storage and ensuite heads.
Forward cabins with double berths and ensuite heads.
Starting forward in the mirrored hulls, are the forward cabins each with athwartship double berths complete with ample storage via shelving units and a hanging locker aft. Each cabin has an ensuite head with sink basin forward outboard and forward facing toilet aft.
In the main salon on deck level, to port is the U shaped galley with the double stainless steel sinks inboard facing forward, ample countertop space with the stove outboard aft.  More counter top space follows the stove.  Aft of the galley is the top opening fridge/freezer units to provide more work space.
To starboard is a comfortable U shaped settee surrounding the dining table.  This settee can be converted either for storage or used as an extra double berth. There is blue microfiber throughout the cabins and salon.
REMOTE PURCHASE AVAILABLE -Find the boat -Agree on the deal-Arrange an international surveyor (either for pre-survey or full survey)-Conference call viewings for more-Remote paperwork -Close the deal-Manage the transfer or transport to your desired destination and start your new journeyMehr anzeigen

name: 2009 Northern Comfort 432009 Northern Comfort 43
description:
Well-built bluewater cruiser


Beautiful epoxy composite Northern Comfort 43 sailing yacht with cutter rigging. Yacht architect Dick Zaal  is one of the most well-known and experienced Dutch yacht architects, also known as the house architect of Contest Yachts, and certainly needs no introduction to experienced sailors. His designs excel in seaworthiness and are therefore popular with departures, among others. Northern Comfort 43 is a high quality yacht built in corecell epoxy using the vacuum injection method. This construction method offers many advantages; light, strong, corrosion-free and no risk of osmosis or water ingress. It is a real offshore sailing yacht for the demanding sailor, ideal as a comfortable departure boat, partly thanks to the 2.20 meter deep keel and fixed spray hood. The boat has more than proven itself on numerous long sea voyages.
The interior is certainly as beautiful as the exterior. There is a fixed spray hood from where you have a good overview of the boat and surroundings. On entering is the spacious wet cell toilet and washing machine to port and a double cabin to starboard. Amidships is the saloon and here you will again find many examples of the great craftsmanship, especially in the technical field. To starboard is the practical galley and to port is the chart table. In the forepeak is a cabin with a double bed and a wet room with shower. The engine is easily accessible all around for service. For those looking for a good sailing, perfectly maintained and luxuriously equipped quality yacht, this Northern Comfort 43 is an absolute must.
If you are interested, please contact the White Whale Yachtbrokers Enkhuizen office via enkhuizen@wwy.nl or +31(0)228 855 380 for more information. Viewings are possible from Monday to Saturday, by appointment only. Your yacht broker is Robert de Vries.
