name: 1980 juelsminde colina 361980 juelsminde colina 36
description: Colina 36 (Triton) Description The boat was built in 1980 as the first example of the type Colina 36 based on a design by Jörn Hansen from 1979. Construction was by Erik Frandsen's Julsminde Badebyggeri shipyard in Julsminde, Denmark. The type designation "Colina" is derived from the fact that the design is based on the hull shape of the pilot and lifeboats designed by the important Norwegian yacht and ship designer Colin Archer (1832 - 1921). It is a pointed gate with an attached rudder, jib boom and cutter rigging. The length of 11.10 m results from the distance from the tip of the bow to the aft edge of the rudder blade. The jib boom protrudes 1.80 m over the bow. The boat is relatively slim and reaches a maximum width of 3.40 m midships. The hull shape corresponds to a long keel with an S-shaped frame and a maximum draft of 1.53 m at the front and 1.73 m aft. An electric bow thruster (Vetus, renewed in 2010) is installed at the front. The fuselage is made of GRP, which was manufactured using the hand lay-up process. The construction and structure consists of mahogany and teak. Displacement with empty tanks about 13,500 kg. The boat is divided into five sections: in the front there is a sleeping chamber with 2 berths. This is followed by a hallway with the exit to the toilet room (pump toilet, washbasin, hand shower). This is followed amidships by the saloon with a horseshoe-shaped bench seat on the port side and a table that can be lowered (possibly 2 additional berths) and a pantry line on the starboard side. Two steps lead up to the wheelhouse with inside steering position, large chart table (with navigation devices and VHF radio) and another L-shaped bench seat and table. The wheelhouse is also the access to the interior of the boat via two large sliding doors on port and starboard. From the wheelhouse it goes aft down three steps into the aft chamber with two berths. The machine (six-cylinder Volvo Penta MD 40, 87 hp) is located under the liftable floor panels of the wheelhouse. This is also where the other technical installations, such as two battery banks and the Eberspächer warm-air heating system, can be found. The sails correspond to cutter rigging, which was completely renewed in 2016. It consists of furling systems for jib and jib and a furling mainsail with Seldén furling mast. The total sail area is 76 square meters, the sails are made of Dakron, color: cream. A gennaker is also available. All sheets and reefing systems can be operated from the outside steering position on the aft deck. The boat is therefore very suitable for one-handed use in connection with the autopilot. The Colina 36 is a stable boat for cruising. It has relatively good upwind properties for a long keeler (with a tendency to heel), but achieves its best sailing performance on half-wind courses or on wide sheets. From 12 to 14 knots of wind, 6.5 to 7 knots can be logged, above which the physical hull speed of approx. 8 knots is almost reached. Under engine, the physical hull speed is possible. The living comfort is very good due to the large wheelhouse and the clever interior layout, both when driving and at the dock or at anchor. This is aided by the large tanks and galley equipment with dual propane cooker and oven (gas bottle in a secure container above the anchor locker) and the relatively roomy cool box, as well as numerous stowage spaces in wall chaps or boxes under and behind the seats. The boat can also be driven well from the inside in rainy weather, as there are complete identical steering positions with all instruments on the aft deck outside as well as inside at the chart table of the wheelhouse. The sail position can be easily controlled via the very large deck hatch of the wheelhouse and must of course (with autopilot control) be retrimmed from the outside from time to time. The boat is well anchored; it can be exited via a fold out ladder attached to the boat with teak steps aft for disembarking or bathing. A moveable ladder is available for side exit (e.g. into the dinghy). Since the takeover in 2007, the boat has been repaired, modernized and maintained, serviced and repaired in the warehouse or shipyard halls during the winter storage periods and is therefore in very good condition. In the 15 years until 2022, the current owner has invested around €450,000 after deducting all annual running costs for berth, cranes, boat care outside (cleaning work, polishing, antifowling), winter storage and maintenance. Since 2010, the boat has been in Kappeln in the marina of the Scalar shipyard by Hennigsen and Steckmest, where it received an almost complete boat building refit. The boat has been at Ancker-Yachting for regular winter storage since 2013. The usual work on the hull and rig also takes place there. The complete renewal of the rig with a new Seldén furling mast was also carried out by the Seldén agency of Ancker-Yachting in Kappeln. Since then, all boat building work has been taken over by the local Janssen and Renkhoff shipyard. The company CO-Segel (Kappeln, Brodersby) was responsible for the design and manufacture of the new sails, which also took over their ongoing maintenance and repairs. The Vogt company in Kappeln has been in the hands of the Vogt company in Kappeln for almost 10 years. All companies involved are also available to provide information if required. The boat will be on 10.06. launched and can then be viewed at the berth (Henningsen & Steckmest, Kappeln-Grauhöft). A more detailed synopsis is also available for serious interested parties and can be sent on request.Show more

name: 1938 Baglietto TWINS V - 6 m. International Tonnage1938 Baglietto TWINS V - 6 m. International Tonnage
description:
Twins V “Celestina”, the only existing example of the glorious 6 meter International Tonnage series owned by olympian Oberti brothers. The great Italian yacht designer Carlo Sciarelli remembered Twins V such as a “boat with a very noble pedigree”. In 1939, she took part in the prestigious “Scandinavian Gold Cup” in Finland. Information about all the regattas made by the yacht are available in various publications and in the archive of Oberti’s family. First restoration was made in 1985/86 at De Cesari Shipyard in Cervia. The deck has been modified over the years with the addition of a deckhouse for cruising use. The yacht represents a real monument of Italian sailing in international regattas. Twins V also took part in some editions of “Vele d’Epoca d’Imperia”recalling the glorious past of 6m International Tonnage. Boat in good condition and dry docked. Sails in cotton.
 
Twins V “Celestina”, unico esemplare esistente della gloriosa serie dei 6 Metri Stazza Internazionale appartenuto agli olimpionici fratelli Oberti. Definita dal Maestro Carlo Sciarelli “barca con nobilissimo pedigree”. Nel 1939 partecipa alla prestigiosa “Scandinavian Gold Gup” in Finlandia. Innumerevoli le regate disputate e riscontrabili sia in diverse pubblicazioni sia nell’archivio della famiglia Oberti. Primo restauro eseguito nel 1985/86 presso il Cantiere Navale De Cesari di Cervia. Nel corso degli anni la coperta è stata modificata con l’aggiunta di una tuga per un uso crocieristico. Lo yacht rappresenta un vero e proprio monumento della vela italiana nelle regate internazionali. Ha preso parte anche ad alcune edizioni delle “Vele d’epoca d’Imperia” ricordando i fasti dei purosangue del mare. Barca in buono stato e rimessata al coperto. Vele tipiche in cotone.Mehr anzeigen

name: 1991 Dehler 36 CWS1991 Dehler 36 CWS
description: General: The Dehler 36 CWS is designed as a sporty sailing yacht that can also be sailed relaxed with the family or even solo. With the CWS system, all trim options are within reach of the helmsman. The electric winch at the stops makes the sail trim a lot lighter. All halyards run below deck from the mast to the cockpit, which means fewer obstacles on deck. The mainsail can easily be folded up with the lazybag. The genoa and turning jib are roller reef, as is the large Code Zero which has its own furler. Sheets are operated from the cockpit with the ST sheet winches. The large spray hood provides excellent shelter, navigation equipment is placed at the helm. Thanks to the shallow wing keel, sailing on inland water is also no problem. The solar panels keep the batteries efficiently charged. The Dehler 36 has been put aside every year for maintenance and antifouling. Accomodation: The interior is practically and stylishly furnished with a combination of white inner shell, wooden panelling and fabric panels. Windows and shutters are fitted with roller blinds. Headroom is 1.90 / 1.85m in the saloon and 1.80 in the forecastle. To starboard next to the cabin entrance is a navigation corner, with folding seat, equipment and switch panel. Behind it is a lockable aft cabin with double bed and closet space. To port is a wet cell and well-equipped longitudinal galley. Opposite the sitting area with wooden table is a cupboard with the possibility to place a TV. The lockable front cabin has a spacious V-bed, with sufficient standing space and cupboard space on both sides.Mehr anzeigen

name: 1997 Nissen One Off1997 Nissen One Off
description: his aluminum sailing yacht was designed by Mr. Nissen from Laboe as a long-distance ship. The hull was built by the aluminum shipyard in Lübeck and the interior was fitted out by the Dick shipyard in Kiel. Most of the technical equipment was installed by the owner himself. The rig is from John Mast in original condition with a Harken furling jib system and a removable cutter stay. There are 2 mainsails, as well as a genoa 1, genoa 2, genoa 3, storm jib, cutter jib and gennaker. The autopilot system is an Autohelm 3000 and a Windpilot Pacific system. The radar antenna stands on its own mast on the mirror. The boat is ready to sail but needs some painting work on the deck and superstructure.Show more

name: 1985 Scalar Scalar 361985 Scalar Scalar 36
description: This Scalar 36, built by the noble smithy Henningsen & Steckmest, is offered third-hand for reasons of age. The yacht has been in the possession of the current owner for 22 years. About 10 years ago the hull was painted in dark blue with Awlgrip 2K paint by the Böbs shipyard in Travemünde. In 2020 the teak deck was repointed and sanded. It is still approximately 12mm thick. All external wooden parts from the structure and in the cockpit have also been repainted 3 years ago with 2K paint. The bowsprit was retrofitted in 2022 to enable a much more comfortable boarding the yacht. In addition to the dark blue hull, there is another special feature of this beautiful yacht. Below deck, the aft cabin has been opened to the saloon. This results in a light interior. If someone doesn't like it, it can also be reversed. Facts Shipyard: Henningsen & Steckmest in Kappeln Year of construction: 1985 Building number: 85 Length: 11.00 m Length o.a. with bowsprit: 11.50 m width: 3.45 m draft: 1.70 m weight: 7.2 t wheel steering sail area upwind: 57 m² engine: Bukh Diesel DV 36 with approx. 1500 operating hours, always serviced and in a very good condition with three-blade fixed propeller. Sails and rigging, top-rigged single-saling rig, all shrouds and stays were renewed in 2019. In 2015, a roll-up mainsail from Elvström with a roll-up boom was retrofitted. This can be operated via an electric winch in the cockpit under the sprayhood. The headsail, a Genoa 3 from Beilken, which can be operated via the Reckmann furling system, is about 10 years old. There is also an unused Genoa 1 from Co-Sail. name: 1984 Sigma Yachts 361984 Sigma Yachts 36
description: Offer beautiful sailing yacht Sigma 36 for sale. She is 10.98m long, 3.52m wide and weighs 6500kg with a draft of 1.6m. It was built in England in 1984. The headroom in the "galley" is approx. 1.83m and decreases towards the front. In addition to a very spacious aft cabin and a double cabin in the foredeck, it offers various "sleeps" on the saloon benches, starboard at the chart table and raised above the saloon bench. The wet room has a pull-out water tap with hot and cold water (warm after the machine is running). There is also hot and cold water in the galley. Storage space is plentiful both in the kitchen cupboards and in the compartments behind the seat backs in the saloon. The engine, a Volvo Penta 2003, is very reliable and got a new alternator and a new shaft including stuffing box in 2019. The underwater hull was extensively sanded down and rebuilt in 2019 and is provided with fresh antifouling every year. A new bathing ladder has been installed. Now to visit in Hooksiel! In winter storage, it can be viewed in Wilhelmshafen.Show more

name: 1977 SHE 361977 SHE 36
description:
The much admired Sparkman & Stephens SHE36 "Sherpa" is regrettably for sale. She has proved herself to be a quick and delightful boat to handle and takes heavy weather comfortably. "Sherpa" was built in 1977 to Lloyds 100A1 and has had only two owners from new, her current owner having had her for over 35 years. She has been raced and cruised round Britain, Sweden to Portugal to Canaries and Caribbean and back. "Sherpa" is almost ready to do it all again or have a more gentle life in home waters.
The She 36's fin and skeg underwater lines are enhanced by a sleek low coachroof, balanced overhangs and the typical S&S tumblehome on the topsides making her a classic-looking yacht from all angles. These boats rarely come on the market as their owners tend to keep them a long time and anyone considering a Swan, Contessa or similar should take a look. Also see Classic Sailor magazine article "In Praise of the She 36".
Viewing by appointment through our Essex Office - 01621 785600.Mehr anzeigen

name: 1974 Contest 36 Ketch1974 Contest 36 Ketch
description:
General: The Contest 36 Ketch is a very robustly built sailing yacht and certainly not a lightweight, but at the time designed by Dick Zaal under IOR rules as a Cruiser-Racer. This version is built as type-B, so with a deep keel of 1.90m. The Contest 36 ketch has a center cockpit and the mizzen mast is placed on the roof of the aft cabin. The steering wheel is placed on a steering position with compass and cup holders, with teak decking on the cockpit floor and benches. The sheet winches are on the cockpit edge with the navigation equipment under the sprayhood. A climbing ladder is attached to the main boom. A furling reefing device is available for operating the headsails. There are three halyard winches on the mast for hoisting the mainsail. On the foredeck is a manual windlass and a turning jib rail. The teak deck has been partially replaced, such as on the superstructure, lockers and anchor locker. Other teak deck needs maintenance and repair. A revised Volvo Penta 2003 diesel engine has been installed by the current owners. The bow staircase makes it easy to get on board and folds in while sailing. The underwater hull was sanded in April 2021 and put in the new antifouling. This Contest 36 Ketch is suitable for an owner with two right hands who can tackle the overdue maintenance or has enough budget to have the necessary maintenance carried out.
Interior: The interior is finished with mahogany and headroom in the cabin is 1.91 m. The woodwork needs to be repainted here and there. To starboard is next to the cabin entrance a large chart table with handy chest of drawers. To port is a galley with sink, refrigerator and gas stove. Although new water tanks have been installed, there is no steaming water due to the lack of the necessary pipework and water pump. The aft cabin can be reached from the inside, in the passage is an extra toilet (out of order) and also a large hatch to the engine compartment. The aft cabin has two separate berths with a washbasin with mirror in between. All permanent and additional sleeping places are equipped with swing planks. The saloon benches can also be used as extra bunks, behind the benches there is a lot of cupboard space. Between the front cabin and saloon is a wet cell with pump toilet and washbasin on port side. To starboard is a hanging and chest of drawers. The V-bed offers two sleeping places, the storage room below is reached by removing the fitting piece.Mehr anzeigen

name: 1983 Jeanneau Sun Fizz 401983 Jeanneau Sun Fizz 40
description:
CAP MED BOAT & YACHT CONSULTING is pleased to offer you for sale this beautiful Sun Fizz from 1983. The Sun Fizz sailboat is a habitable cruising monohull, built by the Jeanneau shipyard in France. This fixed keel sailboat, rigged as a Sloop at the head, designed by the naval architect Philippe Briand, is 11.75 m long with a maximum draft of 1.95 m. Production started in 1980 and ended in 1986. 651 copies of the boat were produced. Fast and stiff on the canvas, it is a solid construction, a renowned architect, sought after for its accessible budget and its marine qualities. .

description:
Yacht broker for this ship is Dick Schmeinck 088 2502502


Comfortina 35 Scandinavian quality yacht in excellent condition and with many extras. The yacht is one of the Swedish Comfortina Yachts yard and the design by Thomas Bern is built to a high standard. Unique to each Comfortina is the combination of the balanced design, the realized build quality and the refined sailing characteristics. Below decks, these yachts are finished with beautiful teak. This yacht was built in 2004 and launched in 2005. The yacht has been in the possession of the 2nd owner since 2020 and has always been a demo yacht. It has been sailed little and the yacht has had an antifouling in 2022. In short: well maintained yacht and ready to go!
General: Milon, length 10.80 m, width 3.35 m, depth 1.85 m, year of construction 2004, in service 2005, construction number SE-COM 35219 E 405, builder hull and finishing Comfort Batar Sweden, designer Thomas Bern, round bilge , short keel, building material lead, material cabin construction  polyester, deck design: walking deck teak, displacement 5800 kg, ballast lead 2800 kg., steering wheel,  6 berths (4 fixed/2 extra), bed length in front and along bench 2.00 m. and aft 1.95 m., 2 cabins, headroom in saloon 1.95 m., chart table, anchor stainless steel (Bruce), anchor line 30 m., bathing ladder, interior teak, material windows tempered glass in aluminum, sprayhood new, cockpit tent, 2 x fire extinguishers , 1x lifebuoy and bilge pump manual and electric.

name: 1983 J Boats J/351983 J Boats J/35
description:
Nice cruiser/racer to sail this season. Very good sailor with sleeping place for 6. Equipped with many recent updates.


Well maintained cruiser/racer from J/boats ready for this season.
Extensively refitted since 2016 and equipped with 6 berths, this ship can be sailed away immediately.
This 1983 sailing yacht is still recognized today for its fantastic sailing characteristics and will easily be at the front in the competition fields and beyond.
This example has been completely refitted and checked since 2016, during which time and later many improvements were made to, among other things, the rigging. Think of an improved deck layout with associated blocks (Spinlock) where all lines can be operated from the cockpit, new backstays (Dynema), new winches (Harken), overhauled hydraulic backstay, Rod rigging (2020) and new Quantum sailing (main 2016, jib 2020).
The electrical system was also completely renewed in 2016, using only LED lighting and the most modern navigation equipment from B & G, Raymarine and Icom. This equipment is easy to operate both from the cockpit and from the chart table.
Due to the wide hull shape, this ship offers a nice, light open space in the cabin. With 6 fixed berths, 4 in the rear and 2 in the forepeak, this offers space for the whole family or a group of friends. A small kitchen on the port side, two long benches and a fold-out table invite you to go out with this ship for a weekend, week or longer.
Are you looking for a spacious cruiser/racer from a renowned shipbuilder that can be sailed away immediately? Please contact White Whale Yachtbrokers Willemstad: oscar@wwy.nl or call +31631901231

name: 1980 Shogun 10801980 Shogun 1080
description:
A Shogun Sailing Yacht Online Auction. Anyone can easily bid until October 31, 2022 on the Bootveiling website.


A Shogun sailing yacht that needs to be refurbished by the lovers. The boat has had several owners. The boat has not sailed in the last year and before that it was stationary for several years. The starter motor and battery were replaced this year. The engine was then started, but that was short-lived. He is currently not employed.
The Shogun was built by Linjett Yachts and the Rosättra yard, where three generations of accomplished boat builders work at a yard that has been building yachts since 1886. Located just an hour and a half from Stockholm, the team and yard have brought their experience and craftsmanship into Shogun Yachts and created a partnership and passion that led to this sailing yacht.
Extra information

Known defects: water leakage in the wall of the center space. Engine no longer starts. Several meters broken, electrical cables not 100 percent. Wood outside weathered.
Bootveiling is an independent specialized boat auction house. Our boats are sold under the auction conditions.

name: 2009 Bavaria Cruiser 352009 Bavaria Cruiser 35
description:
LxWxD 10.78m x 3.60m x 1.55m
Very good, well-kept condition. A fully equipped ship that has been regularly maintained.
- Propulsion: Volvo Penta D1-20, approx. 930h, 3-blade folding propeller (fixed prop included as a spare), bow thruster
- 3 cabin version. The two double berths in the stern can also be divided in such a way that a very large 2-berth berth and a large 1-berth berth (or luggage compartment) are created
- Sails: genoa, battened mainsail with lazy jacks and bag, spinnaker halyard and jib tarpaulin
- Comfort: Webasto heating, hot water, Neptun mattresses & slatted frames in the foredeck, sufficient mosquito screens, shower facility in the toilet
- Current instruments: Raymarine Axiom 9 plotter, Raymarine helm pilot, 2x Raymarine display P70i, Raymarine wind display. All instruments work in a network with the plotter. A P70i display is in the cockpit, the 2nd display below in the navigation corner also shows the most important data (all NMEA data such as wind, position, ETA, etc.) below. If desired, the Axiom plotter automatically connects to known port WLANs and provides its own hotspot. With Navionics the course can be planned and synchronized with the plotter on a mobile phone/tablet or alternatively the plotter can be remotely controlled below deck. ICOM M323G fixed radio with GPS and NL channel 31 (handheld radio is not part of the sale)
- Spray hood with bracket, tarpaulin for helm station, tarpaulin for cockpit, large winter tent
- New batteries 2020, new toilet 2020, bow thruster 2016, automatic steering and P70 2018, wind indicator 2017, Axiom plotter 2019.
- Underwater ship new 2021
- Complete instructions and documentation with invoices from the last few years, CE, VAT proof, etc.
NO CHARTER SHIP!
After taking over you can start sailing immediately, fenders, lines, almanac and paper charts for the Dutch Wadden Sea and IJsselmeer are included.
The berth in Marina Stavoren/NL has been paid for until April 2022 and can be taken over.
Selling due to enlargement
Tel. 0171/5583174Show more

name: 2022 Dehler 342022 Dehler 34
description:
Dehler 34Arrange a non-binding appointment today and let us advise you in detail about the sailing boat, model Dehler 34. We are looking forward to your contact.
Gladly also directly under 04103 838 17
The Dehler 34 Put through its paces - The new Dehler 34 was designed by judel/vrolijk & co and has benefited from over 50 years of yacht building experience. The local Bodden was the ideal test track. The boat copes well with the short, choppy wave, nothing moves and it stays surprisingly dry. She sails gently through the waves and is not impressed by strong gusts. But not only the sailing characteristics were on the test program. Points such as performance under the engine, noise development below deck, maneuverability and ergonomics were also checked, the test protocols then evaluated and possible improvements discussed and implemented. As a result, we are pleased to be able to present a sporty and modern performance cruiser with a length of 34 feet to the sailing world.

name: 1984 siltala yacht Nauticat 331984 siltala yacht Nauticat 33
description:
1984 SILTALA YACHT NAUTICAT 33,
XBOAT ref 847.SILTALA YACHTS- NAUTICAT 33- material: polyester, monolithic and fiberglass (solid construction)- overall length (with Delphinière): 11 m- hull length: 10.10 m- waterline length: 8.60 m- width / beam: 3.25 m- draft: 1.50 m- weight approximately 8 tons- air draft: 12.90 m- Long keel- mixed sailing and motor sailboat (Fifty)- double steering wheel (inside and outside)- ketch rigging

Accommodation: - large and bright wheelhouse with access through 2 side doors (very practical for going outside and maneuvering) - 360° view - wheelhouse with steering wheel and navigation tools - 3 windscreen wipers - manual sunroof (exterior varnish redone in June 2022)- bench seat and small removable wooden table- large chart table- storage- access to the aft cabin by going down one level- spacious cabin with a double bed (+ mattress extension)- magnificent woodwork - linings in good condition, portholes - WC area (marine WC) - wooden furniture with washbasin - numerous storage spaces - curtains replaced (in 2021) - square access and kitchen forward and down 2 steps (steps with chest storage space)- a saloon with a U-shaped bench seat (blue velvet in good condition)- a wooden table- the saloon can be converted into a bed for 2 people (possible to install a separating curtain)- equipped kitchen area:- worktop - double stainless steel sink - cold water / pressurized hot water tank capacity 250 liters COOLMATIC table top refrigerator (12v) ENO oven with 3 gas burners access to bathroom (at the front right of the boat) woodwork- Access forward cabin- a beautiful forward cabin- double bed- cousin and very good condition- storage and woodwork- new curtains

The NAUTICAT 33 is a very livable sailboat for its 10 m:- 2 cabins- 1 convertible saloon- 1 fitted galley- 1 superb 360° wheelhouse- 1 bathroom with shower- 2 toilets- 6 possible beds- EBERSPACHER forced air heating (to be revised not used)

ENGINE: - VOLVO - model: D2-75 - power: 75 HP - engine replaced in 2012 - shaft line replaced in 2012 - fixed bronze 3-blade propeller - fuel capacity of 600 liters (2 x 300 l) - 2 stainless steel tanks replaced in 2013 - about 1000 hours of operation - maintenance by professionals - invoice available

SAILS: - semi-battened mainsail (approximately 10/12 years old - good condition) - dark blue lazzy bag - furling genoa + sock + UV band (good condition) - second forestay for storm sail to be hauled - sail mizzen (good condition) - dark blue lazzy bag - Marconi ketch rig at the head (more than 10 years old, good condition) - mast resting on the deck - forestay replaced in 2013

ELECTRONICS / NAVIGATION: - SIMRAD AP 16 autopilot - hydraulics on helm sector - depth sounder, log, B & G anemometer - GPS, GARMIN GPS 120 plotter - AIS transmitter, receiver (connection to a PC not supplied) - fixed VHF NAVICOM RT 450 DSC- Portable VHF NAVICOM RT 420

EQUIPMENT / SAFETY:- 8-seater liferaft, ZODIAC, ISO 9650.- overhaul valid until 2024- reviewable for another 3 years- 4-seater FOB dinghy- Electric windlass- complete mooring with 10 mm chain- bowsprit- bilge pump manual - electric bilge pump - outside water intake - 2 rear seat lockers

name: 1992 ALC 351992 ALC 35
description:
Good sailor - generous headroom - new rigging - new diesel engine (2021)


The hull of this unique ALC 35 was built by the yard in 1976 and then, until its launch in 1992, it was professionally completed by the first owner, under the supervision of a naval architect. The interior has been finished with great care using high-quality materials. There is a lot of living and storage space and there are enough handles for grip when sailing. This beautiful sailing yacht has been maintained with care and many innovations have recently been implemented, including a new strong and quiet Yanmar diesel engine with a new tank and exhaust system.

name: 1981 Colvic Liberator 351981 Colvic Liberator 35
description:
The Colvic Liberator is a well tested cruising yacht designed by Ed Dubois and highly regarded for their good performance and sea keeping abilities. Offering comfortable accommodation and a spacious cockpit they are also easily sailed shorthanded and make good passagemakers, often considered a great alternative to a Sigma 33 or Westerly Storm. Jacana was professionally fitted out to a high standard from new and has a good inventory including recent standing rigging, diesel heating, new cooker, and toilet.

Designed by Marc Lombard, the Sun Odyssey 35 has proven to be a fast cruising yacht, easy to handle and fun to sail.  With a spacious comfortable interior layout they make wonderful and practical family cruisers.  This good example has been carefully used and maintained and comes with recent standing rigging, 2022 sails, in-mast furling and most important for the East Coast, shallow draft.  She's well worth viewing.

description:

'Full Circle' is a sought-after lifting keel version capable of taking the ground in suitable conditions, and is still in her original ownership from new. She has been upgraded to a high standard by her knowledgeable owner with lots of unique features to increase practicality, and an impressive inventory including diesel heating, holding tank, upgraded electrical system with solar panels, recent standing rigging, electric anchor windlass, an excellent sail wardrobe, and much more! Early viewing is highly recommended as yachts of this quality are rarely available, especially with lifting keels.

name: 1947 Ericson Nordic Cruiser 5 1/21947 Ericson Nordic Cruiser 5 1/2
description:
The Nordisk Kryssare 5 1/2 cruiser is a metrical class very used in Scandinavia during last century. This type of sailing boat is considered the smallest sister of the legendary J class that has writtend one of the most glorious chapter of America’s Cup history. With a length of 11 meter, the hull is characterized by large overhangs at the ends. This metrical class was very appreciated by legends such as Tore Holm, William Fife and Bertil Bothen. This boat was built in 1947 by the swedish shipyard Eriksson using Tord Sunden’s design. The boat, initially named 'Marie', took part in numerous regattas in Sweden and Finland during the 1950s. Later named 'Stumpan', in 2002 she was renovated by a well-known Italian shipyard specialized in restoration. Actually, the boat is in good general condition as it has always been covered in dry land. It is equipped with its wooden mast, rigging and sail set. A perfect yacht for the real enthusiast gentlemen who wants to be seen. More info available on request.
 
 
La Nordisk Kryssare 5 1/2 cruiser è una classe metrica tipica dei paesi Scandinavi durante il secolo scorso. Tale tipologia di imbarcazione è considerata la sorella più piccola della leggendaria classe J che ha scritto uno dei capitoli più gloriosi della storia della Coppa America. Con una lunghezza di quasi 11 metri, lo scafo si caratterizza per i grandi slanci alle estremità. Questa classe metrica è stata molto apprezzata da leggende come Tore Holm, William Fife e Bertil Bothen. L’esemplare in questione è stato costruito nel 1947 dal cantiere svedese Eriksson su disegno del connazionale inventore delle Folkboat, Tord Sundén. L’imbarcazione, inizialmente chiamata “Marie” ha partecipato a numerose regate in Svezia e Finlandia durante gli anni Cinquanta. Successivamente chiamata “Stumpan”, nel 2002 viene rinnovata presso noto cantiere italiano specializzato in restauri.  Attualmente la barca si presenta in buone condizioni generali in quanto sempre rimessata al coperto ed è completa di albero in legno, rigging e set di vele. Yacht ideale per l’appassionato che non vole passare inosservato. Maggiori informazioni disponibili su richiesta.Mehr anzeigen

name: 1984 Colin Archer Moen & Sons1984 Colin Archer Moen & Sons
description:
Colin Archer in online auction. Everyone can bid until October 31 at www.bootveiling.com


The 3rd owner of this beautiful ship is now selling it after a complete restoration where everything has been done for a long life of the boat with respect for the original construction and the original material. Possibly this is one of the best and most original Colin Archer available.
This boat was built in Norway according to Colin Archer's original plans. The restoration of the ship includes a new rigging, new electrics, new interior, new technique, new sails. Now the boat is in a good condition and ready for use. It sailed for one season after the restoration. The boat has been used for pleasure boating at sea and large inland waterways. The boat is auction and easy to handle for the skipper. The Colin Archer has beautiful ship lines. It is a strong boat with a comfortable sailing behaviour.
The boat has the necessary sailing experiences. The current owner has made a trip from Regensburg in Germany down the Danube to the Black Sea, Bospurus, Dardanelles, Ägäis to the Pelepones!
The sale includes the Woodstove and a Dickinson Stove.
The boat was last put on the side in 2020 for maintenance and immediately received an antifouling treatment with Copper Plated.
The Colin Archer is registered under number 032315-F German "Flaggenzertifikat"

name: 1988 Hallberg-Rassy 3521988 Hallberg-Rassy 352
location: prins van oranje, de stienplaat 1, 8754 he makkum, niederlande
description:
Yacht broker for this ship is Dick Schmeinck 088 2502502


Hallberg Rassy 352 Scandinavia The Hallberg Rassy 352 is a very good and seaworthy sailing yacht, with a central cockpit, a comfortable interior and a passage to the aft cabin. The ship is a good sailor and the build quality is excellent. Over 800 Hallberg-Rassy 352s were built, making it one of the most popular quality offshore cruisers ever. This Hallberg Rassy has a higher mast with double spreaders and furling mainsail. The yacht is equipped with a heavier Volvo Penta diesel engine type 2003 Turbo. Due to the 10 centimeters higher hull, the passage to the rear to the cabin is higher and wider. This with beautiful Louvre doors and a better access staircase. The larger deck hatches provide more light. The interior has a nautical spotless warm atmosphere. The yacht has been owned by the 2nd owner since 2001. This has always kept the ship up to date (see appendix). The yacht has always been on fresh water and in a heated hall in winter. In short: quality yacht in fantastic condition and good for many years of sailing pleasure!
General: Name ship Prima, Hallberg Rassy 352, length 10.54 m, width 3.38 m, draft 1.67 m, year of construction 1988, construction number 665, builder Hallberg Rassy Sweden, designer Christoph Rassy/Olle Enderlein, S Truss, continuous keel semi, construction material polyester, material cabin structure polyester, execution deck teak + foot rail, displacement 6.700 kg, ballast cast iron 3000 kg, steering wheel (emergency tiller), material windows hard glass, anchor CQR plowshare 32 kg., anchor line, electric anchor winch, 7 berths (5 fixed/2 extra) : bed length at the front 1.95 m, bed length along the bench 2.05 m and bed length behind 2.05 m, headroom saloon 1.89, electric anchor winch, bathing ladder, life buoy, life raft, 2 x fire extinguisher, manual + electric bilge pump, material windows hard glass, inside mahogany paneling , sprayhood, cockpit tent and winter cover. Other: In 2019 underwater ship 5x primer, last antifouling in 2022, new anode (2022).
Engine: Volvo Penta MD2003 Turbo 43 HP, year of construction 1988, diesel, indirect cooling, consumption of 4 liters per hour, propeller shaft drive, 3-blade propeller Max Prop, stainless steel tank capacity 240 (150+60) liters and fuel level meter.
Rigging: Headroom   16.40 m., top rigging, material aluminum spars, Selden mast   Furling (new 2019), mainsail, genoa and furling mainsail Hagoort (2018), 7 winches (5x self-tailing), material rigging standard. Other: longer mast/2 pairs of spreaders.
Navigation and equipment: Recent batteries, 12 Volt, shore power, inverter 220 Volt, ammeter, compass Delta, depth sounder Nexus NX2 Multi Control, log, windset, gps Furuno, VHF 2 x Icom, outdoor speaker, AIS, radio/CD Pioneer, autopilot Garmin, navigation lights,  90Ah starter battery and 235Ah light battery, Mastervolt 35Ah trickle charger
Gas and water: Stainless steel water tank 300 liters, hot water boiler in engine room, electric water pressure system, indoor shower, outdoor shower hot + cold with thermostatic tap (new 2019), toilet flush, stainless steel waste water tank 80 liters, cool box, gas stove with 3 burners, oven Optimus International, gas bun with drain, hot air heating diesel Eberspächer.

name: 1980 Hallberg-Rassy 3521980 Hallberg-Rassy 352
description:
For sale is our very well-kept and well-equipped Hallberg-Rassy 352, which has accompanied us through the entire Baltic Sea for the past four months.
The ship was built in 1980 and is a true classic. The previous owner has equipped the boat with many well thought-out extras, such as:
- New engine Volvo Penta D2-55 in 2014 (invoice of 14,000 EUR is available), currently running approx. 1,200 hours - Vetus bow thruster (very powerful!) - Raymarine ST7000+ autopilot incl. remote control (very reliable and high quality) - Electric windlass - Equipment rack at the stern- 220V system on board in all cabins- hot water boiler (heated by engine heat or shore power)- ENO gas cooker and oven- new sails in 2019, in very good condition- stern anchor- cockpit cake stall (2019)- toilet waste water tank- Plotter bathing platform & bathing ladder
This year the following was installed or upgraded:
- Rocna anchor 15kg (new) - replacement of all seacocks (Trudesign) (new) - active AIS (receiver & transmitter) - EPIRB (new) - life raft 6 people (new) - solar system 360 WP incl. 2 MPPT solar charge controllers (new )- Energy management system based on Raspberry Pi (new)- On-board computer as a multiplexer with OpenCPN (new)- On-board network with LTE router (new)- Handheld radio (new)- 2,000 watt inverter (new)- Diesel parking heater (new)- Reefs in the mainsail retrofitted
Furthermore, the equipment includes:
- Radio-log-wind gauge-GPS
As it is, the ship is ready for the Great Voyage. In the summer we were able to lie at anchor or on the rocks for a long time because we were sufficiently supplied with energy thanks to solar power. It comes "with pots and pans", i.e. kitchen equipment, many tools and spare parts. A viewing is possible between 05.09. and about 19.09. possible on land on Fehmarn. The boat is then lowered back into the water.

name: 2022 Beaconax Bluestorm 10502022 Beaconax Bluestorm 1050
description: Condition: new from the shipyard - individual and versatile Control: tiller with fixed double rudder Sails: mainsail 30 m², headsail 22 m² Based on the BlueStorm 900, the big sister offers more comfort. The custom concept offers the possibility of individualisation. The proven and more sustainable construction leads to a solid, easy-care and agile construction. She is a family boat and sportive cruiser and has very good sailing characteristics. The variable drafts allow access to shallow water areas and also allow dry traps in the Wadden Sea, short tidal areas are their home. The standard version of the BlueStorm 1050 also has a variable draft by means of a central swing keel. Optionally, the performance-enhancing twin keel can be selected or a fixed keel version can be configured. All swing keel versions can also receive a hydraulic upgrade. In addition to a number of optional features, special requests can also be implemented. The BlueStorm can be customized to suit your requirements and ideas. The standard BlueStorm 1050 already has a high standard. It has a wet cell including a shower and a spacious pantry and a pressurized water system. The space offers sleeping space for up to 6 people and has 3 cabins including a saloon. Even the double rudder system fixed to the transom is included in the basic scope and can optionally be upgraded or converted to push-through rudders and steering wheels. If you want to know more about, then get in touch with us. All BlueStorm boats and yachts are manufactured entirely in Germany and place great value on quality, sustainability and individuality. The design corresponds to the typical BlueStorm design. A very light and durable as well as long-lasting and sustainable construction is achieved by means of epoxy coating of the wooden inner structure. This integrative approach combines the best of both worlds and offers you many different advantages. Interest? Get in touch.Show more

name: 1979 Beelitz unbekannt1979 Beelitz unbekannt
description: I started to completely overhaul the boat, but now I don't have the time for it. It is a beautiful motorsailer (Beelitz) made of mahogany with a teak deck from 1979. The new price at the time was 480,000 DM. Today these boats are traded in good condition at 70,000 €. There is still a lot to be done on the boat, hence the low price. The boat also includes the trailer, a brand new engine, new upholstery (all the finest) in blue. The mast is already completely overhauled and so is the teak deck (disposition is new). The existing sails are fine and will do so for a few more years. You can certainly see a lot in the pictures (before and in the current state), but I would suggest a visit (it is written in the hall of the shipyard) for those who are seriously interested, as I cannot describe everything here in detail. You can reach me by email or on 01777500078. Thank you.Show more

name: 1985 Grand Soleil 351985 Grand Soleil 35
description:
Produced from 1982 to 1987 in about eighty units, it is the first Grand Soleil with the lines that later made the Italian shipyard's success. Classic boat, without excess, with a rather low freeboard and a very profiled deckhouse that disappears towards the bow, with a blue line that slims and characterizes the boat. The project is by Alain Jezequel, the designer who is responsible for much of the success of the Pardo boats of the 1980s. She covered with a snug cockpit and tiller steering. Well-finished interiors with a beautiful aft cabin, on the sides of the descent, chart and galley, and then move on to a dinette with opposing convertible sofas and forward toilet and a cabin with double V-bed. The sailing performance is excellent, especially upwind. . (cit. GdV) Additional Information Electrical and hydraulic system 2013
English IMBARCAZIONE READY TO BOA - BOAT READY TO SAIL Description Produced from 1982 to 1987 in about 80 pieces, it is the first Grand Soleil from the lines that then made the success of the Italian shipyard. Classic boat, without excesses, with a rather low free edge and a very profiled decksaw that disappears towards the bow, with a blue line that slenders and characterizes the boat. The project is by Alain Jezequel, the designer to whom much of the success of the Pardo boats of the 1980s is due. Covered with a collected cockpit and bar rudder. Well-finished interior with a beautiful aft cabin, on the sides of the descent correspondence and kitchen, and then move on to a dinette with transformable opposing sofas and a toilet bow and a cabin with double V bed. Sailing performance is excellent, especially upwind. (cit. GdV) Additional Information Electrical and hydraulic system 2013
Française BOAT READY TO BUOY - BATEAU PRÊT À NAVIGUER Description Produit de 1982 à 1987 en environ 80 pièces, there is the premier Grand Soleil des lignes here in ensuite fait le succès du chantier naval italien. Bateau classique, sans excès, avec un bord libre plutôt bas et une scie à pont très profilée qui disparaît vers l'avant, avec une ligne bleue qui s'élançait et caractérise le bateau. Le projet est réalisé par Alain Jezequel, the designers here a great part of the success of the bateaux Pardo des années 1980 est due. Recouvert d’un poste de pilotage et d’un gouvernail de bar collectés. Intérieur bien fine avec une belle cabine arrière, sur les côtés de la correspondance de descente et de la cuisine, puis passer à une dinette avec des canapés opposés transformables et un arc de toilette et une cabine avec lit double V. Les performances en voile sont excellentes, surtout en upwind. (cit. GdV) Informations complémentaires Système électrique et hydraulique 2013
Deutsch BOAT READY TO BUOY - BOAT READY TO SAIL Beschreibung Produziert von 1982 bis 1987 in etwa 80 Stück, ist es der erste Grand Soleil von den Linien, die dann den Erfolg der italienischen Werft gemacht. Klassisches Boot, ohne Exzesse, mit einer eher niedrigen freien Kante und einer sehr profileserten Decksäge, die in Richtung des Bogens verschwindet, mit einer blauen Linie, die das Boot aussandt und charakterisiert. Das Projekt stammt von Alain Jezequel, dem Designer, dem ein Großteil des Erfolgs der Pardo-Boote der 1980er Jahre zu verdanken ist. Bedeckt mit einem gesammelten Cockpit und Barruder. Gut ausgestattetes Interieur mit einer schönen Achterkabine, an den Seiten der Abstiegskorrespondenz und Küche, und dann auf eine Essecke mit transformierbaren gegensätzlichen Sofas und einem Toilettenbogen und eine Kabine mit Doppel-V-Bett zu bewegen. Segelleistung ist ausgezeichnet, vor allem in Bolina. (cit. GdV) Zusätzliche Informationen Elektrisches und hydraulisches System 2013
Español BOAT READY TO BUOY - BOAT LISTO PARA NAVEGAR Descripción Produced between 1982 and 1987 in a 80 piezas, es el primer Grand Soleil de las lines que luego hizo el éxito del Italian astillero. Barco clásico, sin excesos, with a borde libre bastante bajo y una sierra muy perfilada que desaparece hacia la proa, with a line azul que esbelta y caracteriza al barco. El proyecto es de Alain Jezequel, el deseñador al que se must lograr a large part of the barcos éxito de la década de 1980. Cubierto with a cabin recogida y timón de barra. Interior bien acabado with a hermosa cabaña de popa, a los lados de la correspondencia de descenso y la cocina, y luego pasar a dinette with sofás opuestos transformables y un arco de inodoro y a cabin with cama doble V. El rendimiento de navegación es excelente, especially upwind. (cit. GdV) Información adicional Sistema eléctrico e hidráulico 2013
Россию IMBARCAZIONE PRONTA АЛЛА БОА - ЛОДКА ГОТОВА К ОТПЛЫТИЮ Описание Произведено с 1982 по 1987 год примерно в 80 штук, это первый Grand Soleil из линий, которые затем сделал успех итальянской верфи. Классическая лодка, без эксцессов, с довольно низким свободным краем и очень профилированной палубой, которая исчезает к носу, с синей линией, которая стройная и характеризует лодку. Проект является Ален Jezequel, дизайнер, которому большая часть успеха лодки Пардо 1980-х годов из-за. Покрыты собранной кабиной и баром руля. Хорошо законченный интерьер с красивой афтой кабины, по бокам спуска корреспонденции и кухни, а затем перейти к динетт с трансформируемыми противоположных диванов и туалетный лук и кабина с двуспабельной кроватью V. Парусные показатели превосходны, особенно в болине. (cit. GdV) Дополнительная информация Электрическая и гидравлическая система 2013Mehr anzeigen

name: 2022 Jeanneau Sun Fast 33002022 Jeanneau Sun Fast 3300
description: A bold and uncompromising race boat designed for success! The Sun Fast 3300 is manufactured entirely using the injection molding process. This sailboat is characterized by its exceptional rigidity and significant weight reduction. Due to the very light and powerful hull, the double rudder and the straight keel, the new Sun Fast 3300 combines speed and stability with the best handling characteristics. Perfect for single-handed, double-handed or full crew racing, the Sun Fast 3300 will prove to be a tough regatta contender in competitions. The galley, the chart table, the two double cabins and the washroom have been designed to make your life on board easier. The technical equipment has been designed to be functional and reliable above all. Price ex works plus pre-carriage and accessory options We would be happy to make you a personal offer and look forward to hearing from you. In addition, we would be happy to advise you on financing issues through our partner SGB Finance. Images may show special options. Errors and omissions excepted. name: 1957 Buchanan Saxon1957 Buchanan Saxon
description:
Reduced from £29,500 to £24,995!
Alan Buchanan designs need little introduction.  A master of his art, he had a gift for designing yachts that are easy on the eye, sail beautifully and are comfortable and seakindly in all conditions.  Aelfwyn has been kept up to the mark by a careful owner - with recent sails and engine - and enjoyed notable success in local Regattas over the last 15 years, but now the time has come to move on.  She is currently registered as an historic vessel.
Viewing by appointment at our Suffolk Office (IP10 0LN) - 01473 659 681.
 
 Mehr anzeigen

name: 1969 Holman 341969 Holman 34
description:
Trocar was commissioned by her first owner as an IOR racer and went on to sail her in twelve  Fastnet races, winning prizes in ten of them; the last in 1993 and 3rd overall in 1975.  She was last raced in 1996.  Her present owner, a skilled cabinet maker, bought her in 2001 and completely refurbished and restored the boat to her original condition.  A survey on completion of this work commented that she was now 'better than new'.  Trocar is a typical Kim Holman design with elegant lines, impeccable handling and a good turn of speed.  Over the recent years she has had a new mast and rigging, new engine, electronics, teak deck, sails, electric anchor windlass, upholstery, cooker and much more.  She is presented for sale in fantastic condition and only needs antifouling (and possibly new standing rigging) before launching and would be ready to join the Classic Yacht circuit immediately.  Beautifully built and maintained to the highest standard, this is a classic yacht that will turn heads wherever she sails.  
Viewing by appointment at our Suffolk Office (IP10 0LN) 01473 659 681Mehr anzeigen

name: 1997 Jeanneau Sun Odyssey 34.21997 Jeanneau Sun Odyssey 34.2
description:
This Jeanneau Sun Odyssey 34.2 is a desirable owner's cabin version of these popular cruising yachts, offering spacious accommodation including a large double aft cabin, sizeable heads compartment, comfortable oval dining area, and a well equipped linear galley. They combine good sailing performance with easy shorthanded sailing, and lots of space and storage, ideal for longer term cruising or family use. 'Mas Que Nada' is presented in good condition for her age and is likely to be in high demand in the current market, so early viewing is highly recommended!
Viewing by prior appointment only through the Essex office on 01621 785600Mehr anzeigen

name: 1992 Vancouver 341992 Vancouver 34
description:
The Vancouver 34 is a well proven offshore cruiser designed by Robert Harris.  Their heavy displacement gives them a seakindly motion whilst retaining a light and positive feel to the helm.  Built to a high standard by Northshore with an attractive fit out and a seamanlike layout that works well at sea.  This much travelled example comes with windvane steering, Coppercoat antifouling, bowthruster, central heating, good sails, recent standing rigging and best of all, no teak deck.  She is sensibly priced, so don't hesitate to come and have a look.
Viewing by appointment through our Suffolk Office 01473 659 681.Mehr anzeigen

name: 2018 Dufour 3602018 Dufour 360
description:
At Dufour, design and practicality are not synonymous with large units. Every sailboat deserves the best so the Dufour 360 boasts all the range’s innovations and features. This winning bet sets it apart and makes it unique.
A quick and stable hull whatever the speed, a fully equipped steering station and an immense cockpit secured by the rear seats with a complete galley. And the Dufour 360 has much to offer inside. As well as two and three-cabin options, the lounge’s double bench can accommodate up to eight guests at your table.
Whether you’re taking in the coastline with family, on a regatta with friends or sailing around the world, the Dufour 360 aspires to offer sensational enjoyment whatever the circumstances.
Available with Management Program until 31/12/2023Mehr anzeigen

name: 1970 Sparkman & Stephens S&S 341970 Sparkman & Stephens S&S 34
description:
Designed by the famous S&S studio in 1969, built by Winfield & Partners, it was produced in England and Australia in 400 units. Exceptional construction and level of finish, the S&S 34 is a small elegant sailing ship with "shark" fin, separate rudder with an important skeg, sloop rigged with exceptional qualities in upwind speeds, making sure to adjust the mainsail well. Engine installed in the middle of the boat, the boat was born with a racing spirit without neglecting the care of the interiors thanks to a generous maximum beam (for the time) that allowed a decidedly logical and functional arrangement. Optional cradle The information presented here is generic and for first contact. In case of real interest please contact us by email or call for more detailed and updated information.

name: 1984 Deerberg Saphir III incl. Trailer1984 Deerberg Saphir III incl. Trailer
description: For private reasons, this elegant, very well maintained long keeler, GRP built in 1984, is now for sale at a reasonable price. Special construction based on the classic plan from 1920 with overhangs at the bow and stern. Very quiet location at sea. Space miracle, 5 berths with standing height in the cockpit, completely free cockpit, since the sails are guided outside the cockpit, that was a tradition in 1920. Only sailed by the owner, ocean-going boat license holder with traditional entry, accident-free, third owner since 1999. Only indoor winter storage, wanted to be on the Baltic Sea with our yacht for at least 20 years. Therefore we have invested heavily in the safety and renewal of standing and running rigging. She was always maintained in the shipyard, everything was clearly documented. The yacht has everything a sailor's heart desires, state-of-the-art in terms of safety. Electronics system with large cross-section and underwater hull completely renewed by a specialist company in 2018. 5 x 100W batteries with battery control unit, one of which is only for the motor. Battened main with LaziJacks and collection bag with zip, Furler furler everything from 2015, sail white like new, not dirty or worn out. Jib and genoa from 2018, cutter rigging possible, cake stall new from 2019, new Weihe trailer from 2017, Volvo Penta 28hp with 237 operating hours, newly installed in 2015 by Deterswerft shipyard, with access via the cockpit and engine control to the front, starboard for a better overview , relocated. Pine steering with self-steering system.... Interior bright and friendly renewed in 2010 with precious woods and lots of white. New pump toilet installed in 2020. 3flam. Gas cooker built into the table, but still transportable to cook outside, cool box, fabric upholstery, sails, cake stand are stored at home over the winter. The chart plotter can be swiveled outwards and is therefore clearly visible when sailing. Traditional chart navigation also possible outside, above the companionway with built-in chart table and GPS. Chart table folds away below deck, radio, handheld radio, safe save for flare gun, many extras... Plenty of space for the family, can be sailed with one hand, the yacht comes with everything! accessories delivered. For 20 years, we always transported our yacht to the summer berth in Heiligenhafen via the NOK in the spring, and in the fall it went back to winter storage in Bremerhaven. Here it is now in the hall. All questions will be answered. Inspection in Bremerhaven possible at any time. Please make me an offer. Price negotiable. Summer berth in Bremerhaven possible in the first year as a guest boater and later as a club member.Show more

description: We bought our dream ship in the Netherlands in 2015 and since then have continuously optimized it according to our ideas. The process is not finished, but for health and family reasons we decided to give up sailing and bought a motor boat. The db1 has been in our club hall on the Priwall in Travemünde in winter since 2015, where it can also be inspected. The winter storage block can also be purchased. The shrouds were shortened the year before last due to new putties and checked by the rigger. No damage known. The underwater hull was completely rebuilt before our purchase (according to broker). The db1 is an epoxy hull, so the boat cannot get osmosis. name: 1989 Reinke Taranga1989 Reinke Taranga
description: Maimiti for sale We are selling our Maimiti, a Reinke Taranga from 1989. We have been through a lot with her, but now it's time to give her to someone else. In 2019/2020 I sailed with her across the Atlantic to the Caribbean, where she is still located. Her berth is currently Grenada in the southern Caribbean (outside the hurricane belt). We will fly there again during the summer holidays and would then like to hand it over to the new owner, which would then be at the beginning of August. Facts and figures: Length overall: 10.20m Width: 3.25m Draft: 1.40m Hull shape: Multi-chine Keel shape: Short keel Tonnage: 6t Sail area: 51m² Sails: Large, genoa, wind genoa, jib, storm jib, blister First watering 1989 Motorization: Marinated VW Golf Diesel with 54HP (cheap spare parts) Water tank approx. 150l + 80l diesel tank approx. 180l Solar 200W for two circuits (comfort and navigation) Berth: Grenada in the Caribbean I bought the boat myself in 2017 and am only the second owner. In the following two years I prepared it for the long trip and at the beginning of 2019 we went on a long trip with our Maimiti as a family with three children. name: 1992 Bavaria 3201992 Bavaria 320
description: We offer our checkbook maintained sailing yacht Bavaria 320 for sale. The boat is white and has a teak deck. The boat is a spacious cruising sailor with 6 berths, kitchen with sink, fridge and stove with oven, toilet room and navigation area. The interior is made entirely of mahogany, lovingly maintained and looks like new. In the cockpit there is a huge locker where you can store just about anything. It is steered with a large steering wheel. All halyards and sheets can be operated from the cockpit, so that the yacht can be comfortably sailed by just one person. Sailing yacht Bavaria 320 built in 1992 Length: 10.18 m Length of waterline: 8.30 m Width: 3.20 m Draft: 1.65 m, normal keel Sail area: approx. 50 sqm Weight: approx. 3700 kg Engine: Yanmar 3 GM 30 SD 20, built-in diesel, 27 hp, regularly serviced 100 l diesel tank 210 l fresh water tank All sailing accessories are on board including spinnaker and full tarpaulin to cover. The only flaw: the wooden deck is beginning to come loose in a few places, so that it would have to be replaced in places over the next few years. The ship is moored in Kressbronn on Lake Constance, unfortunately it is NOT possible to take over the berth.Show more

name: 1986 Fellowship 331986 Fellowship 33
description:
Fellowship 33 . converted for world travel


The Fellowship 33 that we offer you has been maintained and maintained at a very high level by the current owner. the ship was completely prepared in the years 2010-2012 to be able to undertake a world trip. unfortunately the then owner never got around to it, however many improvements have been made to the ship that the current owner enjoys. the current owner has also upgraded the yacht every year and therefore invested regularly. (a list of upgrades is available on request)
The Fellowship 33 is a very seaworthy and good sailing ship, because of her heavy long keel (made extra deep at 1.50m1 instead of 1.25m1), especially for safe sailing on longer journeys.
You step on board via the extended stainless steel bowsprit, which provides space for 2 headsails; the ship is therefore cutter rigged. Via the heavy electric anchor winch you can walk to the rear over the wide gangways. the windows in the saloon are in a sturdy metal frame. The cozy cokpit is protected by a lockable tent. Behind the steering wheel is the aft cabin, spacious enough for 2 people. Via the stairs to the front you enter the ship and at starboard is the galley, before that the chart table/navigation corner. To port the round seat, spacious enough for 4 people. further forward to port the sanitary unit and in the front another spacious double berth.
Under the floor in the cockpit is the strong Vetus Diesel with approximately 62 HP. the engine compartment can also be reached from the saloon by removing the stairs.
The yacht is tastefully decorated and very well maintained, with practicalities in mind, such as the lack of gas which is very safe.
Interior photos are made by us and show the current status. We have thoroughly inspected the yacht; ask us for more information, if you find it desirable.

name: 1985 Beachcraft Beachcraft 341985 Beachcraft Beachcraft 34
description:
As a Dutch shipyard, the Beachcraft 34 was clearly designed according to the requirements of fifty/fifty yachting. That means: Sailing sporty but comfortably with wind (+ horsepower reserves for adverse conditions) - without wind, reach your destination quickly with machine travel. With a live weight of 8000 kg and in top condition, the Beachcraft 34 is ready for any journey imaginable. This is guaranteed by outstanding equipment, a new rig (including masts and sails) and the need-based division of working and living space on board: with a comfortable center cockpit (hardtop), three cabins (5 fixed berths), headroom everywhere below deck, plenty of sea-tight storage space and excellent accessibility to the engine. Rigged as a ketch, the Beachcraft 34 is equipped with a self-tacking jib, furling genoa and genacker. A PV panel on the hardtop. Thanks to the bow propeller, it is possible to handle the ship with less effort, especially when maneuvering in port. Overall, the Beachcraft 34 offers the best conditions for those switching from pure sailing and for families!
Furnishings: Interior made of teak, cabin, lockable cabin, built-in cupboards, shelves, curtains, sleeping places inside, seats inside, seats outside, hatch, viewing window cabin, upholstery, lamps, 12 volt sockets, 220 volt sockets, toilet room, electric lake toilet, washbasin, Diesel parking heater overhauls, radio with cassette+CD, storage space, fabric seats, upholstery covers, carpeting, shore power supply, table inside, headroom inside, headroom outside, hot water boiler (engine and 230V) Cockpit instruments: speedometer, rev counter, oil pressure gauge, fuel gauge, battery gauge, temperature display, el. Compass, depth sounder, engine compartment fan, battery switch, battery main switch, battery, battery charger, Lowrance chart plotter color chart set Navionics gold Baltic Sea, GPS, DHI lighting, VHF radio (Sailor A1), bow thruster, wooden steering wheel, elctr. Windshield wipers Pantry kitchen Lamps, built-in cupboards, 2 burner stove, oven, sink, refrigerator, crockery, pots, cutlery, tarpaulins and covers Cockpit cover, cake stand, windbreak aft deck, bimini accessories and attachments Fender, linen, bathing ladder, bilge pump, railing, anchor, anchor chain, Radio cassette, CD, cleats, fuse box, antifouling, shore connection cable With 'Pött un Pann' and trailer with 4x twin tires, (1-circuit) air brakes and TÜV approval. name: 2008 Van De Stadt 10.102008 Van De Stadt 10.10
description:
Beautifully built Van de Stadt in neat condition - many extras - 140 cm keel - strong diesel engine


The hull of this beautiful Van de Stadt was built in 1987 and came into the possession of the current owners in 2003. These are professional technicians who have completely rebuilt the boat in-house with great care. Only the hull and keel are from 1987. In the period 2003-2008 the entire interior was refitted and the deck was renewed. After that, the boat is equipped with a new rig, a new engine and new electricity. Only the very best materials have been used. In 2008 the yacht was put into service again. The yacht is built from woodcore epoxy, a material known for strength, rigidity and good insulating properties. Woodcore epoxy is also low-maintenance and durable. The yacht is easy to sail and everything can be operated from the cockpit. Below deck it is spacious and comfortable. The headroom is 188 cm and the beds are 2 meters long and wonderfully wide. In addition to the spacious owner's cabin in the foreship, there is an aft cabin with a large single bed and in the saloon there are also two single beds available. The kitchen unit is easily accessible and the worktop is made of luxurious Corian natural stone, with a large refrigerator and stainless steel oven. This really is a wonderful family yacht suitable for fantastic holidays and completely ready to sail.

name: 1984 Coaster Passagemaker 331984 Coaster Passagemaker 33
description:
The Coaster 33 is a substantial canoe-sterned motorsailer on an MFV style hull, with wide, safe decks and substantial gunnels, highly praised when launched for their quality of build and performance under both sail and power. Considered great alternatives to a Nauticat 33 or Fisher 34, 'Osprey' is a very rare Passagemaker, offering a secondary tiller helm for an improved sailing experience and superior exterior space thanks to their aft cockpit layout. Presented in excellent condition for her age and benefitting from a recent Beta 50hp engine and tan cruising sails she would be ideal for long-term cruising, and could even be used as a very economic displacement motor cruiser, ideal for coastal and river exploration!

description:

Shirias II is in very good condition for her age and has an impressive inventory including wheel steering, radar, self-tailing winches, windvane self-steering, recent standing rigging, professionally resprayed topsides and epoxy coatings, but has been laid up ashore for an extended period due to her owner's health. Priced competitively to reflect the recommissioning and updating that her next owner will need to carry out, she could easily be one of the best of her class once completed, and should be strongly considered by all Nicholson 32 enthusiasts or serious offshore sailors.

New driveshaft from 2021 with new motor bearings
We bought the Vilm 2 years ago and put a lot of time and money into it. The Vilm has a built-in shower with an 80l hot water boiler that can be heated electrically or via the 75 hp diesel engine.
The Vilm can be used both as a sail and as a motor boat. The deck saloon keeps you dry even in bad weather. Our previous owner used the Vilm as a houseboat for 10 years. The Vilm is equipped with all sorts of technical refinements such as an active AIS. So you can also easily make a circumnavigation by boat. Now to the pending maintenance tasks, the Vilm has a GRP hull on which no work is necessary. The superstructures are made of wood, so that work has to be carried out here, as with any wooden ship. The teak deck has to be partially repointed due to its age. The teak is approx. 14mm thick, so there are no problems when working with it. A part has already been processed, there is still enough Sikaflex for the whole ship. Here I would like to point out again, at the moment part of the deck has already been repointed, but we have not yet sanded and oiled this part, so the boat is currently covered with a tarpaulin to protect against rain and sun. The engine has a new drive shaft and new bearings. New cushions have also been purchased for the foredeck and the saloon. The two diesel tanks need a revision or should be exchanged for new tanks due to their age. The Vilm is nothing for people who don't have any craftsmanship! The work that has to be done on every wooden ship requires time and love! I emphasize the word time!!!!!!!!!!! Due to lack of time we hand over the ship. There is work to be done on the ship! If you don't have time, please buy a Vilm for about 90,000 euros and not for 20,000.00.
If you want a visit, we are usually in Sloten at the weekend so that this can be done free of charge on Sundays.
If you would like a visit during the week or on days when we are not in Sloten, you are welcome to do so for a reimbursement of 200 euros in advance! I then take the day off and drive to Sloten. I lost a whole day so I would like to have this expense reimbursed. If you make a purchase, the amount will of course be credited.
Due to bad experiences in the past, I reserve the boat only against advance payment of 2,000 euros.
Subject to prior sale and errors.MFGJan WilhelmsI am happy to answer any further questions by telephone on +49 (0)171/8648745.
I can send videos and photos via WhatsApp!Show more

name: 2012 Cornish Crabber 262012 Cornish Crabber 26
description:
Unique Cornish Crabber 26


Unique Cornish Crabber 26 for the Netherlands with many options. the ship is in very good condition. Would you like to scurry comfortably on the mudflats, or anchor in the shallowest places (boat is only 80 cm deep!) on the Frisian lakes? then this Cornish Crabber 26 is very suitable for you.
The boat has a nice appearance on the water and because it is equipped with a bowsprit that can be picked up, you can lie on the most beautiful spots in the harbor. The boat is then only 7 meters long. It is also possible to lower the mast yourself, if necessary. The powerful 3 cylinder 20 hp engine has enough power to make good speed on the engine. The ship is unique in that, despite its small length, it is very spacious and has headroom in the entire cabin. The cozy interior, a complete oven, refrigerator and spacious toilet make the ship an ideal family boat for a weekend away or even a few weeks on the water.
The boat is technically in perfect condition. Engine has very few operating hours (less than 100) Boat has just had a new underwater hull and the engine has had a complete service min 2022, all woodwork is in top condition, sails are in excellent condition.
Of course, the complete history, all invoices, instructions for use and documents are also available.
You can board and sail away.
New price of this Crabber in 2022: 175,000 euros.

name: 1964 Noord Nederland segelboot mit decksalon1964 Noord Nederland segelboot mit decksalon
description: Sailing boat with deck saloon Family-friendly cruising ship Farewell doesn't sail like a regatta, but does do so in a sporty way. For comfort there is a deckhouse (new build Greifswalder Museumswerft 2019, mahogany frame with plywood filling), so Farewell looks like a small cutter. If you want to feel the wind at the helm, you will also find an outside steering position. Farewell was built in 1964 at the shipyard Jachtbouw Noord Nederland (steel, galvanised) and is being sold with the well-maintained original interior (mahogany). In the saloon, the boat offers a pantry with gas stove, sink (pressurized water system) and refrigerator, as well as a comfortable seating area that can be converted into a double berth if required. In the deck saloon you can sit well with 4 people at the (rotating) table, as in the galley you have standing height here. In the foredeck is the on-board toilet, a wardrobe and a large double berth. Another 2 berths are located in the aft ship. There is enough storage space everywhere, even for long journeys. The ship comes with three sails, all in beige by Elvström: furling genoa, self-tacking jib on the boom, main with 4 battens. Standing and running rigging is in very good condition. Nautical equipment: GPS, VHF radio, echo sounder, compass, many sea charts Engine: SABB 2G, an indestructible Norwegian fishing diesel, 2-cylinder slow-speed engine, 22 hp, is started with a fuse. The engine has always been well serviced and maintained, various spare parts are included. After 18 eventful years with Farewell, I am looking for a new owner who is enthusiastic about the boat. Get in touch if you need more information or want to visit Farewell.Show more

name: 1985 CN TODINI BAUXITE 999 DL1985 CN TODINI BAUXITE 999 DL
description:
1985 CN TODINI BAUXITE 999 DL,
XBOAT ref 5061.This 10-meter ballasted dinghy sailboat (Draught 1.10/2.20), in aluminum built by the CN TODINI is designed to sail far away in complete safety.The interior was made by the first owner, insulating the deck and the topsides of the hull. The layout proposed in a forward cabin version with a bathroom, a saloon that can accommodate 5 people, a pivoting chart table allowing access to a sea berth. The galley has a 2-burner stove and an oven. , a refrigerator (to finish connecting) and double stainless steel tank with manual water pump. The 33 hp VETUS engine was installed in 1994, a set of crutches allows a grounding. The deck painting with application of non-slip paint was done in 2017/2018, the portholes were replaced in 2019. This boat is aimed at first-time buyers seduced by this concept of sailboat. Rare boat on the second-hand boat market. Complete inventory on request. name: 2023 Northman Maxus 34 Electric2023 Northman Maxus 34 Electric
description:
Modern sailing with the new Maxus 34 Electric!The Maxus 34 Electric offers comfort, sportiness and lots of sailing fun. Enjoy the feeling of freedom and adventure while standing at the steering wheel. The sleek, ergonomic hull cuts smoothly through the water and the modern lines of the Maxus 34 Electric offers enormous speed potential. 
The clear deck layout and spacious cockpit are both efficient and well thought out thanks to Northman Shipyard's many years of experience with the line Maxus sailing yachts. The Maxus 34 Electric offers full control from the helm, all lines can be handled from the cockpit and the self-tacking jib (standard) makes it easy to sail with a small crew. 
Electric drive and optimal functionalityThe yacht has a 100% electric drive. The powerful electric motor allows you to manoeuvre easily and precisely to enjoy emission-free and silent cruising.
The spacious cockpit, with room for 8, offers two sofas and a folding table. The high level of comfort makes the Maxus 34 Electric the ideal yacht for a long sailing holiday with family or friends. Mehr anzeigen
