name: 2022 Beaconax Bluestorm 9002022 Beaconax Bluestorm 900
description: The BlueStorm 900 offers sailing performance and agility like that of a dinghy cruiser and the sense of security of a keel yacht. Like all BlueStorm yachts, it can be highly customized both in the interior and in the area of ​​deck construction, including superstructure. Personal requirements can be implemented individually with a BlueStorm. Condition: new to order from the shipyard - individual and versatile Control: tiller with fixed double rudder Sails: mainsail 23 m², headsail 17 m² Keel: swing keel central 0.90 m to 2.20 m, other options such as twin keel selectable As a hiker between the Described worlds apart, the Bluestorm 900 offers the agility of a dinghy cruiser with the comfort of a keel yacht. The BlueStorm 900 is a sporty and agile cruiser that can plane and invites you to cruise. Due to the variable draft, it has a large range of territory. Due to the double oars, it can easily fall dry and does not need any trestles. Thanks to its width of 3 m, it can be trailered with the right towing vehicle with a dead weight of 1.8 t. Like the other BlueStorm yachts, the 900 can also be customized. This adaptability is possible below deck but also on deck. The boat should suit the owner and his requirements. It is just as suitable as a family boat as it is for single-handed sailors. The design of the yacht can be adjusted in this regard. The BlueStorm 900 is at home in tidal areas and allows access to mudflats, shallow bays and harbors with the swing keel. The swing keel allows the draft to be reduced to 90 centimetres. With a width of 3 meters and a weight of 1.8 tons, it can also be trailered and is cheap in terms of maintenance costs. The perfectly coordinated twin rudder system increases the fun factor of sailing. But a lot has happened since the first edition and the BlueStorm 900 impresses with a high degree of sustainability, modern design, classy sailing characteristics and a lot of creative freedom. Against the background of our convictions and philosophy, many components are already included in the standard that are obligatory with other surcharges. The double rudder system, the variable draft and the minimum requirements for nautical and electrical equipment are therefore included in the basic scope. We're happy to answer any questions.Show more

name: 2018 Domani S302018 Domani S30
description:
Very nice Domani S30 Daysailer.


Domani S30 Sportyacht
We like to call the DOMANI S30 a sports yacht, with its specific mix of sporty features, performance, direct steering and the timeless features, comfort and luxury of a sailing yacht. The thrills of sailing with this compact yacht easily rival the appeal and appearance of a larger vessel. The aft deck is just fantastic for sitting or sunbathing and offers easy access to the water, an elegant swim or a refreshing swim is done in no time. The interior is luxurious, comfortable and bright with diffused natural light and views while the low sheer enhances that grand feeling of becoming one with wind and water.
Sportiness and performance are in every detail
Arriving first at the finish is not a must in day sailing. Speed ​​and sporting characteristics did play an important role in the design phase, as evidenced by the extended laminate mainsail; for sailing in good weather, the code 0, carried from a unique bowsprit. Of course also the carbon tiller and the 1.20 bulb keel. While the S30 may look like the lounge boat of choice, once the sails are set, this yacht moves fast, agile and seaworthy. Naval architecture as a basis, design as added value.
Due to the electric drive and the fact that the ship is easy to trailer, she is very suitable for the European lakes/coastal waters, such as the IJsselmeer, Wadden Sea, Lake Constance, Chiemsee, Lake Como or Lake Maggiore. With the S30 on the trailer you can easily drive to Croatia or Sweden.
Interior photos are made by us and show the current status. We have thoroughly inspected the yacht; ask us for more information, if you find it desirable.
Appointments for viewings can be arranged 6 days a week in advance directly with the White Whale Yachtbrokers Northern Netherlands; office in Sneek. mail: sneek@wwy.nl or call +31 515 423 467
Do you also want to sell your boat? White Whale Yachtbrokers has 11 offices in Europe. We simply sell your boat from your own berth, for a low commission. Free advertising on the most relevant and leading websites including Yachtworld.com. No start-up costs, always no-cure-no-pay!! Feel free to ask us for a proposal for your own yacht.

name: 2023 Winner Winner 9 plus2023 Winner Winner 9 plus
description: The Winner 9 plus, the reference in your segment! It contains all the attributes that you would expect from a WINNER. She is the contemporary interpretation of an individual yacht by sailors for sailors. She consistently continues the tradition of the shipyard's fast, high-quality and stable-value sailing yachts. As a successor to the WINNER 9.50, which is extremely popular with 260 units, we have created a fast and handy yacht in the important 30-foot range. The Winner 9 plus offers everything that is needed for efficient and safe sailing: There is no teak in the cockpit at the entrance and it is sailed with a tiller. For those who prefer a wheel, a version that can be swiveled to the side can be ordered. An extendable gennaker boom also gives the Winner 9 plus wings. There are three drafts to choose from (1.25 to 1.90m), whereby the keel can also be changed later if the yacht changes e.g. the area or the ambition changes, since the keel foundations of Winner yachts are basically identical. Design category A makes the Winner 9 plus seaworthy and the classic hull construction with laminated deck-hull connection ensures a lifelong watertight and torsion-free ship and thus a high value retention. Winner 9 plus - Order your new Winner directly from the manufacturer! Call us or send us an email: we look forward to hearing from you! Also visit winneryachts.com for more information

name: 1939 Drachen 1939 Drachen
description: This historic wooden kite is being sold due to a change of territory. One of the previous owners was Gunder Thunberg (ship's papers available). The boat was built in 1939 at the Swedish boat school in Lysekill near Gothenburg. It is a masterpiece in the truest sense of the word. It is dimensionally stable and hardly leaks even after a long winter. The hull is made of Oregon pine, which makes the ship look different from other kites. The staff deck was completely rebuilt a few years ago by a renowned boatyard. Annual maintenance in winter storage by a renowned boatyard is given, so that the ship can be launched and sailed immediately. The boat is in very good condition. Among other things, the shrouds were replaced in 2021 and the backstays were completely renewed in 2020. The ship was used as a leisure boat and was rarely used in regattas. The berth on the Alster can be taken over for the current season 22. Subsequent takeover not excluded. Loa: 8.90 m Bua: 1.90 m draft: 1.25 m aluminum mast, spinnaker pole, spinnaker (as new), 1 set of sails from Nova-Sail, full tarpaulin. Buyer trailer, very good condition. name: 2016 Tirion HP282016 Tirion HP28
description:
Distinctive and good sailing Daysailer, with full interior.


The Tirion HP28 is a good sailing yacht, with pleasant sailing characteristics. The hull design is by De Ridder Yachtdesign. The Tirrion HP28 has been thoughtfully built, making the yacht easy and comfortable to sail. This one off HP version has been built with an eye for detail, resulting in a distinctive yacht, with beautifully executed details. Although the yacht is designed as a Daysailer, this type description does not do justice to the possibilities of this HP28. Inside you will find a practical, but fully-fledged interior to be able to stay comfortably on board. The yacht provides, among other things, in a forward cabin, toilet room and small galley.


General
Steering: Composite tiller with extender. Jefa bearing system for rudder stock
Windows: Aluminum gates and deck hatch
Air draft normal: Easy lowerable mast.
Other:
This Tirion HP28 was built by an experienced yacht builder, who has worked at various leading national and international shipyards, specialized in composite construction. This HP version is a one-off variant with a distinctive construction. During construction, a lot of attention was paid to beautiful, practical solutions.
The design of the Tirion is based on a hull design by leading design agency De Ridder Yachtdesign, which guarantees good sailing characteristics. However, this one off HP28 is distinguished by a different keel variant. Instead of a shallow fin keel, a bilge keel with NACA profile shafts and ballast bulb was chosen. Despite the shallow draft, the yacht thus retains good sailing characteristics.
The hull is constructed from an epoxy laminate with a Cedar core. The deck and superstructure are made of 20 mm. foam core, with 1500 grams of fiberglass on both sides. The yacht is equipped with a Kevlar web frame to reinforce the deck and putts.
The deck and cockpit layout is modern, well-arranged and 'clean'. A very nicely executed detail are the 'flush' drainage channels incorporated in the deck, with which pipe water is drained before it reaches the cockpit. The large cockpit, with comfortable seats on the gangway, thus remains dry for a long time.
This Tirion 28HP has been used very lightly and is therefore in almost new condition.

Accommodation
Material, colours: The interior is not yet equipped with cushions / upholstery
Saloons: Interior with kitchen, two long benches, cupboard space and forward cabin. Also dog cages under cockpit seats.
Cabins: Front cabin, with spacious V-shaped bed
Berths: Two extra berths in a dog cage under the cockpit seats
Cooker & fuel: 2-burner gimbal cooking comfort, on alcohol
Other:
The Tirion HP28 has a relatively long structure, which benefits the interior space. Although the interior of Daysailers is often subordinate, the space on board the HP28 is used optimally. Since the yacht does not have a central fin keel with wriggles, floor parts can be omitted and the full height of the interior space is used.
The interior is beautifully finished, using Abachi wood parts and sporty carbon details. At the moment the yacht is not yet equipped with a cushion set and mattresses, but of course this is possible. The fact that we are dealing with a real sailor here is apparent from the conventional, but practical layout:
As soon as you enter you will find a dog cage on both port and starboard, with sufficient length to act as an extra sleeping place. Although the yacht already has the necessary storage space, the dog cages can also be used as extra storage spaces. To starboard you will then find a full-fledged chart table, under which an electric refrigerator is also mounted.
To properly prepare the contents of the refrigerator, a nearly state-of-the-art kitchen has been built on the port side, with 2-burner cooking comfort and a sink with running water. A nice and sporty detail; the kitchen worktop and sink are made of carbon. In the saloon area there are two longitudinal benches of approximately 125 cm and although they are sporty, they still offer comfortable seating.
Two cupboard spaces have been built into the foreship, with the starboard cupboard actually being a (wet) cupboard. To port, the carbon door conceals a full-fledged Jabsco pump toilet, with attached holding tank. In order to offer the necessary privacy, the carbon doors of the cabinets have been thoughtfully designed so that when folded open, they shield the space of the toilet and the forward cabin. It is also possible to shield the front cabin in this way, where a double bed is built in.

Engine, electrics, water
Fuel Tank Quantity: Integrated Epoxy Tank
Voltage: 12 Volt on-board network with switch panel at chart table
Alternator: Alternator on main engine
Water tank & material: Epoxy, integrated water tank.
Holding tank & material: Holding tank with deck extraction
Shore power: Separate connection
Other:
This Trion HP28 is equipped with a full Yanmar 9hp inboard diesel, with sail drive. This greatly benefits the ease of use when sailing and maneuvering and also offers the possibility to navigate larger waters better on the engine.

Rigging
Rigging type: Fractional rigging with two sets, arrow spreaders
Spars, stays: Aluminum mast, on carbon mast foot.
Winches: Antal self tailing 2-speed
Ironing installation: Carbon mast support and single-line talie on built-in winch
Sailing material: Maxx Apen tarpaulin
Genoa: NED31 Sailmakers Cross cut, 17 m2
Jib: NED31 Sailmakers High Aspect, 13.5 m2
Gennaker: NED31 Sailmakers, 45 m2
Number of masts: Selden aluminum mast profile, with custom carbon boom. Rodkicker up/down holder
Other:
The Tirion HP28 has a well thought-out fractional rigging with two sets of arrowed spreaders. The main rigging and puttings are positioned in such a way that a backstay could be omitted. This not only benefits the ease of use under sailors, but also facilitates boarding on board in the port.
All halyards and sheets are guided below deck to two self tailing winches, making the deck look sleek and 'clean'. The winches in the cockpit stand on a deck-integrated base, in which a recess is already provided during construction, in order to be able to store the winch handle.
The yacht is rigged with a Selden aluminum mast profile, which is mounted above deck in a Carbon mast foot, with pivot point. The mast is easy to lower by means of a single-line talie on a concealed winch in the deck. The mainsail can be moored and remain on the boom. Speaking of the boom? The yacht has a striking custom made, open carbon boom; Another beautiful and striking detail on board!


Navigation and electronics
Other:

A universal NMEA transmitter has been installed in the plane since construction, to which various types of navigation electronics can be connected as desired.


Equipment
Sea rails: stainless steel fencing up to the superstructure, stainless steel stanchions and pulpit
Other:

Boxes in the cockpit, under the gangways
Storage space under cockpit floor, accessible via deck hatch.


Safety
Other:

Preliminary information subject to client.

name: 2022 Corsair 880 Trimarano2022 Corsair 880 Trimarano
description:
TRIMARAN CORSAIR 880 READY FOR DELIVERY. The new Corsair 880 is the latest carriageable sport cruiser built by the famous corsair Marine shipyard, which has been building and developing trimarans for more than 30 years. Designed to allow families and groups of up to 8 people to sail for weeks on end. Easy, light and fast, it has incredible sailing performance. Its movable centreboard will allow you to go all the way to the beach!!! Worried about mooring? No problem because the side hulls can be folded down and its width can be reduced to 2.50 m, which makes this fantastic boat also easy to trailer. Eglass laminated vacuum hull with extensive use of carbon fibre. Carbon rotating mast, dyneema sartie, carbon battened mainsail, gennaker and self-tacking jib. All this without forgetting the necessities for comfortable cruising: 2 double cabins, saloon table that can be converted into a single berth, gas cooker, sink, fridge and toilet.
—
TRIMARANO CORSAIR 880 IN PRONTA CONSEGNA. Il nuovo Corsair 880 è l'ultimo sport cruiser carrellabile, costruito del famoso cantiere corsair Marine, che da più di 30 anni costruisce e sviluppa trimarani. Progettato per permettere alle famiglie e ai gruppi fino a 8 persone di navigare per settimane intere. Facile, leggero e veloce ha performance incredibili a vela. La sua deriva mobile ti permetterà di arrivare fino in spiaggia!! Sei preoccupato per l’ormeggio? Nessun problema perchè gli scafi laterali si possono richiudere e la sua larghezza si può ridurre a 2,50 mt il che rende questa fantastica imbarcazione anche facilmente carrellabile. Scafo sottovuoto laminato Eglass con ampio uso di fibra di carbonio. Albero rotante in carbonio, Sartie in dyneema, Randa steccata in carbonio, Gennaker e Fiocco autovirante. Tutto questo senza dimenticare il necessario per una comoda crociera: 2 cabine doppie, Tavolo del salone trasformabile in cuccetta singola, cucina a gas, lavello, frigorifero e wc. Possibilità di fare un nuovo leasing.
—
TRIMARAN CORSAIR 880 PRÊT À ÊTRE LIVRÉ. Le nouveau Corsair 880 est le tout dernier sport-croisière transportable construit par le célèbre chantier corsair Marine, qui construit et développe des trimarans depuis plus de 30 ans. Conçu pour permettre aux familles et aux groupes jusqu'à 8 personnes de naviguer pendant des semaines. Facile, léger et rapide, il possède d'incroyables performances de navigation. Sa dérive mobile vous permettra d'aller jusqu'à la plage ! !! Vous avez peur de vous amarrer ? Aucun problème car les coques latérales peuvent être repliées et sa largeur peut être réduite à 2,50 m, ce qui rend ce fantastique bateau également facile à remorquer. Coque en verre laminé sous vide avec utilisation extensive de fibre de carbone. Mât rotatif en carbone, sartie en dyneema, grand-voile lattée en carbone, gennaker et foc auto-vireur. Tout cela sans oublier le nécessaire pour une croisière confortable : 2 cabines doubles, table du salon transformable en couchette simple, cuisinière à gaz, évier, réfrigérateur et toilettes.
—
TRIMARAN CORSAIR 880 BEREIT ZUR AUSLIEFERUNG. Der neue Corsair 880 ist der neueste fahrbare Sportkreuzer der berühmten Werft corsair Marine, die seit mehr als 30 Jahren Trimarane baut und entwickelt. Er wurde entwickelt, um Familien und Gruppen von bis zu 8 Personen wochenlanges Segeln zu ermöglichen. Es ist einfach, leicht und schnell und verfügt über unglaubliche Segeleigenschaften. Sein bewegliches Schwert ermöglicht es Ihnen, bis zum Strand zu segeln!!! Haben Sie Angst vor dem Anlegen? Kein Problem, denn die Seitenrümpfe können heruntergeklappt und die Breite auf 2,50 m reduziert werden, so dass dieses fantastische Boot auch leicht getrailt werden kann. Vakuum-Rumpf aus Glasfaserlaminat mit umfangreicher Verwendung von Kohlefaser. Drehbarer Karbonmast, Dyneema-Sartie, Karbon-Lattengroßsegel, Gennaker und Selbstwendefock. All dies, ohne die Notwendigkeiten für komfortables Segeln zu vergessen: 2 Doppelkabinen, Salontisch, der in eine Einzelkoje umgewandelt werden kann, Gasherd, Spüle, Kühlschrank und Toilette.

name: 2022 TES Yacht Tes 28 Magnam2022 TES Yacht Tes 28 Magnam
description: TES 28 Magnam We produce the yacht to order. We can customize it to suit your needs. All boats manufactured by us are EU taxed. We can organize transport worldwide. The price shown is the standard price but includes: - steering column with wheel and hydraulic steering - full sails with lazybag and lazyjack, jaib roller with UV, - fittings made of A4 steel with 25mm profile, - interior with waterproof veneered and varnished plywood with a teak -Marine floor, - complete electrical installation with 12V, USB and 230V with connection - full throttle installation - complete water installation All components used by us are brands and of high quality. Please contact us - we will be happy to send you a complete price list and the current delivery date. Tes 28 Magnam Yacht Specification: - Length - 8.69m² - Beam 2.98m - Draft - 0.36m - Weight - 3900kg - Interior Height - 1.87m² - Category - B/C - CE Certificate - yes - versions - swing keel / false keel / fixed keel - fittings - steel A4 (316) - interior - waterproof veneered varnished plywood - engine - outboard / in a well / stationary diesel / stationary electric TES 28 Magnam is a nearly 9 meter long vessel , a comfortable and safe tourist yacht with a modern and dynamic hull line. Depending on the equipment variant, the unit is designed for 2 to 4 people in the owner's version and 6-8 people in the charter version. Perfect for sailing on both inland and sea waters (design category B or C depending on ballasting method). The center section is a typical mess with a well-appointed galley. Large sanitary cabin with toilet and shower. A separate aft place for 2 people. All rooms are heated. The yacht is ventilated via five hatches. In the central part there is a comfortable mess with an ergonomic, well-equipped galley. The yacht is characterized by excellent living conditions that guarantee maximum comfort for the crew. It has a very safe high back cockpit, it is equipped with a closed stern (tailgate) to prevent accidental falling out. The yacht is available with steering wheel and classic tiller. In the version with steering wheel, the tailgate also becomes the helmsman's seat. Depending on the variant chosen, it can be equipped with a stern platform, which becomes a “bridge” between the yacht and the quay, which further increases the comfort of use. The cockpit is designed in such a way that the helmsman and crew have easy access to all onboard equipment necessary for sailing. Tes yacht The company TES YACHT Sp. z o.o. was founded on the basis of many years of experience in designing and building yachts by the company TES Tomasz Siwik. Yachts with this name have been designed and built for almost 30 years. At first these were just projects, then it came time to build individual units, and gradually the company reached mass production in the late 1980s. Currently the company offers a wide range of sailing and motor yachts. Each of the designed units features a unique hull line while maintaining the highest utility values ​​and excellent performance. The TES yachts have been designed to offer the user maximum comfort and safety.Show more

name: 1983 Friendship Friendship 281983 Friendship Friendship 28
description: First class sailor. The ship sails fast and close to the wind; the rigging can be trimmed easily. With fifty percent ballast, the Friendship 28 is extremely stable, uncapsizeable and self-righting. The freeboard is high, a good guarantee of safety and good spray protection. The rigging is very easy to trim and all halyards run through the mast and can be operated from the cockpit. Two halyard winches and two genoa winches make it easier to put through the halyards and jib sheets. The Furlex furling system offers additional comfort and safety. The mast has been very effectively stabilized by two additional aft shrouds. The pumping of the mast, which is not uncommon with top rigging and spreaders without sweeping in rough seas and strong winds, is thus completely ruled out. The Volvo Penta MD7B with 17 hp provides excellent propulsion in calm weather or harbor maneuvers. The ship was built by Jachtbouw Meijer in Balk/Netherlands. The design was drawn by the well-known yacht designer Dick Koopmans. The Friendship 28 is a stable and quiet sailor. Even in strong winds she does not heel easily, which gives a very safe feeling, making the ship ideal as a family ship.Show more

name: 1982 Bianca BIANCA 281982 Bianca BIANCA 28
description:
Unfortunately, I would like to part with my beloved boat, which has been in the family for 30 years. It does NOT include a buoy place. The boat is currently ashore at the Andreas Weger sailmaker in Breitbrunn and can be inspected at any time by appointment.
The boat has a reliable Yanmar inboard, a furling jib (various additional sails) and is a perfect boat for families. Access to bathing is easy with the stainless steel rear ladder.
Sufficient lines and fenders, as well as various nautical equipment also make the boat perfect for trips on open waters (North/Baltic Sea/Atlantic).
The boat sleeps 5 and also has a gimballed pantry which is unused!
The boat comes with a Habeck harbor trailer (not street legal) and a custom-made tarpaulin.
I wish my subsequent owner a lot of fun and if it can be arranged, I would be happy to be there on the first trips for further explanations.

greeting

Kai HenkeShow more

name: 1967 S.A.C.N COSTANTINI TRISKEL1967 S.A.C.N COSTANTINI TRISKEL
description:
1967 S.A.C.N COSTANTINI TRISKEL,
XBOAT ref 4987.The TRISKEL is a sailboat in 12 mm marine plywood, lively and very pleasant to maneuver.It was built in 1967 by the famous Costantini brothers shipyard in Brittany. It is a little cousin of the Penduick II and it benefits from several of its characteristics, including its bulbous keel attached to a metal cradle connected to the chainplates. The mast is therefore attached to the keel, and the boat is very stiff to the canvas (Ballast 1300kgs for total weight of the boat 3000kgs). It is in very good general condition, and will suit a boat enthusiast with character. Rigging fully standing overhauled in 2014. Râblure (joint keel-bridge) redone in 2010. Set of sails in good condition. 100W solar panel. ST1000 autopilot.Full fairing September 2020.Visit and more details on request. More information and photos on the site xboat.frMehr anzeigen

name: 1978 Contessa 281978 Contessa 28
description:
The Contessa 28 offers an excellent blend of confidence inspiring sailing performance and useful accommodation, offering up to 6 berths in 2 cabins. Less well known than earlier Contessa yachts, the 28 was more modern with an improved interior and moulded headlining, often considered an earlier rival to the Sadler 29. 'Midnight Lady' is a very good example of her class fitted with a 2006 Nanni 21hp diesel engine and a recent chart plotter and windlass. She is competitively priced as a recent survey identified that the decks will require attention in the future, early viewing is highly recommended!
Viewing by appointment only through our Essex office (01621) 785600Mehr anzeigen

description:

name: 1965 Peter Duck 281965 Peter Duck 28
description:
The Peter Duck is a classic East Coast design from Laurent Giles, evolved from the original 'Peter Duck' built for Arthur Ransome of Swallows and Amazons fame! They combine surprisingly spacious cruising accommodation, shallow draft, comfortable performance, and a sea kindly manner, all within an easily managed and maintained size. 'Incognito' has clearly been well cared for across the years, with some general maintenance and upgrading could easily be an excellent example of her class, and she has been priced very realistically to allow for her next owner to do so.
Viewing by appointment only through our Essex office (01621) 785600Mehr anzeigen

name: 2007 Vancouver 282007 Vancouver 28
description:
The Vancouver 28 is a very strongly built blue water cruising yacht. Fitted out to a high standard by Northshore, this Robert Harris design is a superb choice for long distance blue water sailing. This truly excellent example is in fine condition and is ready to sail away. Her previous owners have spent a vast amount bringing her to almost concourse condition including 2018 sails, 2016 standing rigging, refurbished self steering system, plus the engine has very few hours logged. This is the VERY LAST Vancouver 28 to have been built and in our opinion is almost as good as new - certainly the best one to have come on to our books. Do not miss this opportunity!
Viewing by appointment at our Suffolk Office (IP10 0LN) - 01473 659681Mehr anzeigen

name: 1977 Blok Zeeschouw1977 Blok Zeeschouw
description:
Block Zeeschouw


This Blok Zeeschouw from 1977 is characterized by the wide side decks and the large foredeck. This creates a lot of space to safely walk around the cabin. There is sufficient space in the cockpit to sit comfortably and maneuver the boat. The stained glass windows in the entrance door to the cabin provide a nostalgic look.
.
A spacious seating area has been created in the cabin. The sofas can also be used as an extra bed. The kitchenette is placed on the port side and is equipped with a sink and a 2 burner stove. A small chart table is placed on the starboard side. The cuckoo placed in the middle provides atmospheric daylight in the cabin.
.
The toilet area with a portable toilet is located in the forepeak of the Blok Zeeschouw. On the other side is a cupboard for storing clothes. A spacious double bed has also been placed in the forepeak.
.
For propulsion, this Blok Zeeschouw is equipped with an Albin two-cylinder diesel with a capacity of 20 hp.
.
If you have any questions about this Blok Zeeschouw or if you would like to make an appointment for a viewing on board, please contact White Whale Limburg via limburg@wwy.nl  or call +31 (0) 637 407 926.
.

.
We like to help you!

name: 2022 Northman Maxus 262022 Northman Maxus 26
description:
The Maxus 26 is a sailing yacht with good sailing characteristics and a comfortable interior. The yacht has all the facilities you need on board, 4 fixed berths, 2 flexible berths, a spacious table with comfortable sofas, a bathroom with toilet, sink and possibly a shower, a kitchen with; hob, refrigeration, storage space and sink. The yacht offers more space than the Maxus Evo 24 and is therefore ideal for a family vacation or a longer sailing holiday.
The sailing yacht has different keel options; a swingkeel (sword), a fixed keel, or bilge keels. In addition to the jib and the mainsail, additional sails are also possible, such as a spinnaker or genaker. In addition, you can choose to add even more comfort to the yacht by electrically propelling the yacht. This allows you to enjoy the constant sailing experience by sailing silently on the engine and without the smell of exhaust gases.

The Dufour 2800 with aluminum mast is a reliable day sailor with a heavy, polyester hull. The Dufour 2800 is an ideal weekend/short holiday boat for the coastal waters of the Netherlands, she is easy to sail and maintain. Ship has always been owned by the same family. The engine is defective.
Michel Dufour, an engineer with a love for sailing, started his shipyard in La Rochelle in France in 1964. He owes his success to his keen intuition. He was convinced that new technologies and new materials would change sailing. But sailing was always meant to be an embodiment of his pioneering and adventurous spirit: the pinnacle of pleasure.

The boat is in good technical and working condition. It can be sailed straight away. The signs of wear to be expected on a boat that is more than 40 years old are visible. The condition of the underwater hull is very good.
We have had the boat since 2019 and made a number of improvements to the boat. We have always used high-quality, marine-grade materials. Unfortunately, due to time constraints, we were not able to finish all the work, so there is still a little work to be done for the new owner.

name: 2016 Einzelbau Vertue II Dschunkensegel2016 Einzelbau Vertue II Dschunkensegel
description:
Extremely solidly built long-distance cruiser with junk sails, an "eye-catcher" with classic lines. Only the best materials were used for the construction and the boat has only been in the water a little due to time constraints.
The fuselage is made of GRP and wooden slats. The two layers of wood are fully glued with epoxy resin and "wrapped" in GRP epoxy. This means no water contact with the wood! Very stable construction with aramid and carbon fiber intermediate layers.
The junk sail is profiled and created by the cloth factory in Greifswald. The self-standing aluminum mast is in a tabular bracket, there are no shrouds, the mast can be easily laid down using the tilting bracket (sail remains on the mast). The mast mount is cleverly designed without a breakthrough on the inside, which avoids leakage problems. The rig has very good upwind properties (comparable to Bermuda rigs) and junk-typical very good downwind and light wind properties, but it is also easy to sail in strong winds, up to 8 Bft without any problems. Reefing (5 reefs) and recovering the sail can also be done quickly and easily with one hand. The sail is very forgiving and both tacking and jibing are done solely by rudder position. No pods have to be slacked off and pulled tight.
The boat can go on a large or small tour immediately, has a lot of storage space, 2 water tanks (not yet used), alcohol stove, dry composting toilet, new upholstery, very large compressor cooler.
Other equipment: teak deck, large lockers, summer full tarpaulin, sprayhood, bowsprit with manual anchor winch, 2 anchors, dinghy, engine can be taken out of the water. A sea toilet has been removed and is still complete and could be quickly reinstalled.
Berth in Travemünde can be taken over!
Background info: The Vertue I was drawn by Laurent Giles in England in 1935/36. Since then, more than 200 wooden boats have been built, most of which are still sailing today. Almost unchanged and with basically the same construction, the Vertue II has been built since 1976 (usually as a fiberglass boat). The boat is considered a long-distance cruiser and the most seaworthy of its size (see "My old man and the sea", German "Seelenriffe", a travelogue with a Vertue II around South America including Cape Horn).Show more

name: 2020 Dalpol PHOBOS 25 Lieferung 20232020 Dalpol PHOBOS 25 Lieferung 2023
description: Phobos 25 new build to order. Available in 3 keel variants. Basic equipment from €37,800, ready to sail (sword version) You can download the test report on the PHOBOS 25 from the homepage of the magazine "SEGELN". We would also be happy to send you one on request. Still good trailerable! (with special permission for the extra width) width 2.86 m, length o.a. 7.98 m, weight: approx. 2500 kg The boat shown has a list price of over 55,000 euros (without trailer and motor!) The Phobos 25 is based on the style of modern Mediterranean yachts. Up to six opening windows and hatches can be mounted in the long superstructure with the characteristic large windows, which provides unusually good ventilation and lighting of the interior. The Phobos 25 is characterized by its large cockpit, which offers an excellent view towards the bow. Four separate storage compartments in the cockpit make it easier to store the necessary equipment and also allow the yacht to be equipped with water, gas and heating systems. The hull of the Phobos 25, designed by the well-known regatta sailor Wojtek Spisak, is wide and relatively flat. On the one hand, it ensures excellent stability and, on the other hand, a spacious interior. The ballast versions with folding centerboard and bottom balst in combination with the mast-laying device are ideal for flexible use on coastal waters, lakes, rivers or canals. We currently have used Phobos model (as of August 2019) Welcome to the company IMPOL Yacht & Bootsimporte We have been importing sailing boats from Poland for over 16 years and are your German contractual partner of the Dalpol Yacht shipyard. Some Phobos models from 18 to 29 feet from the Dalpol Yacht shipyard are in our permanent boat exhibition. The boat is second hand and was only launched during the holiday season. It is a spacious boat for the whole family with a shallow draft. Much has been renewed, such as jib and mainsail (1988), interior upholstery, new 20 hp Ruggerini (ca. 1995) teak interior. The boat is complete and fully equipped. The selling price includes the Jaguar 27 as well as the Bootransporter. Joint sale is preferred. Complete documentation of the sailing yacht, as well as mostly for the tractor (complete from 1993). name: 2023 Beaconax Bluestorm 8002023 Beaconax Bluestorm 800
description: The BlueStorm 800 can be individually adapted to personal requirements in terms of interior design and deck construction. No BlueStorm is like the other, every owner has their own preferences, which can be implemented with our semi-custom approach. Condition: new from the shipyard - individual and versatile Control: tiller with fixed double rudder Sails: mainsail 22 m², headsail 12 m² Keel: swiveling twin keel as standard, various options are available Concept: The hull design and construction are identical to her sister boats and guaranteed so the same excellent, safe and sporty sailing characteristics. It is a light, individual and high-quality sailing boat with a modern hull, variable draft and very good sailing characteristics - made in Germany. Whether as a cruiser for the family, for after work or for sporty sailing, the BlueStorm 800 is versatile and highly customizable to the requirements of the owner and leaves little to be desired even in the standard version. The boat is completely manufactured in Germany in a more sustainable construction for lasting pleasure in the boat. The BlueStorm 800 can have a modern or classic design, with us the owner decides. It offers many innovative and practical solutions. With a length of 8 m and a width of 2.80 m, the boat offers more space than its little sister and can be trailered with a special permit. With the performance twin keel, the saloon is completely unobstructed. The larger space allows for an optional small separate wet room, or a navigation area, etc. The unladen weight is just around 1200 kg. Like the sister boats, the BlueStorm 800 also impresses with its lightweight construction using regenerative materials and modern plastic variants and processes. The weight including trailer is approx. 1750 kg. The design ensures high strength and durability. A variable draft is also part of the standard equipment, as is the twin rudder system. What she's sure to include is shown below in the sample configuration: Hull, Deck, Keel & Rudder > Hull Plywood and Canadian Cedar with reduced GRP skin and epoxy; Standard color selection: RAL7035 light grey, RAL9010 pure white, RAL5003 sapphire blue > Deck sandwich with foam core and partial solid wood core and plywood cover layer in the vacuum process and reduced GRP finish Standard color selection: RAL9010 pure white, RAL7035 light gray > Variable draft using a performance twin keel with lead bomb 0.30 m - 1 .70 m double rudder system with central tiller control Interior > Surface finish visible area in RAL9001 cream white and non-visible area in pure white RAL 9010 > Separation bulkhead with large passage between saloon and foredeck > Upholstery for benches in saloon and in the foredeck in gray similar to RAL7016 > 2 ceiling lights in saloon and Forecastle with white and red light > 2 USB sockets in the saloon > Stainless steel mast support > Storage bags in the forecastle > Forecastle hatch electronics & navigation > 12V on-board power supply incl. 100 Ah battery capacity and fuses > Shore power connection and 230V socket and charger > LED navigation lantern as 3-color lantern in the masthead > Illuminated compass deck & cockpit > winches: halyard winch and 2 sheet winches > main sheet system > halyards & sheets > halyard stopper > boom vang > anti-slip covering > anchor locker > sliding hatch with bulkhead > lockers > 6 stainless steel cleats > manual bilge pump > bathing ladder sail > mainsail 22.30 m² & headsail 12 .20 m² Dacron in white > Gennaker 45 m² Dacron in white > Sail covers for mainsail & headsail drives We would be happy to make you an electric motor offer. In general, a 5 hp outboard motor with a normal shaft is sufficient. Outboards are placed far aft in the bay, allowing for better steering and handling. Further options selectable, individual requests on request.Show more

name: 1996 Kroes Boemerang ( Zelfbouw )1996 Kroes Boemerang ( Zelfbouw )
description:
Kroes Boomerang ( DIY )


This self-build Kroes Boomerang was built on the basis of the blueprints of designer Gait Kroes of Kroes BootBuilders in Kampen. The design came about after a design competition was launched in the Water Kampioen. The builder has chosen not to build the ship with lap seams, but caravel, resulting in a nice tight and smooth hull. The cabin roof has been raised slightly and the cabin floor has been lowered, creating more height in the cabin.
The ship is completely built in wood-epoxy. Mahogany was used for the hull and superstructure of the Kroes Boomerang. The beautiful teak deck gives the Boomerang a beautiful luxurious and classic look.
There is sufficient space in the cockpit to sail the ship comfortably. All traps and shots are directed backwards. The sails can be hoisted from the cockpit due to the winches and stoppers placed on the cabin roof. The self-tailing sheet winches placed on the cockpit edge ensure easy operation of the headsails.
The cabin has two large beds which also serve as a comfortable sofa. The cabin table is attached to the mast support, which can easily be turned away to create more space. The sink and stove are placed next to the entrance. In the forepeak, which serves as storage space, the toilet is placed on the port side and the drinking water tank is also located. A storage cupboard is placed on the starboard side.
When not sailing, the reliable Ruggerini marine diesel provides the propulsion of this classic sailing yacht.
If you have any questions about this DIY Kroes Boemerang or if you would like to make an appointment for a viewing on board, please contact White Whale Limburg via limburg@wwy.nl  or call +31 (0) 637 407 926.
Do you also want to sell your boat? White Whale Yachtbrokers has 11 offices in Europe. We simply sell your boat from your own berth, for a low commission. Free advertising on the most relevant and leading websites including Yachtworld.com. No start-up costs, always no-cure-no-pay!! Feel free to ask us for a proposal for your own yacht.

name: 1951 hein 25er blitz jollenkreuzer1951 hein 25er blitz jollenkreuzer
description: Construction: very stable steel hull, galvanized and riveted, no rust spots, teak deck, mast and boom made of wood, jut tree. Accessories: depth sounder, compass, VHF radio, furling jib, reefing device (2 reefs, can be operated from the cockpit), fenders and mooring lines with tension absorbers, 2 batteries, charger, complete lighting for the BinSchStrO, SeeSchStrO and KVR areas of application. Self-steering system "Raymarine ST 1000" incl. remote control, GPS "Garmin", 2 anchors incl. lead anchor line. Small cool box (12 V). Engine: AB Honda (4-stroke, 9.9 hp) with electric starter and alternator for charging the batteries, regular maintenance at the specialist dealer (last major inspection Dec. 2018. Among other things, toothed belt, impeller, thermostat, anode) Under On the deck there are two bench seats as sleeping benches (new upholstery (blue), 2019), a fold-out table, 4 cupboards and storage boxes (possibly for toilet), a small pantry. The well thought-out cockpit layout enables easy handling of the boat even for small crews or one-handed, but 4-5 people can also be comfortably accommodated there. All important lines converge on the cabin roof. A large cockpit tent (kitchen booth) expands the living space and can be assembled and disassembled in about 10 minutes. All accessories can be stowed away in the large, lockable baking box. The large bow room is closed off and about 2 m long (it was also used as a bedroom by the first owner). The sailing characteristics are very good despite the stable hull. The boat has recorded numerous regatta victories in the first decades. Dry traps and navigating shallow waters are obligatory. The boat is in an original, unobstructed, very good condition. The antifouling lasts at least 1 season. The steel hull has no rust spots. There are only a few spots on the superstructure of the wooden deck that will soon have to be repaired. The boat can be put into the water immediately in its current condition. The sails and the tarpaulin were professionally cleaned in 2020 and have received a new seal (refit) (Van den Anker, Zeilwasserij). The existing boat insurance is paid for by April 2023 and can be transferred (Firmenich). A briefing (construction and, if necessary, sailing instruction) is included in the purchase price if desired (only the fuel costs for the berth must be borne by the buyer)Show more

name: 1997 Rommel 26 Berlin1997 Rommel 26 Berlin
description:
What a picture this Sportster 26.


SY-Sportster 26 in super condition, building number 25 by the famous yacht designer Peter Rommel. Sporty, very fast sailing ship called Moët. The Rommel 26 Sportster is a beautiful, very fast daysailer with lifting keel. Hull number 25 from 1997 of only 31 boats built by the Rommel shipyard in Berlin. Due to its low weight and design, the Rommel is a perfect regatta sailor with which you can also go on an excursion with the family. Thanks to the electro-hydraulic swivel keel, the draft can be varied from 0.60 m to 1.70 m at the push of a button from 0.60 m to 1.70 m at the push of a button. This makes sailing also possible in shallow water, making the sailing area almost limitless.
In super condition, both exterior and interior. Variable keel depth 0.6m/1.7m. Electrically-Hydraulic controllable from the cockpit. Refit 2020 Including new stainless steel hydraulic cylinder. Refit is extensively documented. Can easily fall dry due to variable keel depth in combination with the double rudders. A neat road trailer is included and trade-in is negotiable.

name: 2022 Beaconax Bluestorm 7502022 Beaconax Bluestorm 750
description: BlueStorm yachts are highly customizable in terms of deck and interior design. The modern hull design guarantees a very good sailing performance, which is supported by the standard twin rudders and the tiller steering. Condition: new Order from the shipyard - individual and versatile Control: tiller for double rudder Sails: mainsail 17.35 m², headsail 11 m², gennaker 40 m² Keel: standard - twin pivoting keel (0.65 m to 1.20 m) / optional (0.40 - 1.20 ) and others possible Construction: Composite construction made of GfK/NfK with epoxy and YAC RAC as the core material Concept: light, individual and high-quality sailing boat with a modern hull, variable draft, very good sailing characteristics - made in Germany. Whether as a cruiser for the family, for after work or for sporty sailing, the BlueStorm 750 is versatile and highly customizable to the requirements of the owner and already lacks little in the standard version. The boat is completely manufactured in Germany in a more sustainable construction for lasting pleasure in the boat. The BlueStorm 750 is versatile and individual - whether modern or classic, the owner decides, a lot can but nothing has to. It offers many innovative and practical solutions. The smallest boat in this series, with a width of only 2.55 m and a length of 7.50 m, offers a lot of space and you can sit comfortably below deck and the berths are also generously dimensioned at over 2 m in this boat class. While many other products in this class can only be trailered with a special permit, the BS750 is independent of this and can also be slipped. The curb weight is around 1 ton, which makes it significantly lighter than comparable boats. Highlights: double rudder system, swiveling performance twin keel, trailerable and slippable, very good upwind properties, individual, good equipment, made in Germany and much more. Description: The BlueStorm 750 is suitable for one hand and offers a very large range of sails. The construction offers enormous sportive potential without neglecting safety. It impresses with its agility, strength, safety applications and its sustainable and high-quality construction. The boat starts gliding at about 9 knots. The BlueStorm750 can be trailered and slipped without a special permit. In addition, the variable keel allows a large selection of areas. You can board directly from the shipyard, set sail and feel good. Whether as a holiday cruiser or daysailor, the BlueStorm 750 is as diverse as its owner, it can be individually adapted to your requirements. Thanks to the spacious cockpit, the outboard motor finds a comfortable place in the cockpit shaft, which means that it can also be easily controlled under the engine using the tiller, no annoying bending over and cumbersome operation of the boat and motor tiller and gas valve. The modern look with shines including a spacious cockpit and lower deck space is rounded off by a flat underwater ship. This hull combines the agility of a dinghy cruiser with the benefits of a keelboat. In addition to the more sustainable production, she convinces with her comprehensive standard equipment (shore power, double rudder, Swing Performace twin keel, to name just a few). About the construction: The boat is a composite construction using wood, plywood and epoxy laminate coating. This keeps the boat light while maintaining stiffness and strength. Repairs and maintenance can be kept manageable. The special treatment of the components makes it very durable and it is in no way inferior to conventional GRP boats - quite the opposite. The mast can be set up using an external jutting system. Use on the crane is of course also possible. Due to the performance twin keels, the Bluestorm 750 has an optimal mix of the sailing characteristics of a dinghy cruiser and the comfort and safety aspects of a keel yacht. The hydrodynamically optimized keel construction gives it optimal properties that are unique in this size and weight class. It is suitable for tidal waters and is characterized by a flat and fast underwater hull. The boat is made in Germany and allows a high level of customization for the owner. For example, a classic sea toilet with tank is also possible, as well as a small pantry with gas installation. During construction, only tested and selected materials are used using the latest production techniques. Standard Specification: Hull, Deck, Keel & Rudder > Hull Plywood and Canadian Cedar with GRP Epoxy Coating > Standard Color Choices: RAL7035 Light Grey, RAL9010 Pure White, RAL5003 Sapphire Blue > Deck Sandwich with Foam Core and Partial Solid Wood Core and Vacuum Processed Plywood Face and Reduced GRP Finish > Standard Color Choices : RAL9010 pure white, RAL7035 light gray > Variable draft using a performance twin keel with lead bomb 0.65 m - 1.20 m other different keel constructions can be selected. > Double rudder system with central tiller control Interior > Surface finish visible area in RAL9001 cream white and non-visible area in pure white RAL 9010 > Separation bulkhead with large passage between saloon and foredeck > Upholstery for benches in saloon and in the foredeck in gray similar to RAL7016 > 2 ceiling lights in the saloon and foredeck with White and red light > 2 USB sockets in the saloon > Stainless steel mast support > Storage bags in the foredeck > Chemical toilet under the starboard bench > Foredeck hatch electronics & navigation > 12V on-board power supply incl. 100 Ah battery capacity and fuses > Shore power connection and 230V socket and charger > LED navigation lantern as 3-color lantern in the masthead > Illuminated compass deck & cockpit > Winches: halyard winch and 2 sheet winches > Main sheet system > Halyards & sheets > Halyard stoppers > Boom vang > Anti-slip covering > 4 folding padeyes > Anchor locker > Sliding hatch with plug-in bulkhead > Lockers > 6 stainless steel cleats > Manual bilge pump > Bathing ladder S Egel > Mainsail 17.35 m² Dacron in white > Headsail 11 m² Dacron in white > Gennaker 40 m² Dacron in white > Sail covers for mainsail & headsail drives We would be happy to make you an electric motor offer. In general, a 5 hp outboard motor with a normal shaft is sufficient. Outboards are placed far aft in the bay, allowing for better steering and handling. See our price lists for more options.Show more

name: 2022 TES Yacht 246 VERSUS2022 TES Yacht 246 VERSUS
description: TES 246 against We produce the yacht to individual order. We can customize it to suit your needs. The price shown includes: full sails with lazybag and lazyjack, a jib roller with UV. Fittings made of A4 steel with 25mm profile. Interior construction with waterproof veneered and varnished plywood with teak marine floor. Complete electrical installation with 12V, USB and 230V with connection to the shore. Full gas and water installation. All the components we use are branded and of high quality. Please contact us - we will be happy to send you a complete price list and the current delivery date. Specification of the Tes 246 Versus: - Length - 7.49m² - Beam 2.54m - Draft - 0.35m - Weight - 2600kg - Interior height - 1.82m² - Category - B / C - CE certificate - yes - Transport on a trailer - yes - versions - swing keel / false keel / fixed keel - fittings - steel A4 (AISI 316) - interior equipment - waterproof, veneered, varnished plywood - engine - (5-20HP) - outboard / in well / stationary diesel / stationary Electro Tes 246 VERSUS is the newest yacht in the TES YACHT range of sailing yachts. It is a 7.5 meter vessel with a unique hull structure through the use of an inverted bow overhang, which makes the yacht more stable and improves its nautical characteristics. The yacht is designed for sailing in inland and sea waters (execution category B or C depending on the ballasting method). It was designed for a crew of 4-8 people. It is equipped with 3 side windows, 2 windows over the side on each side and a skylight in the bow, making the interior light and giving an even more spacious impression. It has berths in the bow, mid and aft sections of the unit. It is equipped with a spacious sanitary cabin. In the central part of the yacht there is a spacious mess and a large well-equipped galley that will meet the expectations of any crew. In the cockpit, all the stoppers are located on one side, which greatly facilitates the choice of halves and increases the ergonomics of their use. The cockpit has a closed design, in the rear there are two lockable benches that protect against accidental falling overboard. In addition, the cockpit has high backrests that protect crew members when sailing in difficult weather conditions. The yacht is characterized by excellent nautical parameters that make sailing a pure pleasure even in demanding weather conditions. Perfect for charter companies and individual sailors! Tes yacht The company TES YACHT Sp. z o.o. was founded on the basis of many years of experience in designing and building yachts by the company TES Tomasz Siwik. Yachts with this name have been designed and built for almost 30 years. At first these were just projects, then it came time to build individual units, and gradually the company reached mass production in the late 1980s. Currently the company offers a wide range of sailing and motor yachts. Each of the designed units features a unique hull line while maintaining the highest utility values ​​and excellent performance. The TES yachts have been designed to offer the user maximum comfort and safety.Show more

name: 1934 Classic Cardnell Sloop1934 Classic Cardnell Sloop
description:
'Samphire' is a charming classic sloop, built by the highly regarded East coast shipwright G.E. Cardnell of Steeple in 1934. Her moderate draft and sea-kindly manner make her ideal for exploring shallower waters, whilst being easily handled thanks to her simple rig. She has been subject to a thorough four-year refit in 2012-2016,and she is presented in excellent all-round order ready for her next owner (2016 survey available) . Her impressive inventory includes hot water, a rebuilt engine, recent standing and running rigging, shore power and more. We would recommend an early viewing to avoid disappointment, and a 10m leasehold berth at Burnham Yacht Harbour is also available separately if required. 
Viewing by prior appointment only through the Essex office on (01621) 785600Mehr anzeigen

name: 2000 Red Fox Vision2000 Red Fox Vision
description:

Her twin lifting daggerboard keel system is another design masterstroke from David Thomas, combining good performance with shoal draft cruising. 'Illusion' has had one owner from new but has been unused for a number of years, so now requires all systems checking/servicing/repairing, as well as cosmetic improvements.

description: Due to enlargement we offer our cozy and stable small sailing yacht for sale. description:
PL: The TES 720 TB cabin sailing yacht has an extremely rich, luxurious equipment. The yacht is called "Slipstream". It was made to order. Much of the personalized equipment was made by local artisans. The boat has been finished with mahogany wood. It is equipped with an extensive, waterproof audio system, a multimedia center with two flat-screen TVs. The yacht has a monitoring system with an alarm system.
Sailing yacht sold with a boat trailer OMEGA - 2700. Year of construction of the trailer - 2014. Recently, comprehensive maintenance of the yacht and hull has been carried out. Everything is operational, the sailing yacht is immediately ready for transport and departure.

Die Segelyacht wird zusammen mit dem Bootsanhänger OMEGA - 2700 verkauft. Baujahr des Trailers - 2014. Vor dust wurde eine vollumfängliche Konservierung der Yacht und des Rumpfes vorgenommen. Alles ist funktionsfähig, die Segelyacht sofort einsatzbereit zum Transport sowie zum Auslaufen.

name: 1960 unbekannt 1960 unbekannt
description: Classic long keel sailing yacht for sale 22.45m² sail area, draft 1.3m, LO 7.2m, width 2.15m, weight 2,360kg, year of construction unknown, class/type unknown - wooden mast and boom built in 2012 - mainsail and jib built in 2012 according to the sail plan (available) - Tohatsu 6PS outboard engine ultra-long shaft, built in 2013 with only approx. 50 operating hours, last maintenance 2021 - cake booth, built in 2013, good condition This classic sailing yacht is a guaranteed eye-catcher in every area. Unfortunately, I have to part with it due to time constraints. The hull is planked oak on oak in transverse frame construction. My father, a trained boat builder, restored the boat at great expense between 2010 and 2014 after it had not been in the water for several years. This included, among other things, - finishing of the planks, where necessary - multi-layer, bi-diagonal GRP coating of the above and underwater area based on epoxy resin - new rudder system made of stainless steel - new rudder made of boat tree mahogany, also coated with GRP - new deck including cabin, substructure made of mahogany plywood , Teak deck 10mm fully glued with epoxy resin - New fittings (mainly brass, partly stainless steel) - All other wooden parts on deck are made of mahogany - New cube grating made of mahogany, oiled - New interior including electrics with voltage converter, radio and speakers (I have a battery expanded because I didn't need it) I took over the boat as an estate and added the following work: - 2021 rebuilding above and below water paint - 2021 GfK coating of the cockpit and painting with 2K paint - 2022 ballast all around recoated with GfK - Annually all painted parts on deck including mast and boom 1-2 coats of clear coat Due to the regular Due to the care, the boat is in good overall condition and ready to sail. The sails as well as the standing rigging have been little sailed and are therefore in excellent condition. A valuation report prepared in 2021 put the sailing yacht at a value of €28,000. Various accessories such as fenders, lewmar delta anchors, lines, fire extinguishers, etc. are of course available. A high-quality full tarpaulin worth approx. €2,400 has been commissioned from a sailmaker and is not included in the report, but is included in the asking price. The trailer from year of construction 2021 can also be purchased if required, but this is to be negotiated separately (price €5,700 new). I based my price on the appraisal, but am open to your offer. More photos can be provided if required, viewing is possible in 45259 Heisingen (Baldeneysee).Show more

name: 2014 Gaff Rigged Cutter 715 Lady Realwood2014 Gaff Rigged Cutter 715 Lady Realwood
description:
Passionately built, beautiful classic, in mint condition.


Passionately designed and built, beautiful classic, with lapel S-frame hull. This unique sailing yacht has been calculated, drawn and built with love for 5 years; for the love of yacht building. Despite her smaller dimensions, the interior provides a galley, navigation table and toilet, with two more (sea) berths of 2 meters in the foreship. With, among other things, a built-in Yanmar diesel engine, the yacht is technically fully equipped, so that it can also make considerable trips. After completion, the yacht was in the water for a short time for, among other things, technical sea trials, after which it has been stored indoors since the end of the 2014 season. The yacht is therefore still in new condition!


General
Hull shape: Lap seam built, with Danish oak trusses and wriggles. Sipo mahogany planking
Other:

Spring including bowsprit 8.58 meters

The Lady Realwood was designed and built by a very experienced draftsman and shipbuilder, who has more than earned his spurs in shipbuilding since the early 1940s. The Lady Realwood took shape out of love for designing and building ships, inspired by the designs of William Garden and Paul Gartside. The result: a smaller clinker S-frame, with permanent accommodation for two people and a classic underwater hull, as befits a wooden yacht. With the cockpit benches of 1.85 m long and in combination with a cockpit cover over the boom, the yacht could even be suitable for families, or for sailing with several people. Although the Lady Realwood is an ideal yacht for the designer/builder, the pleasure in designing and building the yacht has been the main motivation.
After approximately 5 years of research, calculation, drawing and construction, the Lady Realwood was completed at the end of 2013 with approximately 11,000 man hours. After being in the water for a shorter time in the 2014 season for various sea trials, the yacht was then stored indoors again. The yacht is therefore still in new condition.

Accommodation
Material, colours: Beautiful high-gloss mahogany paneling, in combination with classic white parts.
Saloons: Two lounge sofas of 0.80 meters and a revolving folding table
Headroom: Headroom of 1.77 meters under sliding hatch, decreasing to 1.67 meters
Cooker & fuel: Semi-gimbal gas comfort
Other:
Very atmospheric, traditional and beautifully crafted interior. Equipped with all the necessary comforts on board, but also practically furnished for use under sail. Since the builder is also an experienced world sailor, the interior has been carefully and cleverly designed with that experience.

Engine, electrics, water
Other:

Well insulated engine room.
With the Yanmar diesel onboard, the yacht easily achieves a hull speed of approximately 6 knots.


Rigging
Winches: 4 Bronze sheet winches
Jib: Stag jib 6.50 square meters
Jib: 7.50 square meters
Number of masts: Oregon Pine spars
Other:

Mainsail of 18.30 m2
Fork topsail of 3.50 m2
Stag jib of 6.50 m2
Jib of 7.50 m2

Despite the experience, the hours invested in the design and construction of the Lady Realwood, the moment finally arrives for the first launch with a trial run under sail. It has been found that the yacht lies nicely on her waterline and sails well beyond expectations, with the course stability of a real S-frame. For the type of yacht, the Lady Realwood  runs nicely close to the wind. It responds well to the rudder both on the engine and under sail.
With the builder's practical experience, he has opted for a somewhat larger sail area, in order to be able to carry more sail even in lighter weather. Reducing the sail area or reefing is always possible with the sail wardrobe.
Given the design and sailing characteristics of the Lady Realwood, the yacht in combination with the interior, according to the builder, is a beautiful and well-built vessel for making stylish trips over wider waters. Moreover, also trips to England, Scandinavia and/or the Baltic Sea.

Navigation and electronics
Other:

Garmin Marine Electronics


Safety
Other:
* Preliminary specification subject to seller's approval

name: 1978 Schoechl sunbeam 221978 Schoechl sunbeam 22
description:
Sunbeam 22 (Schöchl shipyard)
The Sunbeam 22 is a very pretty and fast cabin cruiser from the legendary Schöchl shipyard at Mattsee in Austria. Size and equipment are perfect even for small lakes. 2-4 people can sleep in the cabin.
The boat for sale here was originally built in 1978, but has been extensively upgraded to the latest technical standards. Berth is currently the Schluchsee in the Upper Black Forest.

The boat has new, high-quality sails from the Landenberger Segelmacherei in Titisee-Neustadt, purchased in 2021
The running and standing rigging was also completely renewed in 2021.
In addition, modern self-hauling winches and a comfortable mainsail traveler were installed.
The boat has easy-to-use spinnaker equipment (new for 2021) with a comfortable bow bag for setting and recovering the spinnaker
In addition, a new electric outboard motor was purchased, as well as a new battery.
Lazy-Jacks reinstalled in 2021
New upholstery, new window seals and new windows were installed in the interior.
The hull is in original condition and very well preserved.

In total, around 20,000 euros were invested in the technical equipment in 2021.
The berth at Schluchsee can (but does not have to) be taken over.
A TÜV-approved trailer for transporting the boat is included in the price.
The Schluchsee is the largest inland lake in Baden-Württemberg and the windiest sailing area in southern Baden. The lake is idyllically situated at an altitude of 930 meters in the southern Black Forest, about 40 minutes by car from Freiburg.Show more

description: The boat stood in a barn for 12 years until 2019. After that it was sailed on the Möhnesee and is now in its third season. It has no damage to the gelcoat other than a dock bump on the bow above the waterline. The keel has already been cleaned of rust by grinding and provided with a new 1K primer + antifouling. The sealing to the edge of the keel was sealed with marine sealing material before each season. 1-2 of 8 bolt nuts in the bilge are quite rusty. The sails are suitable for sailing, but the genoa in particular is not the newest. The attachment of the shackle of the foresail is a bit frayed. The jib furler works. Mattresses and pillows probably changed once 20 years ago. Colored covers. There is a provision for a car battery to power the log and light, but it is not used. The electric motor is powered by a gel battery in the rear locker. Price negotiable.Show more

name: 2022 Sunbeam SUNBEAM 22.12022 Sunbeam SUNBEAM 22.1
description: Safety first: the hull is a combination of fabric and sandwich. The keel area is made of full laminate. The keel base is embedded in the hull, bolted and glued. This allows a wide-area introduction of force and very high safety reserves. The resin of the first layers is a high quality ISO/NPG resin. The inside of the fuselage is additionally sealed with a top coat. The gelcoat outer layer is painted and therefore as thick as possible. This additional effort ensures a high degree of gloss for many years. A complex, double-shell construction supports a pleasant indoor climate. This is achieved through a sandwich layer and the air gap between the inner shell and the deck. Moisture and heat below deck are thus reduced to a minimum. Toe rail in teak, this skirting board is combined with the deck/hull connection. The hull is constructed with CHINES beginning aft, disappearing mid-section and re-emerging at the bow. This increases the volume in the forecastle and stabilizes the bow on the wind. The chines also reinforce the dimensional stability. The system between rig, hull and keel is self-supporting. The plate irons are laminated over a wide area on the hull and the mast foot on deck stands on an aluminum support. The rudder is designed in the BIONIC design of a fish fin. This achieves an optimal flow and low resistance, pivoting, with gas springs. The SUNBEAM 22.1 is designed as a swing keel. Equipped with an INTEGRAL SWORD. An inner ballast provides additional stability. The sword is foldable. This means that it can be used at low water and is easy to transport. Deck: Laminated reinforcement under all deck fittings. The interior has an open design, the interior is friendly, bright and painted in natural colors; Oak plywood of the highest quality is used. Particular attention has been paid to the ventilation and ventilation, especially in the seats and the cabinets. The floor is made of real wood and thus ensures a ?warm? indoor climate and comfort. The combination of design and function is the essential detail of SUNBEAM YACHTS. Ergonomics are important for everyday use. From a technical point of view, all units must be easily accessible for service or maintenance. Aluminum mast: the rigging is designed as a fractional rig, which simplifies the trim, Z-Spar. Rig without backstay, with swept spreaders, Dirk. Stainless steel mast shoe with two mast bolts to tilt the mast. Lazyjacks lines from the boom to the spreader mainsheet, jib sheet Half battened square top mainsail with reef, Dacron; the top plate is fully battened for better trimming and comfortable reefing, 1 reef. single line reefing system; about the ?single-handed sailing? to make it easier, the reefing lines are routed into the cockpit. Jib with stay. tree vang. Wind direction indicator on the masthead. The unmistakable exterior is characterized by the large skylight exterior windows on the cabin roof. These windows illuminate the salon optimally and allow a bright and friendly atmosphere. Deck Organicer on cabin roof for leading halyards into cockpit, Harken. Cockpit benches on both sides, foldable. Underneath is the storage space for the engine and accessories. Molded into the lockers are integrated stainless steel foot rails for support when heeling. Pushpit and pulpit in stainless steel. Cleats at the bow and stern, generously dimensioned. Bathing or safety ladder for easy entry, accessible by swimming. Bracket on the bow for attachment and slipping on the trailer. ? Seat belts in the cockpit. Sea railing on deck, from pulpit to pushpit, with a railing wire. Sliding hatch in acrylic. Acrylic bulkhead with ventilation slots. Bulkhead mount in saloon. Molded mahogany tiller. Telescopic tiller extension. Deck hatches: 1 foredeck hatch (50x50). Side windows, the design of the long side windows on the cabin roof also brightens up the interior. The side windows, with their typical ?Sunbeam DNA? and the hull with its positive dip create the typical silhouette of the Sunbeam. Halyard winch in cockpit, 2x Harken, 15STA. Halyard stopper, spinlock, 2x4-fold. Rail for the lifting points, adjustable, Harken. Deflection blocks at the foot of the mast for the halyards, Harken shelves in the saloon, on the side. Fabric panniers in the foredeck for maximum storage space Bilge pump, manual, in the cockpit Mooring package Additional equipment: - Antifouling paint - Furling system for the genoa - Outboard bracket - Kicker - Mainsail SQ Rip Stop TRT - Genoa SQ RipStop TRT - LazyBag - Jib tarpaulin - Cockpit and saloon table combination - Semiwood cockpit teak seats - Semiwood cockpit teak floor - Charger with shore connection and battery - Depth sounder / Sumlog i40 Raymarine - Delivery and rigging Berlin regionShow more

name: 1980 Maxi 681980 Maxi 68
description: This Maxi 68 sailing yacht is sold here on behalf of a customer. MAXI 68 year of construction approx. 1980 boat dimensions length üA: 7.20 m hull length 6.8 m length WL: 5.95 m width ü. A: 2.40 m draft: 1.28 m mast height: 9.90 m weight (kg) 1600 keel type fin keel material iron keel weight (kg) 650 sail area sail area upwind: 25 m² mainsail: 10 m² jib: 11 m² genoa: 15 m² Spinnaker: 39 m² The rig is from Selden Log Lot Compass Anemometer Autopilot Outboard motor with 9.8 hp Other Yardstick number: 121 or 0.99 in the LYS The Maxi 68 is a Swedish family boat. The Maxi 68 was first built and sold in 1976 at the Erje Produkter shipyard in Mariestad, based on a design by Pelle Petterson. The additional designation "68" in the class designation resulted from its overall length. The hull consists of spray laminate up to 15 mm, the deck was made in sandwich construction with a core of Divinycell. The cabin of approx. 4 m² accommodates two berths, in addition there is a larger one in the foredeck. With a keel weight of 650 kg and a wetted area of ​​16 m², she has a displacement of 1350 kg. It can be equipped with an outboard engine of max. 7 kW. The hull speed is 5.9 knots. The boat is classified according to Svenska Sjöfartsverket. From 1978 the boat was structurally changed, the cockpit floor was raised and there was a new silver-colored mast from Selden. The boat can also be safely controlled in stronger winds (from wind force 5). With the Maxi you can sail a maximum close-hauled height of about 35 degrees. The Maxi has a fairly high proportion of ballast which also sits low. Due to this, it can be sailed up to wind force 5 with the normal sails, only travelers in lee. The forecastle is soft in the Baltic Sea wave. The cockpit is designed deep, i.e. you sit very protected. The ship can be viewed in the Boltenhagen Marina by appointment.Show more

name: 1850 Harding FRB 6501850 Harding FRB 650
description:
A Harding in the online auction. Anyone can easily bid until October 31, 2022 on the Bootveiling website.


Fast rescue vessel with dimensions 6.7 x 2.32 x 1.0 m .
Harding waterjet fast rescue boats have fast hulls, reaching speeds of up to 35 knots. Standard hydraulic steering. The robust GRP frame provides good self-alignment capabilities, and large discharge valves in the stern provide drainage from the deck. The boats are equipped with high-quality navigation lighting and switch panels. The hull is designed for speed and stability, which means optimal working conditions to open the ship in rough sea conditions.
The Harding FRB 650 was delivered in 2022 and unused. Including set of filters, VHF/VHF, Chartplotter, AIS, GPS etc. ALA marine waterjet type: WJ 230. Diesel tank 200 liters. The Bukh diesel marine engine type: DJ 170 has 8 running hours.

name: 2021 Dalpol PHOBOS 21, VERFÜGBAR !2021  20222021 Dalpol PHOBOS 21, VERFÜGBAR !2021  2022
description: PHOBOS 21 first watering 06/2021 AVAILABLE IMMEDIATELY! We still have a delivery date available for 2022! Price from 23,900 euros Ready to sail! The small sailing yacht Phobos 21 is very spacious and comfortable despite its small external dimensions. Stylistically, it is clearly based on its "big sister" Phobos 25. Despite its small dimensions, the boat is very stable and exceptionally comfortable. The hull is high and wide at the waterline. Due to the shallow draft, the yacht is suitable for any shore. Designed by the well-known regatta sailor Wojciech Spisak, the Phobos 21 will surprise you with its good maneuverability even in difficult conditions. Thanks to its large rudder blade area, it can be kept precisely on course upwind and during harbor manoeuvres. The interior is high, well lit and ventilated; it forms a unified large space without barriers. It has a typical, proven arrangement with 4 berths, a galley and a lockable toilet cabin. Technical data: Overall length: 6.48 m, hull length: 6.15 m, hull width: 2.50 m, draft: 0.30 - 1.34 m, mast height above waterline: 10.20 m, weight of laminated bottom ballast: 280 kg. a Skarl Skarl 645 online auction. Everyone can bid until October 31, 2022 at Bootveiling.


A Skarl 645, a boat made entirely of polyester. Mast is top rigged and the mast, gaff and boom are made of aluminum. The boat includes a mainsail and a jib. The mainsail can be reefed up to two times. It is an old boat with a few defects, but otherwise in a fine condition. Furthermore, the boat sails very pleasantly. A pelican hook is mounted on the boat. This makes it easy to lower the light mast and the boat is therefore also accessible to sailing areas with bridges on the route.
Extra information

Bootveiling is an independent specialized boat auction house. Our boats are sold under the auction conditions.
The boat was last out of the water 3 years ago for maintenance, Anti-fouling unknown.
Known Defects: Damage at tip and port



Engine, electrics, water
Other: Outboard engine in good condition. Never had any problems with it myself. Including fuel tank of 5 liters.

Rigging
Other: Condition of the sails: sufficient. Excellent condition. Possibility to reef twice.

name: 1931 One Design Deben Cherub1931 One Design Deben Cherub
description:
The Deben Cherub is a small coastal cruiser with a big history.  These delightful classic craft were enthusiastically raced on the River Deben in the 1930s and now, some 90 years later are undergoing a renaissance helped by the craftsmen of the Woodbridge Boatyard, where they were all built.  The design was simple and straightforward and the construction robust and of the seventeen built, six are at Woodbridge and four being restored.  Lindy Lou is Number 6 of the line and having been fully restored is now afloat and ready for the season.  Once owned by the actor John Forbes-Robertson, she represents an economical entry to the classic boat scene.
Viewing by appointment through our Suffolk Office 01473 659 681.Mehr anzeigen

name: 1970 Fisksätra havsfidra1970 Fisksätra havsfidra
description: Furling jib, aluminum boom, sloop rigging, saloon, spirit cooker, toilet manual, echo sounder, speedometer, VHF radio, self-steering system, GPS, awning on the aft deck, battery charger, main circuit breaker, anchor, battery, guard rail, bilge pump, underwater paint, stainless steel pushpit, heating , incl. trailer with brakes, fire extinguisher, upholstery fabric, bow cabin. The Havsfidra is a classic Nordic Koster with Waldeck and Doghouse with 1.65 m headroom. It is a solid cruising boat. The construction of the ship corresponded to the demands and ideas of the 60s and early 70s. At that time, if at all, small ships were sailed with simple equipment. The Havsfidra was intended as a cruising ship for 4 people. In my experience, it offers a crew of 2, possibly with a child, even today there is enough space. The Havsfidra impressively demonstrated its seaworthiness with the participation of two Swedes with their ships in 1968 in the 3rd OSTAR single-handed transatlantic race from Plymouth to Newport under heavy weather conditions. The ship is offered by me together with a 2-axle matching trailer with road approval and TÜV.Show more

name: 1965 top Klasse1965 top Klasse
description:
To Our Pleasure!


General
Other: 
At the end of the 1950s, the North Netherlands Water Sports Association (N.N.W.B.) was of the opinion that there was a need for a new simple, affordable unitary class with centreboard. In 1960 the new sailing boat was recognized by the N.N.W.B. as a unit class, but recognition by the K.N.W.V. only followed in 1980. In the sixties the sailboat is mainly to be found in Friesland; in 1962 there were already a hundred ships sailing there. Later also on the Schildmeer and the Veluwemeer. Competitions for the top class are organized during the Sneekweek.

Rig and sails
Jib: 5,5 m2

name: 2022 TES Yacht 550 Master2022 TES Yacht 550 Master
description: The new yacht to order. The Tes 550 is a 5.5 meter yacht perfect for a crew of 4 people. The height in the cabin is up to 1.72 m. In this small unit there is a separate sanitary cabin, a spacious mess for such a small unit and a small galley. Two double berths are located in the bow / central part of the yacht and aft. Sailing comfort offers a spacious, enclosed elliptical cockpit. The rigging of the 7/8 model allows for independent sailing, including laying the mast, as all waves lead to the cockpit. Access to the onboard equipment needed for free and safe sailing is very easy. TES Master is a fast and safe yacht (self rising and unsinkable) that can be towed behind a small passenger car. It has the P20 certification, which allows swimming at a distance of no more than 20 nautical miles from the shore, and the CE certificate from Germanischer Lloyd.
